loans.name: Yadira Isabel

texts.es:
Yadira una mujer que se desempeña como vendedora de servicios, su campo de acción es lo videojuegos, dándoles una alternativa de entretenimiento a niños, jóvenes y adultos, creando un ambiente sano y libre de bandas callejeras que son tan frecuentes en la zona.
Su negocio es un poco difícil pues constantemente están saliendo consolas nuevas y sus clientes piden lo último en tendencia lo que pasa es que no posee capital para actualizarse.
Yadira muy consciente del problema y entendiendo a sus clientes solicita un crédito para comprar una consola Xbox, un playstation y dos televisores.
La ayuda del crédito podrá satisfacer a sus clientes y atraer nuevas personas con sus nuevas máquinas.
texts.en:
Yadira, is a woman who works selling services; her field of action is videogames, giving children, young people, and adults an entertainment option, creating healthy environment free from street gangs who are so common in the zone.

Her business is a bit difficult since new consoles are constantly being released and her customers ask for the latest. Typically, what happens is she doesn't have the capital to update herself.

Yadira, very aware of the problem and understanding her customers, asks for a loan to purchase an Xbox console, a PlayStation and two televisions.  The loan's help will be able to satisfy her customers and attract new people with her new machines.

loans.use: to purchase a PlayStation and an Xbox; her reason is that videogames update constantly and she should be on the forefront.

loans.name: Carlos Noe

texts.es:
El señor Carlos tiene 30 años de edad vive con su compañera de hogar,  su actividad principal  es la venta de ropa nueva y americana cuenta con más de 2 año de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad, tiene una buena clientela ya que su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico de alto comercio.
Don Carlos está muy agradecido con la institución ya que con el crédito anterior fue de mucho provecho, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra demás productos como faldas, vestidos, camisas, pantalones, blusas, etc. y así tener un muy buen surtido para satisfacer la demanda de su clientela que esta temporada navideña es más alta.
Don Carlos espera cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros, su sueños es mejorar las condiciones de vida.

Trojes, Honduras - Noviembre 2014
texts.en:
Carlos is 30 years old and lives with his spouse.  His primary work is selling new and American clothing, and he has more than 2 years of experience in this type of work. He has a good customer base since his business is located in a very strategic location with a lot of business.

Carlos is very grateful to the institution since the previous loan was very welcome. He is asking for the loan to purchase other products such as skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, blouses, etc. and in this way have a good assortment to satisfy his customers' demand which in the Christmas season is the highest.

Carlos hopes to cover the family expenses and financial obligations. His dream is to improve his living expenses. 

Trojes, Honduras - November 2014

loans.use: to purchase skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, blouses, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Elcy Marina

texts.es:
Del campo a la ciudad, es la frase que caracteriza a la señora Elcy quien tiene su venta de huevos y cría y venta de pollos y gallinas, una actividad que aprendió del campo y que llevo consigo toda la vida.
Su actividad es poco común en el sector convirtiéndose en la única que ofrece gallinas criollas, que son las alimentadas con maíz.
Solicita un crédito para la  reconstruir el galpón que para personas que no conocen el termino es la casa donde duermen las gallinas o tienen huevos, y comprar gallinas.
Apoya a esta empresaria que aunque vino a la ciudad no olvida sus raíces del campo.
texts.en:
From the countryside to the city is a phrase that characterizes Elcy who sells eggs and raises and sells chickens and hens, work that she learned in the country and brought with her her whole life.

Her work is uncommon in the area, making her the only one who sells creole hens, which are those fed with corn.

She asks for a loan to rebuild the coop which, for people who don't know the term, is the house where the chickens sleep or lay their eggs, and to purchase hens. 

Help this businesswoman who, although she came to the city, doesn't forget her country roots.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and repair her coop to continue with this noble profession.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Amelia tiene 57 años de edad, vive con su esposo, su actividad principal es la venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar y también se dedica a la caficultura, cuenta con más de 20 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad tiene una buena clientela siendo estos personas de la misma aldea y comunidades aledañas, su negocio está ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico de alto comercio.
Doña Amelia esta solicitado el préstamo para la compra de huevos, queso, arroz, azúcar, café, pan, harina, etc. Para surtir más su negocio, con lo que espera mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos.
Doña Amelia su sueño es tener bien surtido su negocio permitiéndole tener mayor clientela lo que le generaría mejorar sus ingresos  y mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia.

 Trojes, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014
texts.en:
Amelia is 57 years old, lives with her husband, and her primary work is selling basic pantry items and also she works growing coffee. She has more than 20 years of experience in this type of work and has a good customer base of people from the same town and neighboring communities. Her business is located in a very strategic location with a lot of business. 

Amelia is asking for this loan to purchase eggs, cheese, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, flour, etc. to stock her business more. With this, she hopes to increase her income to cover family expenses and obligations.

Amelia's dream is to have a better assortment in her business, allowing her to have more customers which would generate more income, and improve her living conditions and those of her family. 

 Trojes, Honduras - November 2014

loans.use: to purchase eggs, cheese, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, flour, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Evelyn Elena

texts.es:
Evelyn tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Guaranda provincia de Bolivar.

Solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia para incrementar el negocio de ropa ya que tiene poco mercaderia por que es ropa de catalogo y necesita mantener a su hijito y a sus padres por que son de edad, es la unica actividad que realiza por que no estudio. Las compras realiza cada 15 dias. Su sueño es ponerse un almacen en guaranda de ropa, y su pasatiempo es jugar con su hijito.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 23 years old, single, and has a 2-year-old son. She lives with her parents in the city of Guaranda, in Bolivar province.

She asks for this loan to purchase merchandise to increase her clothing business since she has little merchandise because it is clothing from a catalog and she needs to care for her son and her parents because they are older. It is the only work she does because she didn't go to school. She makes her purchases every two weeks. Her dream is to open a clothing shop in Guaranda, and in her free time she plays with her son.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Godlove

texts.en:
Godlove is not married. He lives with his parent in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced some difficulties in life including sickness, inadequate capital to expand the business, the death of his father, hardship and poverty.

With this new loan requested, he will buy rice, garri, corn, beans, fertilizers, palm nuts, and a grinding machine. This will actively help the community by providing basic needs at low prices with reduced transport cost. He believes that this business will succeed because he has customers around the community and at large and they will buy in bulk because of its strategic location, coupled with the fact that it is beside a school.

With the profit from the loan, he will expand the business and sell building materials and electrical materials. This will enable him to provide good medication for his parent. 

He prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the training offered to members before loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy rice, garri, corn, sweets, biscuits, beans, fertilizers, palm nuts, and a grinding machine.

loans.name: Elvis Jhonatan

texts.es:
Elvis tiene 21 años de edad es soltero vive en el cantón Echeandia provincia de Bolivar con sus padres y su hijo de 1 año, pertenece a la ventanilla rural Cooperativa Mujeres Emprendedoras. 
El se dedica a la cria de cerdos y a la agricultura, solicita el credito para la compra de cerdos para engordarles y luego venderles y poner incrementar el negocio.
Realiza las compras en guaranda cada mes, Su sueño es tener su casa propia y cumplir sus metas. En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar futboll.
texts.en:
Elvis, 21, is single.  He lives in Echeandia Canton in the province of Bolívar with his parents and his son, 1.  He belongs to Cooperativa Mujeres Emprendedoras Communal Bank.

Elvis earns a living raising pigs and farming, and makes his purchases monthly in Guaranda.  He's requesting the loan to buy pigs to fatten and then sell so he can expand his business.

His dream is to have his own house and achieve more goals.  Elvis likes to play soccer in his free time.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a widow with six children. They live in a six-bed-room apartment in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced some problems in life including sickness, death and lack of money for education.

With this new loan requested, she will buy more piglets and feed and repair her pig fence, buy seeds and fertilizer, and also she will sell smoked meat and garri (a couscous-like grain made of cassava flakes) and pay for the rent of market space. The community will benefit in that they will have food at low prices and manure from the pigs.
 
With the profit from the loan, she will pay for her children's education and provide good medication for her family. 

She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the training offered to members before loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy piglets, feed, and seeds, pay for cleaning of the farm, buy food like garri and pay for market space.

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en:
Zebo comes from Tajikistan. She is a very industrious woman. 

Zebo lives and works in the capital of Tajikistan. She has worked for three years in a private organization as an accountant. She is a smart woman and so she does her job well. 

Zebo has a daughter who is 17 years old and she studies at the International School. Zebo’s daughter studies well and she tries to get good knowledge. Zebo must pay for her daughter’s education, but her salary is small and she is not able to pay for her daughter's annual school fee. Zebo is asking for a loan of 4,000 USD with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition of her daughter.

loans.name: Reyna Rosibel

texts.es: Reyna de 19 años de edad que se gana la vida elaborando y vendiendo tamales de gallina, además posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad que desea ampliar. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar de 6 personas. Reyna se siente feliz con sus negocios, pero desea invertir en más productos para la tienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: queso, crema, requesón, salchichas, jamón, etc. Para poder ofrecer otra variedad de productos en su tienda.
texts.en:
Reyna, 19, lives in her own home with her family, made up of six people.  She earns a living making and selling chicken tamales.  She also has a store where she sells staple products that she wants to expand.

Reyna's happy with her businesses, but she wants to invest in more products for her store.  She's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in cheese, cream, cottage cheese, sausages, jam, etc., so she has more product variety in her store.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, cottage cheese, sausages, jam, and other products

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Juan vive en una comunidad de Trojes al Oriente de Honduras es casado y es padre de un hijo el cual depende de el. Su fuente principal es el  cultivo de granos básicos como ser maíz y frijoles.
Don Juan está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de insumos como insecticidas, herbicidas, etc. para sus cultivos, espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante en su negocio y poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
Don Juan uno de sus sueños es tener una buena producción.   

Trojes, Honduras – Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Juan lives in a community in Trojes, in eastern Honduras.  He's married and the father of one dependent son.  His main source of income is growing basic staples such as corn and beans.

Juan's requesting the loan to buy insecticides, herbicides, and other supplies for his crops.  He hopes this investment will allow him to make progress with his business and be able to keep supporting his family.

One of Juan's dreams is to have a good crop.

Trojes, Honduras, November 2014

loans.use: to buy insecticide, herbicide, and other supplies for his business

loans.name: Amour Divin Group

texts.fr: Nkoba est commerçante, membre du groupe  de crédits «Amour Divin», client de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un maçon, âgée de 50 ans, mère 6 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des divers produits manufacturés dans un magasin de la ville depuis 8 ans. Elle va acheter  des biscuits, piles, riz, savon Omo,  huiles, sucre, etc. Elle  souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Nkoba is a retailer, a member of the "amour Divin" loan group and a client of the MFI Hekima. She is married to a bricklayer, 50 years old and the mother of 6 children who all attend school. She started her business with funds she got from her husband. She has been selling various manufactured goods in a shop in town for 8 years. She is going to buy products including biscuits, batteries, rice, soap, Omo washing powder, oils, and sugar. She would like to increase her capital and ensure that her children are fed and educated. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for its support of non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, batteries, rice, soap, Omo washing powder, oils, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.en:
Hipolita is 61 years old, married, and has two children. With one child in school, Hipolita works very hard to provide for them.

Hipolita runs a general store in the Philippines and she has been in this business for 10 years. 

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, rice, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Hipolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, rice, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Zhamila

texts.ru: Жамила, 48 лет, замужем, 2 детей. У Жамилы среднее образование, она много лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Жамилы на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 15 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль Жамилы составляет около 14,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Жамила планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, также хочет купить автомобиль для сына.
texts.en: Zhamila is 48 years old, married and has two children. Zhamila has a secondary education. She has been practicing livestock breeding for many years. Thanks to Zhamila's hard work, she currently has 4 cows and 15 sheep on her farm. Her average monthly income is 14,500 (KGS). For the further development of her business, Zhamila turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to buy bull-calves. Zhamila plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business. She also wants to buy a car for her son.

loans.use: to purchase bull-calves for fattening up and reselling.

loans.name: Jacqueline Margot

texts.es:
Jacqueline es casada y tiene un hijo de 14 años quien aún se encuentra en el colegio. Su madre fue quien la motivó a vender pescados y actualmente con su trabajo logró comprar un puesto ubicado en un mercado en donde vende todos los días y su anhelo es darle educación superior a su hijo. El préstamo será invertido en materiales de construcción para mejorar la infraestructura de su puesto. Así mismo para comprar más pescados para su  venta diaria.  
Jacqueline está muy contenta por haber recibido  el apoyo brindado de los inversionistas kiva.
texts.en: Jacqueline is married and has a 14 year old son who is still studying in school. It was her mother who motivated her to sell fish and now she has managed to buy a stall in a market where she sells every day. Her dream is to provide higher education for her son. The loan will be used to buy construction material to improve the infrastructure of her stall. And she can also buy more fish for her daily sales. Jacqueline is very pleased to have received the support of the lenders at Kiva.

loans.use: to buy construction material and fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more men’s and women’s clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Lilyn

texts.en:
Lilyn has mastered her skills in making bread. She has her own unique bread recipe and she is known for her homemade sweet bread. This has kept her business going for more than five years now. 

Recently, Lilyn requested a loan to buy more kilos of flour, sugar and margarine for bread production. Lilyn hopes to expand her business by displaying her products in more store outlets.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and margarine for bread production.

loans.name: Turdialy

texts.en:
Turdialy is 34 years old. He lives in a small village of North Tajikistan with his wife and four children.
  
The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have milking cows. They sell milk at local markets. Besides, they have two hectares of agricultural land where he grows potatoes. Turdialy sells potatoes in a local market. The profit is hardly enough to provide food for the family. 

He wants to develop his business but he has not money to buy more cattle. This loan will help him to increase the number of cattle and from the profit, to improve his living condition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy more cattle.

loans.name: Ep2 Birema Group

texts.fr: Binane est un commerçant qui s’entraide avec à sa femme dans son activité, membre d’un groupe solidaire «EP2 Birema», âgé de 37 ans, père de 5 enfants dont 3 étudient et 2 sont gosses. Il est vendeur divers matériels de construction à son domicile dans une avenue animée. Il sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Il va acheter des ferres à bétons, clous, tôles, etc. Ainsi, il souhaite scolariser, vêtir  et  nourrir ses enfants. Il remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Binana is a retailer who works with his wife and is a member of the "EP2 Birema" loan group. He is married, 37 years old and the father of 5 children, 3 of whom attend school and 2 of whom are still very young. He sells various construction materials from his home on a busy street. He is requesting a loan from Hekima in order to be able to increase his business activities. He will buy material like iron girders, nails and sheet metal. He would like to ensure that his children are clothed and fed, and that they get an education. He thanks Hekima for its support of small entrepreneurs who are excluded from the classic banking system.

loans.use: to buy iron girders, nails, sheet metal etc.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 57 years old, married and a resident of New Dapitan, Rizal, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have seven children, of whom two are in school. 

Starting with capitalization of 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member in April, 2011, and has taken out three loans. 

Now she is applying for 14,900 PHP to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy stocks of basic commodities.

loans.name: Ep Kibumba Group

texts.fr: Lydie est une femme ambutieuse, commercante, mariée a un enseignant, membre d’un collectif de crédits «EP Kibumba», âgée de 57 ans, mère de 10 enfants dont 5 étudient et 5 n’étudient plus. Elle est vendeuse divers matériaux de construction à son domicile dans une avenue mouvementée. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter des ciments, chaux, ferres a bétons, clous. Ainsi, elle souhaite  scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique
texts.en: Lydie is an ambitious woman who a retailer and married to a teacher. She is a member of the "EP Kibumba" loan group. She is 57 years old and the mother of 10 children, 5 of whom attend school and five of whom have already left. She sells various construction materials from her home on a busy road. She is requesting a loan from Hekima in order to be able to increase her business activities. She will buy material like cement, lime, iron girders and nails. She would like to ensure that her children are clothed and fed, and that they get an education. She thanks Hekima for the support it gives to small entrepreneurs who are excluded from the classic banking system.

loans.use: to buy cement, lime, iron girders, nails etc.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia madre de 2 hijos varones ya mayores de edad, actualmente separada de su esposo y con una problemática de inseguridad en su sitio de trabajo, se dedica a prestar servicios de manicurista, todo lo que tiene es ese balde con sus implementos en verdad un negocio muy informal  y su idea es llevarlo a algo mejor.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de una silla de manicura, mostrador e insumos en cantidades y variedades.
Con la ayuda de este crédito podrá tener su negocio en casa y amortiguar un poco los gastos de transportes y las vacunas que bandas delincuenciales le cobran. (vacuna: cuota que cobra bandas delincuenciales para dejar trabajar tranquilamente a un comerciante en determinado barrio)
texts.en:
Eugenia is mother of two boys of legal age. She is currently separated from her husband and is going through a period of job uncertainty. She is a manicurist and all she has is a pail with her tools. It really is an informal business and her idea is to improve it.

She is requesting a loan to buy a manicure chair, a counter and different supplies. 

With the help of this loan she will be able to have her business at her place of residence and save a little with the expenses of transportation and the fees that delinquent gangs charge to people with businesses to let them work in peace.

loans.use: to buy a manicure chair, a counter and different supplies for manicure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, reeds, and other items.

loans.name: Mahpurat

texts.ru: Махпурат, 41 год, замужем, мать 3 детей. Махпурат в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается сельским хозяйством. Стартовав почти с нуля, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Махпурат есть 2 коровы и 10 овец. На участке мерою 1,0 Га растет картофель, арбузы, перец, кукуруза. Ежемесячная прибыль- около 20,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Махпурат планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Mahpurat is 41 years old, married and a mother to three children. As the main source of income for her family, Mahpurat practices farming. Starting out with almost nothing, Mahpurat currently has 2 cows and 10 sheep on her farm. On a 1.0 hectare plot of land, she grows potatoes, watermelons, peppers and corn. Her average monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her business, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to buy a cattle. Mahpurat plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cattle.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old, married, and has nine children. Out of the nine children, five are still attending school. She lives in Dulag, Leye.

Maria earns a living by operating a motorcycle transport service. She operates a habal-habal (a two-wheeled vehicle that can carry more than two passengers. It is used especially in remote villages with rough and narrow roads). In addition to that, Maria also engages in  farming. She grows and sells rice.

Maria is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to pay for motorcycle parts and maintenance like nuts, bolts, tires and an oil change as well as farm supplies like fertilizers. This will help improve her business and create a hassle-free ride for her customers. In this way, she could gain higher earnings and afford to buy a healthy diet for the whole famliy,

Maria dreams of expanding her business to make it successful and improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle parts and maintenance as well as farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from fish vending. 

Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials to use for her fishing business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

loans.name: Teresa Del Socorro

texts.es: Teresa está separada de su esposo, ella vive sola ya que sus 2 hijos ya son mayores de edad e independientes, Teresa tiene 53 años de edad, ella se dedica a desde que era muy joven a la crianza de animales menores y también trabaja al jornal, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, y ella aspira de este negocio incrementarlo y comprar mas chanchos y a futuro venderlos y después comprar una vaca para mejorar sus ingresos ya que ella es una mujer sola y tiene que cubrir todos sus gastos básicos.
texts.en: Teresa is separated from her husband. She lives alone as her two children are adults and independent. Teresa is 53 years old. She has worked since she was quite young raising small animals and she also works as day labor. She will invest the loan in buying pigs. She hopes to expand her business buying pigs and selling them in the future. Then she can buy a cow to improve her income as she is a single woman and has to cover all the basic expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Marhabat

texts.ru: Эту веселую и жизнерадостную женщину зовут Мархабат. Ей 56 лет. Она находится в статусе замужней женщины. Ее муж предоставляет услуги по перевозке больших грузов на своем грузовике КАМАЗ. Мархабат работает в аптеке в качестве продавца. В свободное от работы время  Мархабат дома занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота. Доход от животноводческой деятельности является основной в семье. Они живут очень скромно и вся их богатство это их скот и работа. В работе муж помогает ей. Мархабат обратилась за кредитом, чтобы расширить деятельность, путем увеличения поголовья скотин. Она чувствует, что ей помогут и она сможет реализовать свой план.
texts.en: This happy and joyful woman's name is Marhabat. She is 56 years old. She is a married woman. Her husband offers services as a large freight transporter in his KAMAZ cargo truck. Marhabat works in a pharmacy as a cashier. In her free time from work, Marhabat raises cattle at her home. The profit from the livestock breeding business is the main income for her family. They live very modestly and they entire wealth is their cattle and their business. Her husband helps her with her work. Marhabat is requesting a loan in order to expand her business by increasing the size of her herd. She feels that she will be assisted and will be able to fulfill her goal.

loans.use: to increase the size of her herd and expand her business.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto de 65 años de edad se dedica a la venta de pan francés y verduras desde hace 9 años de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Roberto vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Roberto, 65 years old, has made a living from the sale of French bread and vegetables for 9 years on foot around the different communities. From what he makes from his sales, he is able to pay some of his home expenses. Roberto lives in his own home with his wife and their two children. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit and vegetables wholesale to continue with his sales and thus make a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo de 44 años de edad se dedica a la venta y cambio de llantas desde hace 30 años su negocio lo tiene y ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, Teofilo vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas llantas por mayor para continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Teofilo is 44 years old and has been working buying and changing tires for 30 years. His business is located at his place of residence and he has lots of clients due to his low prices.Teofilo lives in his own house with his life companion. He is requesting a loan to buy more tires wholesale to continue with his work and to have more income.

loans.use: to buy more tires wholesale.

loans.name: Radha Sss Group

texts.en:
Residing in Chhindwara district of Madhya Pradesh, Memabati is 32 years old and a mother of two children. To support her family, she grows rice as her main source of income, and she sells milk for additional income. She has one cow. She is the only person earning in her family, because her husband is not able to do any work. Also, she can earn more income by goat rearing, and for this, she has requested this loan along with her group.

This is Memabati's first loan cycle with Peoples Forum, and she has committed to repaying her loan on time. She leads this group of 11 members to apply for this loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan to purchase more baby goats to raise and sell in the future. She hopes that she can earn more income to support her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Lucila Amparo

texts.es: Lucila de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un plafón para poder ampliar su casa, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para realizarlo por eso solicita un crédito para compra de cemento, arena, hierro, ladrillos y pago de mano de obra, para que ella y sus hijas puedan vivir más cómodas y seguras
texts.en:
Lucila is 51 years old and lives at her own house along with her two children. She sales crafts and with her earnings she is able to pay some of the household expenses. 

She wants to improve her home by building a drop ceiling in order to expand her house. However, her incomes are not enough to do this, so she is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, iron, bricks and to pay for labor. This way she and her daughters will be more comfortable and secure.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, bricks and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru:
Мадина вместе с мужем являются препринимателями из города Худжанд. В течение 2 лет они ведут свой торговый бизнес в магазине, где занимаются продажей детских игрушек и одежды. И доход с бизнеса является единственным источником дохода этой семьи. Мадина с мужем и 5-летним сыном живет в одном доме со свекровью. Ей 29 лет. В то время пока она с мужем находятся на работе, за их сыном присматривает мать мужа. 
Целью запрашиваемого кредита Мадины является покупка автомобиля мужу для перевозки товара. Этот автомобиль им очень нужен для деятельности, чтобы привозить и отвозить на нем товар. Им не хватает всего 1000 долларов США. Они надеются на этот кредит и с надеждой ждут поддержки.
texts.en:
Madina and her husband are entrepreneurs from the city of Khujand. For the past two years, they have been running a retail business in a store where they sell children's toys and clothing. The income from this business is this family's only source of income. Madina, her husband and their five-year-old son live in one house with her mother-in-law. Madina is 29 years old. While she and her husband are at work, her husband's mother watches their son.

Madina is requesting a loan to buy a car for her husband so that he can transport merchandise. This car is really necessary for their business so that they can bring in and carry out merchandise. They do not have the 1000 USD needed for the car. They rely on this loan and await your support with hope.

loans.use: to buy a car for her husband so that he can transport merchandise.

loans.name: Margarita De Los Santos

texts.es: Margarita es una mujer que cuenta con 52 años de edad demostrando en este tiempo ser una persona emprendedora que cuenta con su propio negocio en el cual comercializa productos alimenticios como: pollo, carne, embutidos, etc., y gracias a ello ha logrado sostener la economía de su hogar. Margarita habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo que es su gran apoyo, desde hace varios años. Margarita desea invertir en más productos para comercializar, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollo, menudos, carne, embutidos, etc. Para seguir de esta manera sosteniendo la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
Margarita is 52 years old. She is showing these days her enterprising ability with her own business of food item sales. She sells chicken, meat, cold cuts, etc., and has been able to support the household economy with this work.

Margarita has lived in her own home for several years with her husband, who is her great support.

She wants to invest in more food products to sell, and decided to request a loan from FUSAI for this purpose. She will use the loan to invest in chicken, giblets, meat, cold cuts, etc., and will be able in this way to keep supporting the home finances.

loans.use: to invest in chicken, giblets, meat, cold cuts, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Gladys

texts.es: Blanca esta casada ella ha vivido desde siempre en el campo y aprendió a que sus ingresos los obtiene de la crianza de ganado y del trabajo en la agricultura, ella tiene 55 años de edad y 3 hijos, Blanca vive con su esposo, una hija y una nieta, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca, la aspiración de Blanca   es  mejorar su negocio y ganarse la vida con su trabajo para darles un buen ejemplo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca is married and has always lived in the field. She learned that her incomes would come from livestock rearing and agriculture. She is 55 years old and has 3 children. 

Blanca lives with her husband, her daughter and a granddaughter. She will use the loan to buy a cow. 

Blanca’s aspiration is to improve her business and make a living with her job so she can set a good example for her children.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Veronica Yamileth

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, la joven vive en casa propia con su hija y su abuela, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman, who has had her face pixelated because she is 27 years old and lives in a high-risk area, owns a store located in her place of residence. She has many customers because of her good prices and the courtesy she shows when she sells. The young woman lives in her own home with her daughter and her grandmother. 

She is requesting a loan to be able to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet bread, etc., and thus be able to make a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Margarita Del Carmen

texts.es: Margarita de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee un pequeño comedor ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada, por eso posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Margarita is 59 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She has a small food stand located near her house in a very busy area so she has lots of clients. She manages to get ahead with what she earns from her work. She is requesting a loan to buy more raw materials like rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc. so she can have a more varied menu and have greater income.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials like rice, chicken. meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Lilian Maribel

texts.es: Lilian de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en:
Lilian, 41 years old, lives in her own home with her life partner and their two children. She makes a living from the sale of clothing on foot in different markets. She has many steady customers because of the quality of the clothing and good prices. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing wholesale and to be able to continue with her sales and thus make a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Trinath Thakur Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
Debaki is 31 years old, and she is married with two children. Debaki works in agriculture, raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Debaki has been involved in this business for more than six years. The main hardship that Debaki faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Debaki, the lady standing with her raised hand wearing a purple colored sari, is the group leader of the Trinath Thakur Shg (A) group, which consists of 10 members. In early 2014, Debaki joined Peoples Forum to improve her business through having a loan from Peoples Forum. 

In the future, Debaki hopes to build a new house, for her children to get admission in a good school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Sayyora

texts.ru: Сайёра 46 летняя жительница не большого городка Исфара. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж находится за приделами страны на заработках. Ее дочка дома принимает заказы на шитье женской одежды, на шитье штор и занавесок. Сайёра работает учительницей в средней школе города Исфары. Она любит свою работу, любит заниматься воспитанием детей. Но сейчас у семьи такое положение, что Сайёра должна помогать дочке в ее работе, чтобы увеличить доход и покрыть расходы семьи. Все свободное время от работы, она будет проводить рядом с дочкой за швейной машинкой. Причина обращения Сайёры за кредитом является нехватка денег на приобретения швейной машинки. Она надеется получить кредит и приступить к работе.
texts.en: Sayyora is a 46-year-old resident of the small town of Isfara. She is married and three children. Her husband is working abroad. Her daughter takes orders for sewing custom women's clothing, drapes and curtains from their home. Sayyora works as a teacher in a secondary school in Isfara. She loves her job and loves raising children. However, her family is currently in such a situation that Sayyora has to help her daughter with her work so that they can increase their income and cover all of the family's expenses. All of her free time from her teaching work she needs to spend with her daughter at the sewing machine. Sayyora is taking out a loan because she does not have enough money to buy a sewing machine. She hopes to receive a loan and begin working.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and help her daughter with her work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Meera Shg Group

texts.en:
The Meera Self Help Group is in its first loan cycle, with 10 members. The group is made up of a club of friends and neighbors from a small village of Koraput district in Odisha. The members constitute a well-knit group, with a strong commitment to work together and mutually support one another. 

Jayanti is one of the members of this group. She is very proactive, and her business is selling fruits and vegetables. She sells different types of fresh fruits and vegetables at a nearby city market, and is a cheerful person whose charisma helps her to have many clients in her area of the city. 

She is requesting this loan to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk for reselling. She thanks everyone for the opportunity to grow that she is being offered.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk for reselling

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is age 37; she is a mother of five children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages to cover his household necessities from his own store. His relatives also like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. 

Due to his behavior and tone, Tahira's husband has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well. Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Tahira requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. 

Tahira hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the needs of her family. Tahira thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's general store

loans.name: Santoshi Maa Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
Usharani represents the Santoshi Maa Shg (A) group. She is doing well, as are the other members. Married, she is the mother of three children — the eldest is 14; the youngest is 8 years old; and the third one is 12 years old. All of them attend school. She has five dependents in total.

She has sold grocery items for 10 years, and has added the sale of cold drinks. She buys her goods in a market near her. She wants to buy a fridge to keep cold drinks for sale. She wants to put her profits into savings, and her ambition is to buy a plot of land and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a fridge to keep cold drinks for sale

loans.name: Katty Mabel

texts.es:
Katty tiene 24 años, casada con una hija menor de 3 años. Katty trabaja en un centro educativo particular enseñando a niños pequeños su sueño siempre fue ser profesora. Actualmente con sus ingresos apoya a su esposo para los gastos que requiere su familia; pues su sueño es tener su propio centro educativo donde siga brindando este servicio de enseñanza especialmente a niños. El crédito será invertido para comprar material de construcción para mejorar su vivienda con el propósito de darles mayor comodidad a los niños que les da clases de reforzamiento por las tardes.
Agradece a los inversionistas kiva por el apoyo brindado, lo cual se siente muy contenta.
texts.en:
Katty is 24 years old, married and has a three-year-old daughter. Katty works as a teacher at a private school; this was always her dream job. Katty uses her income to support her husband with family expenses. Katty now dreams of owning her own school where she can continue to teach children. 

This loan will be used to buy building materials to make Katty's home more comfortable for the children to whom she gives extra classes in the afternoon.

Katty is grateful to Kiva investors for this support; she is very happy with it.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 30-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. 

Shahida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's shoe manufacturing business. He is a shoe maker and very expert in his trade. He has been manufacturing shoes for many years. This is the reason he has a lot of experience in his trade. He sews shoes made of leather and Rexene on a sewing machine. After that, the shoe is attached to its sole through stitching by hands. In this way he generates income for his family. 

He has been making shoes at home, but now he has established a shop to continue his business on a wide level. But he does not have the necessary amount to buy initial raw material for making shoes.

Therefore, Shahida has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy initial raw material for making shoes.

loans.use: to buy initial raw material for shoe making.

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en:
Mariyam is a 45-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession who drives a rickshaw in Lahore city, which is very populated area. He recently got into a road accident: when he was looking for a passenger by standing beside the road, a speeding car collapsed into the rickshaw from behind. Mariyam’s husband did not get any fractures but the rickshaw has gotten seriously damaged and needs fixing. Her husband does not have enough money to fix his auto rickshaw.

Mariyam is requesting a loan from the Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan to cover the repair costs for her husband’s rickshaw. She is very thankful to Kiva and the field partner BRAC Pakistan for this support.

loans.use: to cover the repair cost for her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Dienaba's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement   est mis en place depuis le 31 Octobre  2006 jour de son inauguration. Les femmes qui le composent sont toutes issues du même village, elles ont également des liens de parentés de sang ou par alliance. Elles sont très solidaires les unes des autres et mènent des activités principalement dans le petit commerce. 

Madame Diénaba (debout à l’extrême  droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de 5 enfants dont (04 filles 01 garçon) âgés entre 2 et 22ans. Elle s’active dans la vente de produit de la cueillette plus particulièrement l’huile de palme qu’elle achète par bidon pour la revente par litre.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter au moins 06 bidons de 20litres pour la revente au détail par litre.

Elle utilise les bénéfices pour appuyer son mari dans la gestion des frais scolaires des enfants et améliorer la nourriture familiale.
texts.en:
This group was established 31 October 2006 during the inauguration. The women in the group are all from the same village and share family ties or ties of allegiance. They are very supportive of each other and work mainly in small-scale commerce.

Diénaba (who is standing on the far right with her hand raised [in the photo]) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and a mother of five children (four girls and one boy), who are aged from two to 22 years old.

Diénaba works selling harvested products, particularly palm oil that she buys by the drum and resells by the liter. With this new loan, she plans to buy at least six 20-liter drums [of oil], which she will resell at retail by the liter. 

She uses her earnings to support her husband with their children's school fees and to improve the family's diet.

loans.use: to buy at least six 20-liter drums of oil

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is the age of 33, a mother of four children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession and he offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of the vegetables. 

So, Jameela applied for loan so her husband would be able to buy more vegetables for selling.

Jameela is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetables for her husband's shop

loans.name: Maa Gajalaxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
P. Amulu, 46, is from a very poor family. She is married and has two children: a girl and a boy. She lives with her husband and her kids, along with her parents-in-law, in a small traditional house in a remote village where people mostly work at agricultural production for a living. P. Amulu's family is not an exception. Indeed, they cultivate rice, vegetables and maize, and breed goats and chickens. With her experience in agriculture, P. Amulu was confident enough to take out her first loan from the Peoples Forum. She will use it to buy young goats.

P. Amulu hopes that her investment will go well so that she can better support her family, especially her children. She dreams her children will have a more abundant life, study well and have good jobs. In the picture, she is seated with her hand raised. 

The other members of this "Maa Gajalaxmi SHG" group are engaged in different activities.

loans.use: to buy young goats.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a young lady of the age of 47 years. She is a housewife, and looks after her family which consists of seven persons. Her husband owns a sanitary items shop. He has been running the sanitary items shop for the last three years. He sells variety of sanitary items like pvc pipes, wash basins, bracket pair for wash basin, lead (solid), looking glass, etc. in his shop. 

He require some amount to enhance his business. So Bushra made contact to Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan. BRAC staff visited her husband's sanitary shop and issued the loan. 

Bushra is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's sanitary shop

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 49-year-old lady who is very poor and needy. Her husband provides sheltering services to generate income to feed his entire family. Musarat’s husband has been doing this business for many years and has been using wooden planks and bamboo, which have been depreciating over time. He is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboo. 

Musarat is requesting a loan so that her husband can buy new wooden, smooth boards and bamboo to continue his business. She hopes that her loan will bring positive changes in her life and that her husband will earn maximum profit with the help of this loan. Musarat is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner because they empower her husband to buy new sheltering material.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's sheltering work

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is the age of 44, a mother of three children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of the vegetables. 

So, Shamim applied for loan so that her husband would be able to buy more vegetables for selling.

Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetables for her husband's shop

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Mrs. Thanh is 46 years old, married and lives with her two children.  She has been working in fish business for more than 20 years. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the living condition and health for her family, especially her children and also contribute to environment protection.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Tu

texts.en: Mrs. Tu is a hardworking woman. She is married and has three children. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry. With more than 10 years experience and has support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Hoan

texts.en: Mrs. Hoan is a farmer, 35 years old and married. She has three  under 18 year’s old children. She would like to improve her living standard, especially her children but lack of capital. The loan can help her to build a hygienic latrine. Farming is main income source of her family and she is able to pay the loan monthly from chicken raising activity.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is not married with six children, and they all live in a three-bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which include inadequate finances to educate her children, sickness, accidents and the death of family members.
 
With the new loan requested, she will buy a motorbike and pay for the papers, fertilizers, and clearing of her farm. She says her business will succeed because she lives in a community that is suffering from inadequate poultry farms, she has experience in her provision store, it has a strategic location and demand is high. From this activity, the community will benefit from a regular supply of chicks at moderate prices. Secondly, the waste from the fowls will be used as manure to boast yields.

With the profit from the loan, she will ensure the intake of a balanced diet by her family, save money for a bigger investment, and provide adequate medication for her family. She prefers the GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, the repayment duration, and the encouragement and training of  members before the disbursement of the Empowerment credit.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike and pay for documents, fertilizers and the clearing of the farm.

loans.name: Sanatan

texts.en:
Sanatan is a 21-year-old young man living in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, to pursue his banking and insurance course. He is studying for a diploma in banking and insurance, and is now in his starting month. Sanatan 's future plan is to work in the same field. He is a very hardworking student. He gives 8 to 10 hours for his studies.

Income for his family of four comes from his father's job. Lack of income and some potential financial problems that they have lead Sanatan to apply for an educational loan to help cover his course fees.

loans.use: to pay for his banking and insurance course fees.

loans.name: Merdi Group

texts.fr: Masimizi b. est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire Merdi, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un commerçant, âgée de 25 ans, mère de 3 enfants dont 2 scolarisés et 1 est gosse. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu  de ses parents. Elle est vendeuse de divers habillements depuis 5 ans dans un magasin de la place. Elle va acheter des vestes, pagnes, pantalons, chemises, souliers, jupes, sous vêtements, Singlin. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Masimizi is a retailer, a member of the Merdi community bank and a customer of the MFI Hekima. She is married to a retailer, 25 years old and the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom attend school, one of whom is still very young. She started her business with funds she received from her parents. She has been selling clothing for 5 years in a local shop. She is going to buy jackets, pagnes (highly decorative West African dress), trousers, shirts, shoes, skirts and Singlin underwear. She would like to increase her credit and to ensure that her children are fed and educated. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support it gives to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy jackets, pagnes, trousers, shirts, shoes, skirts and Singlin underwear.

loans.name: Vuruka Group

texts.fr: Marhegane est commerçante, conseillère d'un groupe solidaire Vuruka, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un chauffeur, âgée de 50 ans, mère de 9 enfants scolarisés. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un magasin de la ville. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse de divers habillements depuis 10 ans. Elle va acheter des robes, pagnes, pantalons, chemises, jupes. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Marhegane is a retailer, an adviser to the Vuruka solidarity group and a customer of the MFI Hekima. She is married to a driver, 50 years old and the mother of 9 children who attend school. She displays her merchandise in a shop in town. She started her business with funds she received from her husband. She has been selling clothing for 10 years. She is going to buy dresses, pagnes (highly decorative West African clothing), trousers, shirts and skirts. She would like to increase her credit and ensure that her children are fed and educated. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support it gives to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy dresses, pagnes, trousers, shirts and skirts.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica comes from New Delhi. She is a very industrious woman. 

Monica lives and works in New Delhi, but currently she is living in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, because she recently got admission into the banking and insurance diploma course in Bhubanesawr. She has worked for three years in a private organization as an accountant. She is a smart woman, and so she does her job well. 

Monica must pay for her diploma, but her salary is small, so she was not able to save for her diploma course fee. Monica is asking for a loan of 100,000 INR with this aim. She will get promoted after completion of this course, so she can join in another organization on a higher salary. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for her diploma course fee so she can get promoted after completion of the course.

loans.name: Aarti

texts.en:
Aarti is a 23-year-old single lady who has been working as an accountant in a private bank for the last one year to support her family in covering most of their necessary living needs.

Aarti is a hard worker, with a very good reputation in her region. Most of her neighbors and co-workers talk about her hard work and the efforts she puts in to develop her family's living.

Today, Aarti is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Peoples Forum to pay for her banking and insurance diploma course fee. She says, "This course is very important for me because after completion of this course, I will promoted to assistant manager." 

She hopes that in the future, she can establish her own business and develop her family's living properly.

loans.use: to pay for her banking and insurance diploma course fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the repair cost of her son's marble-grinding machine

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of five. Her husband is a hardworking father who is helping his family by providing tailoring services in his community. He has been doing it for many years. He knows the techniques of stitching very well. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns enough to lead a decent life. He wants to buy two new sewing machines to enhance his business.

Therefore, Razia has requested a loan for her husband so that he can easily buy the sewing machines. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

She gives thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines for her husband's tailoring work.

loans.name: Manassé Group

texts.fr: Hangi est commerçante, présidente de la banque communautaire Manassé, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 44 ans, mère de 8 enfants et tous vont à l’école. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des pagnes au marché du rond point de la ville depuis 13 ans. Elle va acheter 70 pièces de pagnes. Son conjoint est un architecte. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, construire une maison,  scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish,  elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Hangi is a retailer, the president of the Manassé community bank and a customer of the MFI Hekima. She is married, 44 years old and the mother of 8 children who all attend school. She started her business with funds she received from her husband. She has been selling pagnes (highly decorative West African fabric) at the market on the town's roundabout for 13 years. She is going to buy 70 pieces of pagnes. Her spouse is an architect. She would like to get more loans, to build a house and to ensure that her children are educated and fed. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support it gives to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 70 pieces of pagnes.

loans.name: Jiguene Bakhna 90 Group

texts.fr: JIGUENE BAKHNA 90 est un groupement d’intérêt économique qui regroupe 5personnes. Ils habitent dans un même quartier et évoluent toutes dans la commercialisation des fruits et légumes sur la route nationale. Sokhna est la présidente. On la reconnait par la main qu’elle a levée sur la photo. Elle demande ce montant pour acheter et vendre des fruits et légumes. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5ans et commence sa journée à 7h pour la finir à 20h. Elle voudrait avec l’aide de l’institution augmenter son stock de marchandises et diversifier ses produits. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent afin de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Jiguene Bakhna 90 Group is a group with economic interests and is made up of five people. They live in the same area and all work in the selling of fruits and vegetables along the national highway.

Sokhna is the president and has her hand raised in the photo. She is seeking a loan for buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She has been doing this work for more than five years. She starts her day at 7:00 a.m. and finishes at 8:00 p.m.

Sokhna is married and a mother of a family. She helps her husband to cover their family's everyday expenses.

She would like to, with the help of the institution, increase her stock and diversify her products. She would like to be able to increase her revenues and save money in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Jiguene Bakhna 72 Group

texts.fr: JIGUENE BAKHNA 72 est un groupement d’intérêt économique qui regroupe 5 personnes. Elles habitent dans le même quartier et font parti du même GIE. Elles pratiquent la même activité.  La présidente s’appelle Ndèye Aminata qui est reconnue par la main levée sur la photo. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des fruits et légumes et a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans cette activité. Etant à son 5ème prêt, elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des fruits et légumes. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 20h. Elle voudrait à l’avenir augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent et devenir pérenne.
texts.en:
The Jiguene Bakhna 72 group has economic interests and is made up of five people. The group members all live in the same area and are a part of the same GIE [Economic Interest Group]. They also work in the same business.

The president of the group is named Ndèye Aminata. Her hand is raised in the photo. She has worked selling fruits and vegetables for more than five years. She starts her day at 7:00 a.m. and finishes at 8:00 p.m. 

This is her fifth loan and is seeking an amount to buy and sell fruits and vegetables.

She helps her husband to cover their everyday expenses and their children's school fees. In the future, she would like to increase her revenue and save money. She'd also like to become self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Koba, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de chaussure, de gâteau et d’articles divers.
Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente ROKIA, deuxième personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de divers fruits. Elle compte acheter des corbeilles de papayes et bananes chez les grossistes à Massigui.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The DANAYA group is made up of married women who are, on average, 36 years old with two children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Koba, Cercle of Dioïla, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They sell grains, condiments, shoes, cakes and other various items.  They are on their second solidarity loan. They have turned to Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the very high demand from their customers.

The group's featured borrower, Rokia (second from the right in the standing row), is illiterate and is currently selling fruits. She is planning to buy papayas and bananas from wholesalers in Massigui. She sells her merchandise on a retail basis, from home and at the market, to both men and women. She gets paid in cash. She is expecting to make a monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy papayas and bananas for her fruit stall

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Fotemogoban de l'association Danaya sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Niomirambougou dans le district de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Niomirambougou. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de condiments (pâte d’arachide) d’ustensiles de cuisine (tasses, pot,…), du charbon de bois, des produits d’artisanat (encensoirs, canaris,…), des produits de la pharmacopée, du riz, des vêtements de toutes les qualités : pagnes wax, brodés et bazins. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Doussouba (femme assise en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la  vente des pâtes d’arachides. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  4 sacs d’arachides en gros à Médine. Pour faire la pâte d’arachide, on trie les meilleurs grains, les grille, les épluches et les Broie au moulin. La pâte ainsi faite est prête à la vente en détails à une  clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Doussouba espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de ses enfants.
texts.en:
There are five women in the Fotemogoban Group, most of whom are married and living in monogamous households. On average, they are 45 years old and have five children. They all live in the Niomirambougou neighborhood in Bamako and know each other through being neighbors and working together at a local market.

The group members run small businesses selling condiments (groundnut paste), kitchen equipment (cups, pots, etc.), charcoal, craft products (incense burners, canari cooking vessels, etc.), pharmacy products, rice, and clothing of different types, including wax, embroidered and damask cloth pagnes.

In order to gain cash to restock, the group have decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their third solidarity loan.

Doussouba (pictured sitting second from the right) has a good reputation for the groundnut paste she sells. She will use her loan to buy four sacks of groundnuts in bulk in Médine. The groundnut paste is made by selecting the best nuts, grilling them, peeling them and then crushing them in a grinder. It can then be sold to individual customers, usually women.

Doussouba hopes to make 90,000 CFA francs on average per month, which she will reinvest in her business and put towards supporting her children.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and fruit and thus increase her sales and her profits in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Akiba Group

texts.fr:
Saleh fait partie du groupe  Akiba et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 52 ans et est mariée à Mohamed, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 15 à 21 ans, dont  1 étudie. 

Elle est tailleur et fait le commerce des habits  depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à son septième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une voiture, constuire  une maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Saleh is a member of the Akiba group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 52 years old and is married to a Mohamed, a driver. Together they have three children, aged from 15 to 21 years old. One of the children goes to school.

Saleh is a tailor and has worked selling clothes for ten years. 

She is on her seventh loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy a lot of clothing, which she will resell and earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to buy a car, build a house, and see her children study.

loans.use: to buy a lot of clothing to resell

loans.name: 031004010003.thiệu Chính Group

texts.en:
Thanh works in agriculture raising cattle. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. She is 47 years old and married with two children. Thanh is the group leader of the 031004010003.Thiệu Chính solidarity group, which consists of 8 members. She lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Ruvimbo Group

texts.en:
Ruvimbo is a group of four hardworking ladies who are working towards achieving their goals. Margaret is the secretary and pillar of the group who has managed to keep the group together for almost a year now.

Margaret is married, her husband is an electrician at the National Railways of Zimbabwe. She has three children, two of whom are school going. She stays in Rugare, in Harare where she has managed to run a poultry business since 2009.

The training she got from Thrive changed her ideas on the use of money. She could not retain her money in the business and this limited the growth of her business. After she got her first loan, she started keeping a batch of 100 birds at a time. Although her customers are delaying in payments, she has managed to have at least 50 birds at any given time in her fowl run.

With her second loan, Margaret hopes to extend her fowl run and start keeping at least 150 birds at a time to meet the demand for chicken which has grown. Since she is currently staying at her parents’ house, in time, she hopes to buy her own stand and build her own house.

loans.use: to expand her chicken business.

loans.name: Moving Group

texts.en:
Moving is a group of four hardworking ladies with Hadisi as the chairlady. The group was formed due to the women`s drive to improve their standards of living. Hadisi is a 38 year old lady who stays in Dzivarasekwa in Harare. She is married and her husband is a self-employed motor mechanic and they are blessed with three children.

Hadisi is into buying and selling of groceries. She started this business ten years ago, selling the groceries on a stall by her gate. A year ago she had saved enough money to build a cabin that she now uses as a tuck shop. During her walk with Thrive, she has learnt how to keep records and why it is important, so now she keeps a daily record sheet. This helps her keep track of her purchases, sales and stock. She claims that this has greatly improved the efficiency in her buying and selling. 

With her first loan, she stocked larger quantities of groceries for her tuck shop so as to meet demand. With a new Kiva loan, Hadisi hopes to save enough to build a brick-and-mortar tuck shop with enough space and security to keep high stock levels at all times.

loans.use: To expand her tuckshop.

loans.name: Born Again Group

texts.en:
Plaxedes is the chairlady of Born Again group based in Glenorah C, a high density area in Harare. She is a married mother of 4 children and has a grandchild. 

Plaxedes started doing business in the year 2011. She started as a cross border trader buying and selling different items ranging from clothing to kitchen wear. She then decided to add on to her business and started rearing poultry. She started with a batch of 50 chickens at a time and now she does batches of 100. 

She and her group members are appreciative of the group loan availed to them by Thrive Microfinance. The loan will enable her to start keeping constant batches of chickens, so that she always has chickens available for her clients at all times. She used to face challenges of little working capital, making it hard to buy chicks and feed at the same time. She also was not fully meeting the demands of her customers as she would wait for one batch to be finished before starting to rear another. Plaxedes plans to grow both her businesses and work hard so she can be able to buy a residential stand and open a tuckshop.

loans.use: To expand her poultry business to provide constant supply.

loans.name: Big Fish Group

texts.en:
Theresa is the featured borrower for the Big Fish Group. She got together with a couple of friends and formed a group with the aim of improving their home businesses. They appreciated that they needed both financial and business management training support. This is when they approached Thrive Microfinance.

Theresa is a married woman with three school-going dependents. She is a tailor who specializes in sewing uniforms for nearby schools. She has been running this business for the past 5 years. Demand for the uniforms is rapidly increasing beyond her working capital. A Kiva loan will assist in bulk material procurement so that she can meet demand.

She says she has benefited from Thrive’s trainings, especially record keeping and budgeting. Theresa and other group members would like to thank all lenders who contribute to the Kiva program around the world.

loans.use: To expand her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: Maria de 50 años de edad se dedica a la venta de especies (achote, pimienta, orégano, etc.) desde hace varios año de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, Maria vive en casa propia con su madre, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas especies por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old, and has worked selling spices (achiote, pepper, oregano etc) for many years as a street vendor in different neighbourhoods.
