Maria lives in her own house with her mother. She is asking for a credit to buy more spices wholesale to continue with her sales and have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy more spices (achiote, pepper, oregano, etc) wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some crockery and fresh food items for her husband's restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Emomali

texts.en: Emomali is a hardworking student from the southern part of Tajikistan. He is single and lives with his family. Emomali’s major is law. His goal is to graduate and become a professional lawyer. After graduation he is planning to help and work for the community. Emomali is requesting a loan to help pay for his university fees.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Nhóm 06, Đồng Thọ, Vạn Hòa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hạnh works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hạnh is 49 years old, and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 7 member group, the Nhóm 06, Đồng Thọ, Vạn Hòa solidarity group. 

In 2013, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hạnh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hạnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hạnh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hạnh hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Dasiana

texts.en:
Dasiana is 60 years old and a resident of Minlasag, Sibutad, Philippines. She has four children, one of whom is in college. She owns a "sari-sari store" (small grocery store) that forms part of their house, and her neighbors are her clients. 

Since she has a college student to support, she has decided to improve her small business to support their children. So she has requested a loan from Paglaum MPC to buy basic commodities for her sari-sari store. Aside from the financial assistance, she also received add-on benefits like insurance, savings, etc. She hopes that with Paglaum's help, she will become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to buy basic commodities for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 60 years old and has five children. Juana is a married woman.

Juana is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Juana requested a 5,000 PHP  (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Juana has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Deisy Yurley

texts.es:
Deisy es una hermosa flor Colombia de 22 años de edad, que se gana su sustento y el dinero para pagar la matrícula de la universidad gracias a la venta de mercancía para el cuidado de la piel.
Su principal problema para operar es la falta de capital para realizar una mejor campaña de ventas por lo que quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido en crema de manos, productos capilares, talcos, desodorantes, desodorantes corporales, etc.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá tener existencia para vender pues su preocupación pasa por pagar la matricula del otro semestre y aún se encuentra juntando el dinero, ayuda Deisy espera tu apoyo.
texts.en:
Deisy is a beautiful 22 year-old woman from Columbia. She makes a living and obtains the money to pay for her university tuition fees by selling skin care merchandise.  

Her business' main problem is that she lacks the capital to carry out a better sales campaign and for this reason she is asking for a loan to purchase a range of skin care products including: hand cream, hair products, talcum powder, deodorant, personal deodorant, etc. 

With the support of this loan, she will be able to have products in stock to sell, which is important as she is still worried and collecting money to pay her tuition fees from the previous semester. Help Deisy, she is counting on your support.

loans.use: to purchase a range of skin care products to carry on making money to pay for her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Seanghai

texts.en:
A woman living in Kampong Cham province, Seanghai is 34 years old and a mother of one child. Nowadays, she can earn income to support her living conditions via cassava and cashew apple growing to earn extra income. 

For Seanghai, this is her fifth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. She will spend her entire loan portion to rent more land to support her farmland. She hopes that she can earn more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to rent more land to support her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to rent another field and pay laborers for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Jiguene Bakhna 48 Group

texts.fr: JIGUENE BAKHNA 48 est un groupement de femmes qui est composé de 5 personnes. Elles habitent toutes dans le  même quartier et pratiquent la même activité c'est-à-dire la commercialisation des fruits et légumes. Elles ont comme présidente la dame ADAMA. C’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo ; elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des fruits et légumes de l’époque. Elle commence sa journée à 7h pour la finir à 20h. Elle a une expérience de  plus de 5ans dans cette activité et a comme charges particulières les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle voudrait avec l’aide de l’institution diversifier ses produits et être pérenne pour mieux gérer son activité et gagner le monopole du marché. De ce fait elle pourra épargner de l’argent et construire sa maison pour le bien être de ses enfants.
texts.en:
JIGUENE BAKHNA 48 is a group of 5 women. They all live in the same neighbourhood and have the same businesses: selling fruits and vegetables.
Adama is the president. She is pictured raising her hand. She is a married mother. She is requesting a loan to buy and sell seasonal fruits and vegetables. She starts her day at 7 am and finishes at 8 pm.
She has over 5 years' experience in this business and is responsible for her family's daily expenses and her children's school costs.
She would like to, with the help of the institution, diversify her products and have a business that lasts a long time so that she can gain a monopoly on the market. She would then be able to save up money and build a home for her children's well-being.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to re-sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. for her husband's general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her husband's dairy farm.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 41 years old, the mother of three children, living in Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.  For many days now, his rickshaw has not been working properly, which means he is unable to generate any income.  He wants to repair it as soon as possible, but due to the lack of money, finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.  This will help him to continue his business.  Naseem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the repair costs of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Kashif Ali

texts.en:
Kashif Ali is the age of 29. He is living in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a very hardworking and gentle person. He is responsible for his two children and his old parents as well.

Kashif Ali is a milkman by profession, and sells milk in his community. He has been selling milk since 1996; now he is very expert and experienced in his profession. He is very expert at producing milk from a buffalo; he produces milk from his all buffaloes in no time. 

He has many buffaloes; this is the reason he has to do very hard work to feed them. Every day, he takes his herd to the pasture for grazing, gives them a bath in the stream, and he has to stay with them the whole day due to a fear of theft. He has not much time for his family members. 

Kashif Ali wants to get an assistant to look after his cattle, but he does not earn enough profit to afford the salary. 

Kashif Ali is receiving his second loan, and he has been investing his previous loan in the same business. With the help of last loan, he has purchased a buffalo and has benefited from that buffalo. He still wants to establish his business, and wants to buy a buffalo so that he can increase his monthly income, get an assistant, and spend some time with his family. 

Therefore, Kashif Ali has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. Kashif Ali hopes that he would be able to buy a buffalo, and he will be successful in increasing his monthly income, as well. 

Kashif Ali thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milk production.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 40 years old. She is a responsible mother of two children. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of four persons. She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services to the people, at her own house. 

She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Rubina is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested. Rubina is very thankful to Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her own stitching work

loans.name: Jiguene Bakhna Group

texts.fr: JIGUENE BAKHNA 69 fait partie du groupement d’intérêt économique du GIE GFAP. Elle est composée de 5 personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier et font la même activité. L a présidente s’appelle NDEYE, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des fruits de mer et sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des huitres, poissons fumés et séchés ainsi que des crustacés. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans et commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle aide son mari sans la gestion des charges financières de la maison et frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle aimerait diversifier ses produits grâce à l’aide des crédits de l’institution  et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
JIGUENE BAKHNA, age 69, is part of the GIE GFAP communal bank. The group has 5 members who all live in the same neighbourhood and have the same business. The president's name is Ndeye. She is married with children. Her seafood business is evolving. She is requesting a loan to buy and re-sell oysters, smoked fish, dried fish, and crustaceans. She has over 5 years' experience and starts her day at 7 am to finish at 7 pm.
She helps her husband with the household costs and their children's school costs. She would like to diversify her products with the help of loans and to improve her little family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seafood.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Fausta Karolina

texts.es:
La señora Fausta de 34  años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus  hijos  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 11 años al negocio de costura, hace pantalones, camisas, faldas, juego de cortinas, cameras, etc. también hace remiendos, vive en San Lorenzo Valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Fausta es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como 5 rollos de tela de varios estilos, una maquina eléctrica, porque la que tiene ya le está fallando,  con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente muy buena y con deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Doña Fausta su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Noviembre 2014.
texts.en:
Señora Fausta is 34 years old and lives with her husband and their children in their own house. For 11 years, she has worked as a seamstress, making pants, shirts, skirts, sets of curtains, bedsheets, etc. She also performs mending. She lives in the San Lorenzo Valley in the south of Honduras. 

Fausta is an enterprising woman with hopes of getting ahead, and she fights daily to improve her quality of life. She is asking for a loan to buy products, such as 5 rolls of various styles of fabric, and an electric sewing machine as hers is failing. With the support of this loan, she will be able to improve her earnings and also her quality of life. She is a good client, and hopes to continue working with Prisma. 

Fausta's dream is to have a good business and to expand her clientele, at the same time improving her future together with her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en:
Naziran is the age of 38 and is living with her husband. Her husband is a catering services provider at ceremonies; he provides the decoration lights and wedding tents for weddings, birthdays and engagement ceremonies. He does not consider it a profitable business because it is a seasonal business. Now the marriage season is going at peak, but most of his tents have become deteriorated due to lack of usage for a long time. He wants to buy new wedding tents to provide better services to his customers. 

Therefore, Naziran has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new tents and decoration lights to provide the decoration services. 

Naziran thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's catering work with new wedding tents and decoration lights

loans.name: Nhóm 12 Cụm Thạch Bắc 02 Xã Quảng Thạch Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tre has a retail business selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell.

Tre is 57 years old, and she is married with four children. Tre lives in Quang Xuong, a rural town in the province of Thanh Hoa.

Tre is the group leader of Nhóm 12 Cụm Thạch Bắc 02 Xã Quảng Thạch, a solidarity group which consists of four members. 

In 2013, Tre joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tre has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Tre has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tre faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tre hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 06, Thiện Na, Vạn Hòa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sỹ works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Sỹ is 45 years old, and she is married with two children.

Sỹ is the group leader of Nhóm 06, Thiện Na, Vạn Hòa, a solidarity group which consists of four members. In 2012, Sỹ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Sỹ has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Sỹ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Sỹ hopes to maintain a successful business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: 021603040002 Thôn 9 - Hoằng Ngọc Group

texts.en:
Nhược works in agriculture raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Nhược is 52 years old, and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa, a rural district in the province of Thanh Hoa.

Nhược is the group leader of 021603040002 Thôn 9 - Hoằng Ngọc, a solidarity group which consists of three members. 

In 2013, Nhược joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nhược has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Nhược has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nhược hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Ma. Lyn

texts.en: Ma. Lyn is 47 years old and married with 5 children, one of whom is in school. Ma. Lyn works very hard to provide for them by buying and reselling charcoal in the Philippines. She has requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Ma. Lyn has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, Ma. Lyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sarai Margarita

texts.es: Sarai de 29 años de edad tiene un salón de belleza en su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues realiza un buen trabajo, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella vive en casa propia con su esposo, su madre y su hija y solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Sarai, 29, has a beauty salon in her home. She has many clients, since she does a good job. She uses the profits she makes to resolve the needs of her household, where she lives with her husband, her mother, and her daughter. 

She asks for a credit in order to buy beauty salon products such as creams, shampoo, hairpins, scissors, and other things that she needs, and thus she will be able to earn better profits that will help her to have a better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, hairpins, scissors, and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Jiguene Bakhna Group

texts.fr: JIGUENE BAKHNA 89 est un groupement de personnes qui est composé de 5 personnes. Elles habitent toutes dans le même quartier. Elles se sont connues à travers une association et sont sur la même route et vendent pratiquement les mêmes produits c'est-à-dire les fruits et légumes de chaque époque. Elles se réunissent à chaque fois de besoins et organisent des tontines mensuelles. Leur présidente s’appelle Ndieynaba, elle est très brave et évolue dans la commercialisation des fruits et légumes. Elle est à son 5ème prêt et sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des fruits et légumes. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des charges  quotidiennes de la famille. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans et commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 20h. Avec l’aide de l’institution, elle souhaite augmenter ses revenus en diversifier son activité commerciale.
texts.en:
JIGUENE BAKHNA 89 is a 5-member group. All the members live in the same neighbourhood and know each other through a community group. They sell almost the same products: seasonal fruits and vegetables.
They meet whenever they need to and also organize monthly meetings. Their president is Ndieynaba. She is very brave and is experienced in selling fruits and vegetables. She helps her husband with the family's daily costs. She has over 5 years' experience and starts her day at 7 am to finish at 8 pm. With the help of the institution, she hopes to increase her revenue and diversify her sales.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Sheeba

texts.en:
Sheeba is 27 years old, residing in Lahore, Pakistan, and the mother of two children.  She maintains her household activities properly, but has also been running a beauty salon for the last few years.  She is a trained beautician, and good at her job.  Due to her efficient and good work, her client numbers increase every day. 

Sheeba requires some beauty salon related items such as facial creams, combs, and furniture items like dressing chairs and mirrors, so she made contact with the Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan.  BRAC staff visited her enterprise and issued a loan. 

She is very thankful for BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to enhance her beauty salon.

loans.name: Jiguene Bakhna 31 Group

texts.fr: JIGUENE BAKHNA 31 est aussi ici du GIE  GFAP qui est composé de plusieurs groupement qui habitent tous dans le même quartier et font la même activité qui est la vente des fruits et légumes. Elles se sont connues grâce à l’organisation des tontines mensuelles et des rencontres régulières. La présidente s’appelle AWA, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. AWA est mariée et mère de famille qui aide son mari dans la gestion des charges quotidiennes. Elle a un parent bénéficiaire dans l’institution. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans et commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 20h.Etant à son 5ème prêt, elle a besoin de ce crédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises et diversifier ses fruits. Avec l’appuie de l’institution, elle pourra à l’avenir augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
JIGUENE BAKHNA 31 is a group of GIE  GFAP made up of people who all live in the same neighbourhood and have the same businesses: fruit and vegetable sales. They met thanks to the organization through regular meetings. Awa is the president, pictured raising her hand in the photo. Awa is married with children and helps her husband with the daily costs. She has a relative who also works with the institution.
She has over 5 years' experience in business and starts her day at 7 am to finish at 8 pm. This is her fifth loan, and she needs it to increase her stock and diversify her products. With the institution's support, she will be able to in the future increase her revenue and save up money in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Jiguene Bakhna Group

texts.fr: JIGUENE BAKHNA 74 est un groupement du GIE GFAP qui est composé de 4femmes et un homme et qui habitent dans le même quartier et qui font la même activité. Ils ont pris leur destin en main pour lutter contre la pauvreté. Ainsi Ils ont choisi comme présidente la dame Mbène. Elle est reconnue sur la phot par la main levée. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des fruits et légumes. Elle n’a pas parent bénéficiaire dans l’institution. Mariée et mère de famille, elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5ans et commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 20h. Avec le crédit, Mbène va augmenter et diversifier le stock de son marchandise. Et voudrait à l’avenir agrandir son activité et gagner le monopole du marché. Ainsi elle pourra épargner de l’argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
JIGUENE BAKHNA 74 is a group of Gie Gap made up of 4 women and one man who live in the same neighbourhood and have the same businesses. They have taken their fates into their own hands to fight against poverty. They chose as president Mbene. She is pictured with her hand raised.
Her fruit and vegetable business is evolving. She does not have relatives who take out loans from the institution.
She is married with children and helps her husband with the daily costs. She has over 5 years' experience in commerce and starts her day at 7 am to finish at 8 pm.
With this loan, Mbene will increase and diversify her merchandise and stock. She would like in the future to expand her business and gain a monopoly of the market. This way she could save up money and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for re-sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Angélica María

texts.es:
Angélica tiene 22 años, madre de dos menores hijos, es una persona muy emprendedora tal así que alquilo un puesto ubicado en un mercado en el cual vende comida hace seis años y tiene clientela fija. Sus ingresos le permiten mantener a su familia su propósito es ubicarse en un lugar más amplio para obtener  mayores ingresos. El crédito lo adquiere para renovar sus ollas que se encuentran en estado desgastado.
Agradece a los inversionistas kiva por esta oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Angélica, 22, in the mother of two minor children.  She's a very enterprising person, so much so that she has rented a stall in a market for six years where she sells food and has steady customers.  Her income allows her to support her family.  Her goal is to set up in a bigger space so she can earn more income.

Angélica's getting the loan to update her pots because they're worn out.

She's grateful to the Kiva lenders for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy pots

loans.name: Riaz Hussain

texts.en:
Riaz Hussain is the age of 48 and is living with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

He has been running a small general store for 15 years; earlier, he was doing an ordinary job. After retirement, he established a general store with the help of savings, so that he can equally participate in household expenses.  

His shop is situated under a populated area, and lot of customers are available here to offer miscellaneous general store items. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable in daily usage. He wants to offer additional bakery items such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, patties, etc, but the major problem is the shortage of funds.

Therefore, Riaz Hussain requested a loan from Kvia’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to buy additional bakery item such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, patties, etc.

He  is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will be successful in fulfilling each request for any item and abstain from the disappointment of his customers. In this way, he will be able to generate maximum profit from the sale of additional bakery items. 

Riaz Hussain is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, patties, etc

loans.name: M. Nadeem

texts.en:
M. Nadeem is a 32-year-old married man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been running an embroidery business for the past three years, installing stitching machines and recruiting workers for embroidery work on daily wages.

With the marriage season starting and more demand for his product, he wants to cope with the increasing demand by buying stocks of silky threads and fancy cloths of various colors. M. Nadeem requires some capital to buy desired inventories, but he has already been investing all the savings in his current business. As a result, he humbly requests a loan from BRAC Pakistan.

Now, M. Nadeem is tension free about the stock and pays full concentration over his work. M. Nadeem is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of silky threads and fancy cloths of various colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy one buffalo for her husband's milk sales business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, 45 years old, is married, with three children. She has been in business for more than a decade. Vegetable-vending is her primary source of livelihood. She became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) in June 2012. 

Recently, Evelyn decided to apply for a loan to buy additional vegetables for her vegetable-vending business. She hopes to increase her income with more inventory to sell. 

In the future, Evelyn hopes to save more money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables for her vegetable-vending business.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
An old man living in Kampong Cham Province, Phan is 64 years old and a father of six children. To support his family, he grows rice as a single, main source of income.  This is his second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he has repaid his past loan completely. 

Phan will spend his entire loan portion to pay tuition fees for his daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor degree, majoring in Accounting. He hopes that his daughter can get a good job after graduating

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for his daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor degree, majoring in Accounting.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cylinders of propane gas, cold beverages, corn, and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Viacha 27 Group

texts.es:
Marina es una mujer de 61 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 15, 8 años y 2 hijas de 4, 11 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, generosa, comprensiva, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en ferias de la ciudad como la ’16 de julio’ que se realiza los días jueves y domingos; donde se puede encontrar desde una aguja para coser hasta un tractor para arar. De clima frio y seco, con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 2-12 grados centígrados.
Marina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por el comercio (sentada a la izquierda, usa suéter blanco y chaleco negro). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como empleado y sus hijos; todos estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, alcantarillado y gas. Sus deseos de superación la hicieron formar una banca de personas con negocios como; tapizado de vehículos, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares, venta de hoja de coca, venta de jugo de quinua, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos y venta de polleras, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; Ají de lengua (lengua de vaca, papa, cebolla, acompañada de una de salsa picante), Anticuchos (Brochetas de corazón de vaca, frito a la parrilla, acompañado de papa y salsa picante de maní), Fritanga (cerdo en pequeños trozos, ají, chuño y maíz), Lagua de Chuño (Sopa preparada con chuño, carne de cordero, chalona remojada, papas, hojas de repollo, cebolla, condimentos con orégano), Jakhonta (Preparado con trozos de carne, chuño, papa, hojas de repollo, cebolla; condimentado con orégano), Ispi frito (Pescado pequeño frito. Se sirve con papa puti y mote), Sopa de Karachi (Pescado hecho hervir con papa y cebolla verde). Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana y recorre las diferentes ferias de la ciudad para vender su comida. “aprendí a cocinar desde muy niña porque le ayudaba a mi mamá, luego me independicé y actualmente tengo clientes fieles que me buscan diariamente…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una casa propia. Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a sus clientes de forma adecuada. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marina solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a sus clientes de manera adecuada.
texts.en:
Marina is a woman of 61, married, she has two sons aged 15 and 8 and two daughters aged 4 and 11. Her business is the sale of food. She is a good mother, generous, sympathetic, a good listener, supportive, responsible and hardworking. She carries out her business as a walking vendor in city markets like "16 de julio," which happens on Thursdays and Sundays, where one can find anything from a sewing needle to a tractor for plowing. It's a cold and dry climate, with an ambient temperature that varies during the day between 2-12 degrees Celsius.

Marina has a dark complexion, long braided black hair, her mother tongue is Aymará and she speaks Spanish for business (seated at the left, wearing a white sweater and black vest). She shares her life with her husband who works as an employee and their children; they all study in school. They live in a rented house that has potable water, electricity, sewage and gas. Her dreams of getting ahead caused her to form a bank of people with businesses like: vehicle upholstery, sale of blended juices, sale of cellphone covers, sale of coca leaves, sale of quinoa, sale of perfumes, sale of soda and sale of skirts in order to apply for a loan and grow their businesses.

Her business is the sale of traditional food like: Ají de lengua (cow tongue, potatoes, onions, accompanied by a hot sauce), Anticuchos (skewers of cow's heart, fried on the grill, accompanied by potatoes and spicy peanut sauce), Fritanga (pork in small pieces, chili, potato starch and corn), Lagua de Chuño (soup prepared with potato starch, mutton, potatoes, cabbage leaves, garnished with oregano), Ipsi frito (small fried fish served with puti potatoes and corn), Karachi Soup (boiled fish with potatoes and onions).

She carries out this work every day of the week and travels to the different markets of the city to sell her food. "I learned how to cook when I was a very young girl because I helped my mom. Later I became independent and currently I have loyal customers who look for me daily," she comments. Her dream is to have her own house. She wishes to grow her business through the purchase of tables and chairs to tend to her customers in an adequate manner. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 10 years that she's been carrying out this activity. 

It's for these reasons that Marina is applying for a loan for the purchase of tables and chairs to tend to her customers in an adequate manner.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to tend to her customers in an adequate manner.

loans.name: El Arroyo Group

texts.es:
Clara es una mujer de 57 años, a pesar de su edad aún tiene grandes aspiraciones. Hace poco sufrió la pérdida de su esposo aunque esto no la detiene para continuar con su negocio. Actualmente ya tampoco tiene ningún dependiente, pero sus hijos, nietos y nueras la visitan con frecuencia. 

Durante más de 25 años, se ha dedicado a la cría y engorda de borregos que compra cuando apenas tienen algunos días de nacidos y que conserva durante 8 meses en casa. Con el alimento y cuidados necesarios, puede obtener muy buenas ganancias ya que los animales alcanzan el peso y tamaño adecuados. Clara no necesita invertir tanto en alimento porque desde muy temprano los saca a pastar al campo; afortunadamente en su comunidad iniciaron las cosechas de maíz y cuando los productores terminan de cosechar, cortan y recogen el zacate (remanente del maíz), pero en algunos terrenos queda algo de pasto que Doña Clara aprovecha para llevar a sus borregos.

Ahora solo tiene dos borregos grandes en casa, pero los venderá en diciembre que es la temporada en que las personas compran los animales para preparar platillos como la tradicional barbacoa que ofrecen a sus invitados en fiestas como bodas, confirmaciones, bautizos, etc. Las personas prefieren festejar en esta época porque en la región casi no llueve. 

Doña Clara tiene pensado comprar dos borreguitas y un borreguito, este último lo utilizará como su semental para cuando las primeras crezcan y estén preparadas para iniciar a dar crías. Esto resultará de gran beneficio porque si todo fluye de acuerdo con sus planes, al final del siguiente año tendrá siete borregos en total. Su grande sueño es poder llegar a tener el mayor número de borregos para que en cualquier momento que necesite dinero pueda echar mano de sus animalitos, venderlos y así solventar el gasto.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son Lourdes y Mauricia, ellas invertirán en becerros; Teresa, Luz y Sofía, en la cría de borregos y Juana, en su tienda de abarrotes. Ellas conforman el grupo “El Arroyo”, nombrado así porque muy cerca de su casas hay un pequeño arroyo que es muy importante en su vida porque cada vez que se quedan sin agua, bajan a él para llevar el líquido vital a sus hogares.

También se muestran muy agradecidas con KIVA y VisionFund porque gracias al préstamo podrán hacer crecer sus negocios y con ello ayudar a solventar algunos gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en uno de los campos verdes de la comunidad donde Mauricia tiene sus borreguitos. Clara viste una playera morada y un mandil rosa.
texts.en:
Clara is a 57-year-old woman, who in spite of her age still has big aspirations. Recently she suffered the loss of her husband, although this doesn’t stop her to continue with her business. She currently doesn’t have any dependents relying on her, but her children, grandchildren and daughters-in law visit her frequently.  	

For over 25 years she has worked in livestock rearing and cattle fattening. She buys them when they are in their first days of life, and keeps them for 8 months at her house. With the proper feed and care, she can get really good profits since the animals reach the right weight and size. Clara doesn’t need to invest a lot in feed because she takes them out to graze from an early hour. 

Luckily, in her community just started the corn harvest. When the farmers finish the reaping, they cut and gather the fodder (what is left from the corn). However, in some lands the grass remains and Doña Clara takes advantage of this to take her lambs to pasture.

Now she only has two big lambs at her house, but she will sell them in December. At this time of the year people buy these animals to prepare traditional dishes, like barbacoa, and offer them to their guests in celebrations, like weddings, confirmations, baptisms, etc. People prefer to celebrate in this time of the year because the rains tend to be less frequent in the region. 

Doña Clara wants to buy two female lambs and one male lamb. She will use this last one as a stud for when the females reach an age to have offspring. This will be of great benefit because if everything goes according to her plan, at the end of the next year she will have seven lambs in total. Her biggest dream is to have the maximum amount of lambs so she can sell them at any given time in case she needs the money for her expenses.  

The other members of the group are Lourdes and Mauricia, and they will invest in bull calves. Teresa, Luz and Sofía will invest in lamb rearing; and Juana in her grocery store. They form the group “El Arroyo”, named after the little stream near their homes, and which is of great importance to their lives since it provides them with water every time they don’t have this service. 

They are grateful to KIVA and VisionFund since thanks to this loan they will be able to make their businesses grow and pay for the household expenses and their children’s education. 

*The picture was taken in one of the green fields of the community where Mauricia has her lambs. Clara is wearing a purple shirt and a pink apron.

loans.use: to buy three lambs.

location.town: San Juan Cote, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is a 54-year-old, married woman with eight children. Her youngest child is 18. She is a resident in the town of Dulag, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities like canned goods, eggs, sugar, cooking oil and seasonings.  She has been operating a variety store for more than 20 years.

She is asking for a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy assorted groceries like noodles, canned goods, soap and beverages. Lucita will be able to display a variety of goods in her store, allowing more buyers to shop and purchase. This will cause her income to increase and she will provide her family with nutritious diets.

In the future, Lucita hopes to improve her business to make it successful and profitable for a sustainable livelihood, and also to continue to finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries to sell like noodles, canned goods, soap and beverages.

loans.name: Suaibatul

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Suaibatul, a micro-entrepreneur from East Serang, a suburban city, located about three hours' drive from Jakarta. Suaibatul is married and she has been blessed with five children. 

Suaibatul runs a small stall, selling snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. She met a PT Rekan Usaha Mikro Anda (Ruma) field staff member who introduced her to Ruma about three months ago. She got excited and decided to try the mobile phone airtime business. 

For the last three months, Suaibatul has been running the business really well and now the demand for mobile phone airtime is increasing. Therefore, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva that will be used to process more mobile phone airtime transactions. 

Most of her customers are her own female neighbors who have also adopted mobile phones. As the business runs, Suaibatul plans to add more mobile services to her community, such as a utility bill payment service. 

In the photo, Suaibatul is pictured standing inside her stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in her community.

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
Joanna is 29 years old and married with three children.

Joanna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs and other groceries.

Joanna has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Joanna aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs and other groceries.

loans.name: Mariyam Shg Group

texts.en:
The group named Mariyam SHG is in its first loan cycle and is also participating in the poverty elimination program of People's Forum. These women are the heads of their households and are striving to move forward on behalf of their children and relatives. 

One of the members is Sumitra. Through her work selling fruits and vegetables, she is able to make an honest and decent living. Sumitra says that she is breaking new ground with the variety of products that she offers, which are also more to the liking of her customers. She is a hardworking and determined woman. 

Sumitra is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables. This will enable her to continue her sales just as before. She appreciates the opportunity she has received that will allow her to keep growing.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to continue her sales

loans.name: Angela Arely

texts.es: Angela de 49 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de aritos, cadenas, pulseras de enchape desde hace varios años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra mas productos por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Angela is 49 years old and a single mother. She lives in her own house with her two children. For several years, she's earned a living selling metal-plated earrings, chains and bracelets. Her business is located in her home.

She's seeking a loan to buy more products in bulk in order to continue with her sales and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy metal-plated earrings, chains and bracelets.

loans.name: Alis David

texts.es: Alis de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, el posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Alis, 49 years old, lives in his own house with his mother. He has had a bakery located in his place of residence for the last 10 years. He has many customers because of the quality with which he makes the bread. With the earnings he obtains, he achieves getting ahead with the expenses of the home. He is applying for a loan for the purchase of flour, sugar, flavored jellies, molds, etc. to be able to continue with his work and therefore have more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, flavored jellies, molds, etc.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is 25 years old. She is a housewife and looks after her family of five. She is well-trained in cloth stitching and provides services in stitching to the people at her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for the shop, including threads, needles, cloth, etc. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. Asia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan as per her requirement, for which she is very thankful.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her stitching work

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es: Milagro de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Milagro, 50 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner and her son. She has had a small store located in her place of residence for the past 10 years. She has many customers because of the good prices and friendliness that she has at the moment of making a sale. She is applying for a loan to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, snacks, sweet bread, etc. and therefore be able to have more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, snacks, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas is a businesswoman. She was born in 1985 in the southern part of Tajikistan. She is married and has two children. Mukaddas had a business of sewing clothes for schoolboys and schoolgirls at home. She closed her business last year. 

For almost two months now, she has again been sewing clothes for kids and dressing-gowns. Mukaddas wants to sew different models of dresses and dressing-gowns for kids. She hopes that her business will bring benefit to people and happiness for kids. Mukaddas needs a financial support about 12,000 TJS for materials and sewing machines for increasing the working capital of her new business.

loans.use: To buy materials and sewing machines for increasing the working capital of her new business

loans.name: Lourilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lourilyn works hard to support her family.

Lourilyn has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy more materials for her fishing business.

Lourilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for fishing

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is 46 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more coconuts for her business.

Marialyn has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the dried coconut meat business for 10 years and also earns an income from farming root crops.  She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Merlinda is 32 years old now.

Merlinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

Merlinda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emily is 47 years old.

Emily has a business selling fruit in the Philippines. She requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fruit for retailing.

Emily has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Emily would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell at her fruit stand

loans.name: Gilang

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Gilang. Gilang is a student who sells mobile phone airtime credits. Gilang lives in East Serang, a suburban city located about three hours' drive from Jakarta. 

Gilang is doing the mobile airtime business because he needs support to pay for school himself. He met one of Ruma's field staff, who introduced and trained him on how to sell mobile phone airtime. He decided to join Ruma about three months ago, not only because he can save money for his education but also but also because he can learn more about mobile technology use for businesses. Gilang’s customers are mostly his friends and neighbors.

As the demand for mobile airtime increases (especially on the weekends), Gilang is applying for a working capital loan from Kiva in order to process more airtime transactions. Gilang is the one smiling in the photo. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in his community

loans.name: Mirlande

texts.en:
Mirlande has been a well-appreciated entrepreneur since she started doing business. She used to enjoy making pies and pastries for kids. She opened a restaurant in 2008, and she received financial support from her family. To better promote and provide quality food in her small restaurant, Mirlande decided to learn cooking. Out of the small profits generated, she has been doing philanthropic activities in state hospitals. That pledge has caught many customers’ interest to always come back. 

Today, the business is in need to buy more equipment such as tables, chairs, freezers and other bakery supplies to increase its production. Mirlande has attended two training sessions with Zafen in the process of this loan. This objective will only be attainable with your contribution through Zafen.

loans.use: to purchase three tables, one freezer, four tower fans, food products and bakery supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a pupusa griddle

loans.name: Pesagi Indah 1 Group

texts.en:
Like many Balinese women, Ni Putu and the other members of Pesagi Indah 1 Group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes.  Though many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize income. Ni Putu hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs.  

This is the group's first loan. Ni Putu will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as suckling pig. With her profits, she will help support her family of three by supplementing the income of her husband, who works as a farmer.  Ultimately, Ni Putu hopes that increased income will enable her to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Mhel Owen

texts.en:
Mhel Owen has signed up his membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and availed himself of the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. He is thankful for the capital extended to a small-time loaner like him. Mhel Owen is able to turn the tide in his favor and has made good sales these days. 

He wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, Mhel Owen availed himself of a loan to restock his store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, soy sauce, and noodles. 

In the future, he hopes to create a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, soy sauce, and noodles.

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items for her sewing business

loans.name: Imran

texts.en:
Imran is a 31-year-old married man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with his spouse and two children. He has been running a small printing press for many years. He prints over cardboard boxes for various products, as well as book bindings. For these purposes, he uses various colors paint, rollers, chemicals loop wire and gum.

Imran belongs to a poor family and is singly responsible for his children and old parents. His parents, most of the time, remain sick; he has to spend most of his income upon their cure. He wants to grow his business, so he can easily generate additional income for cherishing his children and to bear the medical expenses of his parents.

Therefore, Imran has requested a Kiva loan, so he can buy cardboard, paint, chemical loop wires and gum to print more boxes. In this way, he can easily generate additional income for his family. He requests the loan with Kiva's support; he hopes that the Kiva lenders will support him. Imran is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cardboard, paint, chemical loop wires and gum.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester, age 53, is happy tending her little store. She is married with two kids, and her husband is a tricycle driver. The store is her means of earning a living in support of her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood, and so she makes promising daily sales. Ester keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores.  Ester believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Ester has reached her fourth year of being a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. "It's already tested," she said.  

She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store, and from there, she could afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to purhase basic commodities for sari-sari (small grocery) store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy needles, thread, cloth, and machine oil  for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Poch's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kampong Speu Province, Poch is 40 years old and a mother of four dependent children. Due to the struggles of her family, she grows rice as their single source of income. She has been involved this business for ages, and it earns her about 30,000 KHR per day. 

This is Poch's second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan. She leads a group of two members to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's lives and health.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Berta

texts.en:
A USD 800 loan is offered to Berta to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, salt, coffee, and fish. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Berta independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a driver. She is happy with this loan because it will improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, salt, coffee, and fish to sell.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos que les gusta trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación, es el trabajo que realiza José de 42 años de edad, el tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 4 ya trabajan para ayudar a la economía de la familia y los 2 últimos  son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de la comunidad.

La actividad que le realiza es la compra, venta y producción de maíz,  el eligió esta actividad porque cuenta con terreno y clima apta para la siembra de maíz y le genera muy buenos ingresos económicos para el y para el bienestar de su familia, la segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero en su comunidad siempre con la visión de ayudar a sus vecinos en su comunidad.

El uso respectivo que dará al crédito que el realiza es para la compra de semillas de maíz y abono químico y orgánico par que sus producciones de este año sean las mejores que años anteriores. Una de las metas de José es incrementar su producción de maíz y mejorar  sus prácticas de manejo en el cultivo de ello y seguir brindando educación a sus hijos para que sean mejores profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
The land has been blessed by hands which like to work and tend it. It is a worthy and admirable occupation that people do for years and even all their lives. Without the hard work of the country dwellers who are so dedicated to tending it, the land would not give us the produce which sustains generation after generation. José is one of these people. He is 42 years old and has 6 children, 4 of whom already work and help support the family financially and the youngest two are excellent pupils at the local school. 

José buys, sells and produces corn. He chose to do this because the land and the climate are ideally suited to sowing corn and because it provides him and with a good income and a good quality of life for his family. He also works as a labourer in his community always with the aim of helping his neighbours. 

He will use the loan to buy corn seed and chemical and organic fertilizer so that this year's produce is better than last year's. One of José's goals is to increase his production of corn, improve his handling of the crop and carry on providing his children with an education so that they can become better professionals in their lifetime.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and chemical and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two burners with propane tanks, a new mill for the bakery and some raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the maintenance costs of her son's van.

loans.name: Pesagi Indah 2 Group

texts.en:
The Pesagi Indah 2 group is made up of six women who are neighbors in the same village in Badung, in the middle part of Bali.  The group is seeking a loan of 21,000,000 IDR, and each member will receive 3,500,000 IDR.  The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement family income, and out of their interest in education on best practices for pig raising.  This is their first loan with MUK.

Ni Wayan, age 40, is the head of the Pesagi Indah 2 group.  She is married and has two children.  Her older child is in junior high school and her younger child is in elementary school.   Her husband earns money as a chicken farmer, but Ni Wayan would like to help support her family with her pig raising business.   

Ni Wayan used her loan to purchase local piglets and feed. She plans to sell the piglets after two months for use as pig barbeque.  With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase local piglets and feed

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe lives in Mauswagon, Calamba, Philippines.  She is married and has two children.  Her husband is a fisherman who never gets tired of supporting their family. In 2000, she applied for her membership to Paglaum MPC. Hearing all the benefits of being a member, she didn't hesitate to become one.  She maintains herself as a credible member in good standing, and she always pays her loans in a timely manner. 

Recently, she has asked for a loan of PHP 6,000 for additional capital for fishing. She makes use of teared foam in their fish vending and hopes to buy new ones. Through this project, she believes she will raise more income and be of help for the expansion of their business.  Fe has found comfort for their financial needs through Paglaum MPC, of which she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like floaters and nets.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn has a hobby of listening to music, and she loves to sing as well. Until she came up an idea to put up a videoke bar, not only that she is enjoying it, she also earns a meager income to support their family needs. She busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her financing needs. 

To generate more income, Marilyn opened a sari-sari (general store) and took a loan to PMPC to buy additional inventory for her store. 

In the future, Marilyn wishes to own "Videoke" units and put them in every store or resort so that she can also be of help to others to earn income for their own families.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Las Limas Group

texts.es:
La comunidad donde se encuentra el grupo “Las Limas” se caracteriza por la producción de hule y caña de azúcar; los caminos están enmarcados por árboles de estos dos tipos y la mayoría de los habitantes trabaja en el campo. 

Los integrantes explican también que a su comunidad se le conoce como "El Chorizo" ya que es alargada y las casas se encuentran también a la orilla de la carretera. El grupo lo conforman:

Valentina- Comida Y Refrescos 
Ambrosio y Manuel - Venta De Refacciones Para Motos
Jorge - Venta De Hule Y Fertilizantes
María - Venta De Antojitos
Marcelo - Venta De Tortillas

Doña Valentina tiene 56 años de edad, actualmente vive con su padre de 102 años a quien cuida desde que su madre murió. Con ella también vive su hija de 22 años y su nieta de dos años. Valentina se ha dedicado a vender refrescos desde hace 10 años y apenas hace tres, comenzó a vender comida (corrida y antojitos) los días sábado, domingo y lunes. De igual manera vende tortas de jamón, pollo, refrescos y aguas a los alumnos de una escuela en su comunidad. Cada 8 días vende tamales rancheros, de masa y de elote. Además, por las tardes visita el solar donde tiene sus sembradíos de maíz, calabaza y frijol que utiliza en la preparación de los alimentos que comercializa. Al preguntarle cual fue la inspiración para iniciar con todas sus actividades, contestó “Me gusta trabajar, vender para poder tener ingresos, no depender de nadie y también para no sentirme sola”.

Valentina está solicitando un préstamo para comprar queso, chiles, aceite, verduras, mayonesa, pollo y refrescos  para continuar con  su actividad. "Cuando yo llegue a faltar, todo esto será el patrimonio de mi hija para que pueda solventar los gastos de su pequeña". Es por su familia por quien Valentina continua trabajando arduamente. Para lograr el crecimiento de sus actividades ocupa parte de las ganancias y los préstamos que le son otorgados.

El grupo da las gracias a Kiva y a VisionFund México por brindarles una oportunidad para ampliar su negocio.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de la casa de otra hija de doña Valentina, ella viste blusa naranja y falda beige.
texts.en:
The community where we find the "Las Limas" group is know for its production of rubber and sugarcane; its roads are lined with both kinds of trees.  The majority of its inhabitants work in the fields.

The members explain that their community is also known as "El Chorizo" because it is stretched out and the houses are located on the edges of the highway.  The group is made up of:

Valentina- Sells food and soft drinks
Ambrosio y Manuel - Sells car parts
Jorge - Sells rubber and fertilizers
María - Sells snacks
Marcelo - Sells tortillas

Valentina is 56 and currently lives with her 102-year-old father whom she has cared for since her mother's death.  Her 22-year-old daughter and 2-year-old granddaughter also live with her.  Valentina has been selling soft drinks for ten years and barely three years ago began selling food (fast food and snacks) on Saturdays, Sundays, and Mondays.  She also sells ham sandwiches, chicken, soft drinks, and water to the students at a community school.  Every eight days she sells cornmeal and sweet corn tamales and tamales ranchero.  In addition, in the afternoons she visits the plot where she has the corn, pumpkin, and bean crops she uses to prepare the food she sells.  When asked what the inspiration was for starting all her businesses she answers, "I like working and selling to make income and not depend on anyone and not feel alone."

Valentina is seeking a loan to buy cheese, chilies, oils, vegetables, mayonnaise, chicken, and soft drinks so she can continue with her business.  "When I'm gone, my daughter will inherit everything so she can support her little one." It's for her family that Valentina continues to work so arduously.  She'll use some of her profits and the loan she receives to grow her businesses.  

The group thanks Kiva and VisionFund México for providing the opportunity to grow their businesses.  

*The picture was taken on the patio at the home of Valentina's other daughter.  Valentina is the one in the orange shirt and beige skirt.

loans.use: comprar; queso, chiles, aceite, verduras, mayonesa, pollo y refrescos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Pervaz

texts.en:
Pervaz, age 40, is married and the father of three children.  He owns a dairy farm and is a hardworking and honest person.  Every morning he wakes up to prepare animal feed and withdraw milk.  He then pours the milk in to clean vessels and delivers them to his customers.  His business is important because it is the only source of income for his family.  

Pervez is seeing growth in this business, and therefore wants purchase additional buffaloes for his dairy farm.  This will allow him to increase milk production and subsequently increase sales.

Due to insufficient financing, he has requested a loan to purchase the additional buffaloes.  This loan will help him boost his business and increase his market outreach.  He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase more buffoles for his dairy farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Anecita is 51 years old and has one child in school.

Anecita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Anecita requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials to use in her business.

Anecita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Anecita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials to use

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception is married and has three children. She works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from fish vending. 

Conception requested her fourth loan from NWTF for 9,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her fishing business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets and other materials

loans.name: Naarkul

texts.ru: Нааркул успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Нааркул есть 3 коровы, 8 овец. На участке мерою 3,15 ГА она выращивает пшеницу. Нааркул на ежедневной основе реализует молоко, экологически чистое и очень вкусное оно пользуется большим спросом среди местных жителей. На сегодняшний день прибыль Нааркул составляет 9,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Она вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для покупки дойной коровы. Она сможет увеличить удой экологически чистого молока, тем самым удовлетворив весь спрос. Доходы от кредита Нааркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Naarkul successfully repaid her loan after using it as directed. She is grateful to the Kiva Fund and everyone, who had helped her with the financing. Today, Naarkul's farm contains 3 cows and 8 sheep. She also grows wheat on 3.15 hectares of land. Naarkul sells ecologically-clean, very delicious and highly-demanded among local residents milk on a daily basis. Today Naarkul's profit amounts to 9,000 som (KGS) per month. She once again requested a loan from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a dairy cow. She will be able to increase the volumes of ecologically-clean milk, thus, satisfying all of the demand. Naarkul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase the volume of ecologically-clean milk

loans.name: Arcadia

texts.en:
Arcadia is 60 years old and married with eleven children. Arcadia works very hard to provide for them.

Arcadia runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, bread and other goods.

Arcadia has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Arcadia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, bread and more.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
A married mother with two children, Beatrice is 32 years old. She has a beauty parlor where she operates a salon and sells cosmetics such as hair gel and perfumes. She is taking a loan to purchase additional stock for her cosmetics shop.  

Beatrice hopes that her business will go a long way in helping her support the family by improving their overall living standards, including food quality and modern housing. Beatrice is happy for Kiva and the support of its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetics to help improve on sales.

loans.name: Agustinha

texts.en:
Agustinha lives in Ermera. She operates a kiosk selling electrical goods, which she has been doing since 2012. She started with her own working capital of $600. She also has one motorcycle for transporting goods to sell in other markets. 

Agustinha is requesting a loan from Tuba Rai Metin for $800, which she will use to purchase a screwdriver, glue, solar power, fan, light bulbs, adapters, cables and other materials to sell. She wants to improve the management of her business and increase her future income.

loans.use: to purchase a screwdriver, glue, solar power, fan, light bulbs, adapters, cables and other materials to sell.

loans.name: Jiguene Bakhna 47 Group

texts.fr: JIGUENE BAKHNA 47 est un groupement de femmes qui est composé de 5 personnes. Elles habitent dans le même quartier et pratiquent la même activité. Elles ont comme présidente Madame FATOU qui évolue dans la commercialisation des fruits et légumes. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans et sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des fruits et légumes. Elle a 5 enfants qui vont à l’école et aide son mari dans la gestion des charges quotidiennes. FATOU commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 20h. Passant toute la journée à courir derrière les voitures pour présenter et vendre ses fruits, elle souhaite à l’avenir avoir un grand magasin sur la route pour mieux conserver son stock et diversifier ses marchandises. En plus elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent à coté.
texts.en:
The 'Jiguene Bakhna 47' Group is made up of five women who all live in the same neighbourhood and work in the same field.  The group president is Fatou and she has been selling fruit and vegetables for more than five years.  She has requested this loan in order to buy fruit and vegetables for resale.

Fatou has five children who all attend school, and she helps her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their household.  She starts her working day at seven in the morning and finishes at eight in the evening.  She makes her sales to people travelling in vehicles and spends her days chasing after cars to show off her wares.  In the future, she would like to be able to have a large shop at the side of the road so she can take better care of her stock and offer a wider range of produce.  In this way, she could increase her revenue and put money to one side for the future.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Abdul Aziz

texts.en:
Abdul Aziz is the age of 38, an energetic young man living with his spouse, a daughter, and old parents in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan.

His forefathers and relatives have been selling chicken for many years. In the beginning, he purchased small quantities of chicken from market then sold in his locality from his butcher shop. The customers grieved stale chicken from many days. He does not want to compromise his quality and reputation.

This is the reason he wants to produce fresh chicken and wants to buy a broiler for producing fresh chicken to sell, but he does not have enough cash in hand. For this reason, he contacted the Kiva field partner and requested a Kiva loan, so he can buy a broiler in large quantity. He hopes that this loan will prove productive and beneficial for his butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy a broiler for producing chicken to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Kafia

texts.en:
Kafia 30, is married and blessed with a child. She is a housewife and looks after her house and child. Her husband runs a small restaurant in the nearby market. His small business is the only source of income for his family. They are able to manage their expenses but they need to save for their child's education and future. 

Her husband wishes to improve his business by adding variety to the menu. Kafia has therefore applied for a loan through Brac Pakistan to help her husband. 

They are pleased and hopeful that this investment will be fruitful.

loans.use: to help her husband improve his restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en:
Zahid has a small general store in Hyderabad. He is a hardworking and fair person. Working for many years has given him good experience. As many customers come to his shop asking for fresh dairy milk, he feels it’s the right time to invest in a dairy shop, given the increasing demand for dairy shop items. He is hopeful with this investment and is sure that this investment will be beneficial for his business.

Zahid is 50 years old and the father of five children. He wants to start saving money for his childrens' marriages and has therefore requested a loan to arrange for the financing to increase sales. He is hopeful for his business and thankful to Kiva and Brac Pakistan for their ready assistance.

loans.use: to start selling dairy products at his general store.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
A young and enthusiastic entrepreneur, Arif runs a small garment shop in Hyderabad, Pakistan.  He is 34 years old.  Arif sells stitched and unstitched clothing at his shop for ladies and gents.  He is polite while dealing with his customers.  He buys clothes from the wholesale market and then resells it at his shop. 

Arif is conscious of the customer demand and the new trends in the market, and provides his customers with a different variety according to their likes and taste.  He wants to buy an additional variety of garments for his shop to boost his sale.  For this purpose, he has requested a loan to get more established and improve his living standards.

He is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase garments for his shop,

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Fida

texts.en:
Fida, age 38, is married and the father of one child.  He owns a general store and is hardworking and honest.  He has many years of experience in this business. His major sales items range in variety from lentils, rice, and flour, as well as other items.  

Fida wants to expand his business by selling dairy products. This addition will lead to higher sales, but due to insufficient financing, he has requested a loan to purchase dairy items like milk, yogurt, cheese, butter, and cream.  This loan will help him boost his business and increase his market outreach. 

He is thankful for Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase dairy items for his store.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
