Christopher, age 66, is from Mitimos, Rizal, Philippines. He is a married and raising five children. Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) supported him by providing the capital to start his pig raising business. He sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive. He gives his best efforts to produce good pigs, in order to sell them continuously. 

Christopher is now trying to expand his pig business and has also decided to venture into a little restaurant. He presented his project proposal to PMPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan to buy materials for pig fence. He is thankful to PMPC for financing his capital needs. 

Christopher wants his business to be well known and to build a good business for his loyal customers. With his extra income, he wishes to send all his children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to buy materials for a pig fence

loans.name: Feve

texts.en:
Feve is 27 years old and lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is married, with two children. Feve has a fish vending business and owns a fishing boat with her husband as the fisherman; she earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work for five years now. 

Feve has requested a loan to pay for fishing boat repair so that she can be able to continue her fish selling business for the benefit of her family. 

Feve has recently signed up for her membership with PMPC; she wishes to maintain her membership with good standing in the cooperative.

loans.use: To pay for fishing boat repair

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is 45 years old and a widow with eight children. She lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City. Marcelina personally manages and sells the catch from her fishing boat in nearby municipalities. Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC two years ago, she has remained a member in good standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 7,000 for the purchase of new fishing nets.  As much as possible, people in her business have to have quality equipment to ensure a good catch. Marcelina already has floaters to help guard her fish cages. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market and fetch higher prices.  In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  She wishes to see all her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 42 years old and married, with two children, both of whom are in school. Emma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, eggs, etc..

Emma has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 45 years old, married and has four children, three in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. Sonia requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her livestock.

Sonia has been in business for 10 years now and has borrowed in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Sonia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her livestock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Mary; she joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training on enterprise development.  She is 54 years old, married, and has six children. 

She does vegetable and dairy farming to earn a living. Mary is taking a loan to boost her vegetable farming by buying certified seeds and manure.  She hopes her crop yield will improve, thus more income from improved sales.

Mary is happy that she will be able to provide a better education for the children. She is very happy with Kiva and their lenders, and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure and seeds that will help improve on crop yield.

loans.name: Tia Bidii Young Mothers Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Jacinta, a member of Tia Bidii Young Mothers Group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training on enterprise development. She is 37 years old, married and has four children. 

Jacinta is a small scale farmer and plants potatoes, indigenous cabbages and carrots. She also keeps poultry. She is borrowing a loan to boost her small scale farming by buying certified seeds and manure. She hopes her crop yield will improve, resulting in more income from improved sales.

She anticipates that she will be able to provide better education for the children and is very happy for Kiva and its lenders. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy seeds and manure that will help improve her crop yield, thus increasing sales.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a 56-year-old married mother of five children, four in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Arsenia has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. Arsenia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish for retailing.

Arsenia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Arsenia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish for retailing

loans.name: Al- Wafa Al- Maror Group

texts.en:
Al- Wafa Al- Maror is a group which consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Masouda is the 37-year-old leader of this group. She has two children and  lives with her family in a very humble house which lacks a lot of home appliances. 

Masouda is a housewife who works inside the home and likes to watch  movies and news when she finishes her works. The T.V is broken and Masouda decided to purchase another one with a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB.

She hopes to open a saving account for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a new T.V.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор уроженка района Хуросон. Она замужем, ей 43 года. Гулбахор воспитывает троих детей. Ее сыновям 12 и 6 лет, а дочери 9 лет. Муж Гулбахор работает за пределами страны, поэтому воспитание детей и ведение хозяйства все на плечах Гулбахор. Она успевает еще и вести животноводческий бизнес. На протяжении 6 лет Гулбахор занимается разведением крупнорогатых скотин, она берет для откорма молодых телят и бычков. В настоящий момент данный бизнес она ведет самостоятельно. Гулбахор до прихода суровых холодов хочет провести ремонт в старом обветшалом коровнике и сеновале, чтобы создать благоприятные условия для своей деятельности. Однако для проведения ремонта у нее нет средств, что послужило причиной обращения за кредитом. Гулбахор верит и надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Gulbahor is a resident of the Khuroson district. She is 43 years old and married. Gulbahor is raising three children. Her sons are 12 and 6 years old, and a daughter is 9 years old. Gulbahor's husband works abroad, and this is why raising the children and running the household lie solely on Gulbahor's shoulders. She is capable of also running an animal husbandry business. Gulbahor has been involved in fattening up cattle for 6 years. She fattens up young calves and bulls. At the present time, she runs this business by herself. Gulbahor wants to make repairs in an old, dilapidated cowshed and hayloft in order to create favorable conditions for her business. However, she does not have money to make these repairs, which is why she requested this loan. Gulbahor believes in and hopes for your support.

loans.use: to repair an old cowshed and hayloft

loans.name: Al-Hodhod Group

texts.en:
The group, Al-Hodhod, consists of four women who live in the city of  Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 90,000 YER from AMB.

Abeer is the group's leader . She is a married woman with seven children who lives with her family in very miserable conditions.  She sells perfume and accessories door-to-door. She earns a small income which is not enough to provide for her children's needs. 

Abeer applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy new perfumes and incense to sell.

Abeer is ambitious and wishes to open a store for sell all kinds of perfume and women's accessories.

loans.use: to buy new perfumes and incense.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat is a 50-year-old married woman. She is involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Musarat has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. With her loan, she wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to boost her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to boost her earnings

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat lives in a populated area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is 39, married, and a mother of 6 children.  She creates embroidery to contribute to the family income, as her husband's salary does not suffice.  What started as a hobby has become a profession, and with her 10 years of experience in embroidery, she is able to make nice and intricate designs skillfully.  

Ishrat wishes to enhance her business by making more embroidery for her customers, but because all of the income is consumed paying off the household expenses, they are left with no money.  She has therefore requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner, to buy raw material for her embroidery work.  She is pleased and hopeful for a positive outcome.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her embroidery work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Edgar Eduardo

texts.es: Edgar de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el posee una llantería ubicada en su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, tiene mucho clientes por su buen trabajo, el esta solicitando un crédito para la comprar de llantas, parches, tubos y pegamentos para llantas para tener mas inventarios y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Edgar, 37, has a house where he lives with his wife and son.  He operates a tire repair business in the yard of his house and says that he lives and works on a well-trafficked street.  He has many regular customers who value the work he does.  Edgar is applying for a loan that he will use to buy supplies--tires, patches, glues, etc.--for carrying on his business.  The investment will allow him to stock supplies for future use and, in turn, grow his business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his tire repair business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Recardo

texts.en:
Recardo is a 51-year-old married man living in the town of Dulag, Leyte.  He is the father of 11 children, with youngest child 8 years old. He earns a living by operating a habal-habal, a two-wheeled vehicle that can carry more than two passengers. It is used especially in remote villages with rough and narrow roads. 

Recardo is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy farming supplies like fertilizer and to pay for motorcycle repair. This will help Recardo improve his services and also improve his farming practice. In this way, he can now provide his customers with smooth rides. The loan will also help Recardo grow and sell more rice. 

In the future, Recardo  dreams of expanding both businesses to improve his status of living and also finance the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies like fertilizer and to pay for motorcycle repair

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha, 27, is married and blessed with 2 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He provides transportation services within Lahore. He is a humble and hardworking person. He has to work day and night to make ends meet. Income from his rickshaw business is the only source of income for the family. His rickshaw stopped working properly due to some malfunction and now it needs repair. But he does not have the money to pay for the repair therefore Martha has requested a loan to help her husband repair his rickshaw and start his transportation service again. 

Martha is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their timely support.

loans.use: To help her husband pay for the repair cost of his rickshaw

loans.name: Jujie

texts.en:
Jujie is 32 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children who are of school age. 
Jujie and her husband earn a living from their motorcycle transport service. The couple has been engaged in this business for eight years already. Jujie earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month from this business activity. She has requested a loan to purchase three tires, three tubes, sprocket and chain sets and bearings for the regular maintenance of their motorcycle. Jujie has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Jujie hopes to acquire an additional motorcycle for hire.

loans.use: To purchase three tires, three tubes, sprocket and chain sets and bearings

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 56 years old and has five children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Virginia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer.

Virginia has been farming rice for 14 years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Marifat

texts.en:
Marifat is a strong woman. She was born in 1973, in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is married and has two children. Marifat, with her husband, has a business of crops. Additionally she gains profits from buying and selling apples. She started her business from dairy products. 

Marifat is planning to hold a wedding party now. She needs the financial support in the amount of 5,000 TJS in order to hold the wedding party. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to hold a wedding party for her daughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in fruits, vegetables, dairy products, green peas, cereal grains, etc.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina has three children and works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business and requests 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ludivina has sustained  her business through  2 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream  which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase  clothing.

loans.name: Maqtari Group

texts.en:
Maqtari is a group which applied for their first loan from Kiva. This group consists of four women who are Mariem, Saeeda, Fatima, and Mayser. The group hasn't completely repaid the first loan but applied for a concurrent loan of 120,000 YER from Kiva lenders.

Mariem is the group's leader and requests a loan to purchase potatoes, cooking oil, and flour to use in her business. Mariem thanks Kiva lenders warmly for their first loan which enabled her to increase her business. Mariem hasn't yet completely returned the first loan and applied for a concurrent loan of 40,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase perfume and incense to resell. She hopes this loan will be funded, too.

loans.use: to purchase perfume and incense.

loans.name: M. Asghar

texts.en:
M. Asghar owns an auto parts shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, and lives near his shop. His shop situated in the automobile spare parts market, and it is challenging for him to sell his product with his competitors. This competition highly affects his daily sales.

To grow his business, income, and compete in the market, he has decided to offer an additional inventory in the form of engine oil of various brands. He hopes that this strategy will work positively as customers are attracted to his new products. He cannot act upon his strategy without some capital, so he has requested a Kiva loan through Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because BRAC provides the facility to empower the poor. He is receiving this second loan from BRAC, as well as Kiva; he positively utilized his last loan for purchasing stylish spare parts.

M. Asghar is a married person and has to look after his young children and sibling, as well, but he hardly spends time among them due to his business. M. Asghar is tension-free after receiving this loan because the BRAC showed him a beam of hope in the darkness. He is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy engine oils of various brands for reselling.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 34-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Saima’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Saima has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some tools for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Saima is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some tools for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: Khursheed is a 60-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Khursheed’s son who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Khursheed has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her son. He wants to replace the auto body and purchase new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Khursheed is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to replace the auto body and purchase new tires for her son's vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, la socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de venta de verduras, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día, la socia continua vendiendo zanahorias, lechuga entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito  para la compra de zanahorias al por mayor.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the Mujeres Emprendedoras community bank.  She has operated a vegetables sales business for some time and says that it is successful because she has worked hard to make it a success.  She sells carrots, lettuce and other vegetables that her customers want.  The business is, she says, her means for helping her family move ahead in the world.
Our member is applying for a loan that she will use to buy wholesale supplies of carrots.  She is grateful to KIVA for providing her the funds to carry on her business and says the investment will help her to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies of carrots for her vegetables sales business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Juan continua dedicándose a su  negocio de agencia de viajes, el socio se siente agradecido por el  crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, él socio continua vendiendo paquetes turísticos para sus clientes  como City Tours, Machupicchu, Valle Sagrado entre otros, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de boletos y entradas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS (Women Entrepreneurs) which is located in the Province and Department of Cusco. Juan continues his work as a travel agent and is grateful for the loan he has received. He is committed to making all of his payments on time. 

The member continues to sell tour packages to his clients such as City Tours, Machu Picchu, Sacred Valley and others. He would like to be able to continue working so that he can continue to support his family. He is asking for the loan so he can buy tickets and entry fees.

loans.use: to purchase tickets and entry fees.

loans.name: Argen

texts.en: Argen has always had enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated land in Tangub, planting commodities like corn and root crops, and has earned good income doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the farmland is ready for planting. Argen knows that she has to get things right to earn more income from this cropping season. In the future, Argen hopes to buy a parcel of land to cultivate to give her farming income a big boost.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

location.town: Tangub - Banglay, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
As a married parent with two children, Lucy .who is 56 years old, works hard to support her family. She is a poultry farmer and also practices dairy farming. Lucy is taking out a loan to purchase animal feed, mineral supplements and to plant Napier grass on an extra plot for her dairy cows. She hopes to gain more profits from the farming business.This will go long way toward helping her support her family and improving their living standard such as providing quality medical care and education for her children.
Lucy is happy for Kiva and the support from its lenders.

loans.use: To buy animal feed, mineral supplements and plant grass on a extra plot of land for her cows.

loans.name: Vanessa Jane

texts.en:
Vanessa Jane is 32 years old, married, and has one child.  She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Vanessa Jane has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Vanessa Jane would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Aida works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell quail eggs business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Aida is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more quail eggs for retailing.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more quail eggs for retailing

loans.name: I Putu

texts.en:
I Putu makes his payment on time. He sells a large amount of rice to the big buyer and he earns a profit. He’s very happy for that. To enlarge his business, I Putu is re-applying for a loan to MUK. With the same loan size of 10,000,000 IDR, he will buy paddy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide, rent a tractor and pay the laborers who work in the rice field. Now it’s starting a rainy season, a good time to plant in the rice field. 

It all costs 15,000,000 IDR, but the rest of 5,000,000 IDR he will take from his savings. With pursuing this business, I Putu hopes to get satisfactory results. He will meet the needs of the family, and he will save all the profits to support his business capital.

loans.use: to buy paddy seeds, fertilizer and insecticides, rent a tractor and pay the labor costs.

loans.name: Calicanto Iii Group

texts.es:
Faviola es una mujer de 28 años de edad, viuda, tiene 2 hijos varónes de 4 y 14 años y una niña de 7 años, y su negocio es la venta de Api (bebida a base de maíz morado).
Ella es buena madre, independiente, optimista, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en la zona ‘central’, un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, y que alberga a universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima templado durante todo el año, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 14-24 grados centígrados.
Faviola es de tez morena, cabello negro como la noche largo y recogido, usa lentes de aumento, su lengua materna es el Quechua y habla español por cultura general y por comercio que realiza. Su vida la realiza con sus hijos, la niña estudia en la escuela al igual que su hijo mayor, su hijo menor el próximo año le corresponde entrar a la escuela, viven en una habitación en alquiler y comparten el baño y la cocina con otros vecinos (sentada a la izquierda, usa blusa color lila, y pantalón celeste). Debido a la necesidad de conseguir una mejor manera de vivir, formó una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio, carnicería, tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de videos y venta de sándwiches, para solicitar un préstamo para invertir en sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de Api (desayuno de maíz morado); Cuando la ciudad todavía duerme y el manto oscuro de la noche está a punto de levantarse para que se inicie un nuevo día, Silvia empieza su jornada en el mercado a la intemperie, y ella sabe que los comensales que habitualmente acuden a su puesto para desayunar no le pedirán café, leche o té, sino que, como ya es habitual en esta época del año, buscarán el api que prepara y que, a decir de uno de sus clientes, ‘solo ella sabe hacer bien’. En una olla grande hace hervir el agua y va sumando los ingredientes hasta lograr el espeso líquido de color morado que luego será acompañado con empanadas fritas y sopaipillas (pan de queso frito). Cerca de las 10 de la mañana ya no queda ni para llenar una taza. “Generalmente tengo que hacer dos ollas, porque en invierno es lo que más buscan…” comenta.  Su sueño es mejorar sus ventas, ella desea realizar la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
 Es por esos motivos que Faviola solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Faviola is a 28-year-old woman, a widow with two male children, ages 4 and 14, and a daughter aged 7. Her business is selling “Api” (a drink made of purple corn).

Faviola is a good mother, independent, optimistic, constant, responsible, and hard-working. She works in the central zone, an area characterized by commerce of all types, plus universities, public offices, and private enterprises, all co-existing side by side. The climate is temperate all your round, varying between 14 and 24 degrees centigrade.

Faviola has a dark complexion, with hair as dark as night, long and attractive. She uses glasses. Her mother tongue is Quechua and she speaks Spanish generally and in her commerce. She lives with her children; the girl studies in school, as does her older son. Her younger son will enter school next year. They live in a rental unit and share the bathroom and kitchen with other neighbors. (In the photo she is seated to the left, wearing a lily-colored blouse and light blue pants.)

Due to the necessity of obtaining a better means of survival, she formed a bank composed of people with businesses such as: selling fried potatoes, selling sports clothes, a local general store, a butcher shop, sewing baby clothing, selling videos, and selling sandwiches, to solicit a loan to invest in their businesses.

Faviola's business sells “Api” (a breakfast made from purple corn). When the city is still asleep and the vale of darkness is about to lift and initiate a new day, Faviola begins her day's work in the public market. She knows that the early customers that come to her post to breakfast will not request coffee, milk or tea, but rather, as is habitual in this season of the year, they will want the “Api” she prepares, and, accordidng to one of her customers, “only she knows how to make it well.” In a large bowl she boils water and adds the ingredients until she has the purple liquid that will accompany fried “empanadas” (stuffed rolls) and “sopaipillas” (fried cheese bread). By 10:00 am, there won't be enough left to fill a cup. “Generally, I have to make two bowls, because in winter this is what they most want...,” she says.

Her dream is to improve sales. She wishes to purchase tables and chairs in order to attend to more customers. This is their third cycle of loans with this institution during the three years it has been engaged in this activity.

So, this is Faviola's motive for soliciting a loan – to buy tables and chairs to serve a larger number of customers.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs in order to attend to a larger quantity of customers.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La socia María Teresa  pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, la socia sigue  dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos, la socia vende casacas, chompas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia María Teresa solicito el crédito para la compra de chompas, polos entre otros.
texts.en:
Our member, María Teresa, belongs to the Mujeres Emprendedoras community bank in Cusco.  She has used past KIVA loans to grow her clothing sales business and is applying for a new loan that she will use to stock the business with shirts, sweaters and other clothing pieces.  The business, she says, is her means of helping her family move ahead in the world.  

María Teresa is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El socio Pedro  se dedica al negocio de bazar,el socio vende regalos y peluches,el socio por medio de estos negocios quiere salir adelante.El socio solicita el credito para comprar adornos y peluches.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Pedro earns his living with a variety store, where he sells gifts and stuffed animals. By means of this business he hopes to get ahead in life. He is seeking a loan in order to buy ornaments and stuffed animals to sell. He is very happy about the loan and is committed to making his repayments.

loans.use: to buy ornaments and stuffed animals.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is a 38-year-old married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than three years now. This is the source of their income.
Maribeth is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, crab nets or cagees. With  a loan, Maribeth and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.
In the future, Maribeth hopes to make their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, crab nets or cages

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 53 years old and lives in San Andres, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children, both adults. 
Nora has been engaged in a hog raising business for eight years. She earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month to help support their family income. She has requested a loan to buy two piglets, two sacks of feeds and dewormer for her pigs. 
Nora has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Nora hopes to expand her hog raising business by acquiring more piglets to supply all meat dealers in her area.

loans.use: To buy two piglets, two sacks of feeds and dewormer

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda has mastered her skills in making bread. She has her own unique bread recipe and she is known for her homemade sweet bread. This has kept her business going for more than three years now. Recently, Imelda requested a loan to buy more kilos of flour, sugar and margarine for bread production. Imelda hopes to expand her business by displaying in more store outlets.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and margarine

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 65 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and has no dependent children.
 
Estelita earns a living from her motorcycle-for-hire business. She’s been engaged in this business for six years already. Estelita earns approximately 2,500 PHP each month from this business. She has requested a loan to pay the renewal fees for her motorcycle registration. Estelita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Estelita hopes to acquire additional motorcycles to rent.

loans.use: To renew her motorcycle registration

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 59 years old, married, and has six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Teresita has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy household goods to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosalina works hard to support her family.

She has a meat-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Rosalina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more meat for her business.

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more meat for retailing

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their 4 children. Currently, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to maximize customers and generate a healthier source of income. Khalida is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to maximize customers and generate a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 54 years old and has eight children. Lydia is married and one of her children is in school.

Lydia is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Lydia has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lydia has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a 34-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Nazia’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Nazia has applied for a loan of 40.000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires along with spare parts and tools for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Nazia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with spare parts and tools for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Sanober

texts.en:
Sanober  is a 43-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Sanober  makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR which she will use  to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Sanober  wishes to utilize part of her revenues to provide a good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market to sell in her store

loans.name: Riaz Hussain

texts.en:
Riaz Hussain is the age of 38. He is an honest person living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. For many years, he has been a milkman by profession, selling both milk in his locality and bull calves to the butcher, generating reasonable income for his family. All his efforts are to provide comfort to his family members.

Riaz Hussain has a few buffalo and cows, from which he produces milk two times a day. He provides door-to-door milk to his customers and takes money on a monthly basis. He found that he can get more milk from his buffalo, so he has made a plan to buy buffalo. The price of a buffalo is more than a cow, however, and he does not have enough savings for the purchase. Therefore, Riaz Hussain requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to buy one additional buffalo for producing more milk. With the profit, he will be able to generate more income and build a cowshed, as well.

Riaz Hussain thanks to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional buffalo for producing more milk to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Haider

texts.en:
The person who is shown in the picture is named Haider.  He is 28 years old and living in the popular area of Karachi, Pakistan.  He is a distributor by profession and has been running an egg distribution shop for many years. His customers are retailers, restaurants, households, etc.

His business is not doing very well lately due to a shortage of sufficient financing as he loses customers and is unable to deliver orders in a timely fashion.  His shop is situated in an underpopulated area where there are a lot of customers available. He finds this as an opportunity and wants to target them for egg distribution. In this way he plans to excel. 

Therefore, he has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. Haider is very glad of the offer to receive this loan and is hopeful that he will have success in fulfilling each request from his customers and abstain from disappointment. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase eggs in bulk quantity for his shop

loans.name: M. Zakria

texts.en:
M. Zakria is a 42-year-old married man. He lives with his spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

He is a turner by profession, manufacturing and renewing spare parts of vehicles. He has been operating a lathe machine for many years; however, his lathe machine has become out of order due to continuously working and needs maintenance. He has spent all of his savings to buy raw material for manufacturing spare parts and does not have cash in hand to fix the lathe machine.

M. Zakria has requested a loan so that he can fix the lathe. He is relaxed now and hopes that he can easily operate his machine once again. He is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to fix a lathe machine

loans.name: Santiraja Shg Group

texts.en:
Rajani is 26 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a small village of the Koraput district of Odisha, India. Currently, she belongs to the Santiraja Shg group which is made up of ten responsible and entrepreneurial women. 

Rajani makes a living selling groceries. She also earns her living selling food like samosa, bada, upma etc. Her husband helps in her business by purchasing grocery items from wholesalers. She will use this loan to buy rice, edible oil, milk, and spices in bulk. 

The Santiraja Shg group thanks the people who make this loan possible. Rajani is the person sitting down and raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy rice, edible oil, milk, and spices in bulk.

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en: Arshad is 39 years old and the mother of two children. Her husband owns a firewood shop for which he purchases wood and cuts it into usable pieces with a splitting axe. He sells firewood mostly to chefs who cook meals for ceremonies and events but also to consumers who have to face frequent shortfalls of gas and like to have firewood for cooking. Now that the winter season is starting, demand for firewood is increasing. He wants to buy more wood to cut into easily utilized pieces to sell. Therefore, his wife Arshad, requests a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful to both organizations.

loans.use: to enhance in her husband's firewood business

loans.name: M. Rafiq

texts.en:
M. Rafiq owns a shop in which he sells spare parts for motorbikes, including brake shoes, brake levers, hubs, rims, mud guards, filters, chains, head lights, batteries, etc. He has been in this business for many years and is earning a sufficient amount to afford household expenses. 

He has to support his family and old parents, also. The spare parts shop is his single source of income. He estimated his future expenses and came to realize that he needs to grow his business to be able to easily cope with future expenses. Therefore, M. Rafiq has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so he can grow his inventories.

M. Rafiq is the father of six children; some of them are very young and fully dependent upon their parents. He hopes that he will be successful in his future planning and that this loan will prove beneficial for his business. M. Rafiq thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy brake shoes, brake levers, hubs, rims, mud guards, filters, chains, head lights, batteries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, la socia  Natividad continua enseñando en un colegio por la zona, la socia es docente de profesión, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma salir adelante, la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyar a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito  para la compra de un electrodoméstico.
texts.en:
The member, Natividad, belongs to the communal bank “Women Entrepreneurs”, and continues to work at a school in her neighborhood. She is a teacher by profession and wishes to be able to continue working so she can get ahead. Natividad is very grateful to KIVA for allowing her to continue with her work and to support her family.

She is asking for this loan so she can buy an appliance for her household.

loans.use: to buy a household appliance.

loans.name: Asster

texts.en:
Asster  is 45 years old; she is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. 

She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. 

She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. 

For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. 

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Mansoor

texts.en:
Mansoor, 45, is married and the father of two children. He owns a gold jewelry shop. He is hardworking and honest.

Due to an increase in demand for gold jewelry, Mansoor wants to purchase gold to making sets, rings, etc., for his shop to attract more customers and retain the existing ones. The demand for gold jewelry fluctuates with the changes in prices of gold. Currently the gold prices have gone down, so demand for gold jewelry has increased.

Gold is mostly given to daughters at weddings and festive occasions in Pakistan. It is thought of as a saving that can be resold in case of any need or emergency. Given the increase in demand, he is getting more gold jewelry orders but he is short of funds right now.

This loan will help him boost his business and increase his market outreach. Mansoor is glad to receive this loan and hopeful that he will have success to fulfill all the orders of his customers. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase gold for his shop

loans.name: Marag

texts.en:
Marag  is a 41-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. 

Marag is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra  is a 51-year-old married woman. She has two children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. 

She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells it to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. 

Bushra  expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 42-year-old married woman with 6 children. She is a housewife and  lives in a populated area of Lahore. Her husband sells pressure cookers that are widely used in Pakistan  to quickly  cook food. This small business earns enough to buy his family bread and others necessities. 

He now wants to enhance his business by buying a variety of pressure cookers and other related items. Anwar has requested  a loan to help her husband. She is pleased and hopes that this loan will prove to be beneficial for the growth of the business.

loans.use: to improve  her husband's  business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.es: La socia Jane  se dedica al negocio de farmacia,la socia vende medicamentos ,la socia trabaja en la farmacia desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de farmacia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar medicamentos para la farmacia.
texts.en:
Member, Jane, works in a pharmacy selling medications. Her hours are from 8:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. The business is going very well for her and she hopes it will help her to get ahead.

Jane's dream is to expand her pharmacy business. She is asking for the loan so she can buy medicine for the pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy medicine for the pharmacy.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca, an industrious mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell. This way, she will be able to sell more products, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 56 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

Nenita has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from vinegar retailing. Nenita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with twelve children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gloria is 44 years old.

Gloria has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

Gloria has been in this business for five years. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Zipporah, who is 40 years old, works tirelessly to support her family. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012 to acquire skills such as business management, savings and financial management, which have helped her improve her life. She farms maize, potatoes and also operates a cafe business.
She is taking out a Kiva loan to expand her cafe business by adding to her stock of flour, sugar and vegetables. This will ensure she prepares adequate food in her cafe to meet the demand of her customers and earn more income. She hopes that the anticipated income will improve her life and that she will be able to educate her children and provide them with basic needs, such as food and clothing. 
Zipporah is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the support

loans.use: To buy more flour, sugar and vegetables for her cafe to improve her income.

loans.name: Mehwish

texts.en:
Mehwish  is a 28-year-old,single woman who works hard to help her family. She has been  a tailor for many years.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

She requests 40,000 PKR  to buy spools of threads in different colors, packs of zippers, and buttons  to sew more dresses. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to cover personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy  spools of threads in different colors,  packs of zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia  is a 41-year-old married woman. Her  husband  is a driver and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has driven a rickshaw for many years.  The rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it functional and she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. 

The loan will be used to purchase new tires to provide better transportation service to his passengers. 

Shazia  is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Maqbool

texts.en:
Maqbool is a 41-year-old married woman with 4 children. She is trying hard to meet their food, health, clothing, and education needs.  

She and her husband have farmed for three years. They provide good quality wheat and sugar to the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She requests a loan to purchase different types of seeds,  packs of insecticides, and pesticides.  This would help her to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds, packs of insecticides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items for her general store to resell.

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor is 51 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Eleanor has borrowed and repaid loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing nets.

Mercedes has been in this business for 16 years now.

In the future, Mercedes would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of fishing nets

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan de 42 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene cuatro hijos, tres de ellos estudiando, él estudió hasta 6° grado de educación básica, no siguió con sus estudios porque no tenía la capacidad económica para pagarlos y la escuela estaba muy retirada de su casa. Juan únicamente vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos.

Juan es comerciante, tiene un molino de nixtamal desde hace 28 años que administra con su familia, tomo la iniciativa de este negocio al ver que vive en una zona muy poblada y que había la necesidad de un molino cercano. Su horario de trabajo es en dos jornadas de 8:00 am a 11:00 am y de 3:00 pm a 5:00 pm.


Solicita el préstamo para el negocio de pupuseria que inicio su esposa, va a comprar una cocina de plancha (con la que inicio es prestada) bebidas, quesillo, maíz y otros detalles. Juan sueña con comprar mas tolvas para su molino y  también moler café, harinas y otros productos para dar mejor servicio, espera lograrlo gracias al negocio que espera le dé buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Juan, 42, has a companion and four children, three of whom are students. He studied until 6th grade and then stopped because he didn't have the financial means to pay for his schooling and it was far away. Juan lives with his companion and four children.

Juan is a businessman. He has had a corn mill for the last 28 years that he runs with his family. He started this business when he realized he lived in a very populated area and there was a need for a mill close by. His work schedule is 8am to 11am and 3pm to 5pm.

He is requesting this loan for the pupusería (corn tortillas with different fillings) business his wife started. He will buy a griddle (the one he currently uses is borrowed), drinks, cheese, corn and other items. Juan dreams of buying more hoppers (recipients) for his mill and also wants to grind coffee, flour and other products in order to provide a better service. He hopes to reach his goals thanks to his business, which he hopes will be successful.

loans.use: buy a griddle, drinks, cheese, corn and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Henry Noel

texts.es: Henry de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la venta de golosinas (dulces, galletas, chocolates, bombones, etc.) distribuye su producto en las diferentes tienda y tiene clientes ya establecidos, el esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas golosinas por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Henry is 34 years old and lives in his own home with his family. 

Henry makes a living selling all kinds of candies, including sweets, biscuits, chocolates, and bombones. He distributes his products to various stores and has established clients. 

Henry is requesting a new loan in order to buy more wholesale candies and thus continue with his sales and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy sweets, biscuits, chocolates, bombones, etc.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 29-year-old single woman. In order to support the needs of her family members, she started a tailoring business six years ago. She has attained a good number of customers and has become famous on her street for her finely-stitched clothes. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase more spools of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons, and laces. These items will help her meet orders on time and earn a good amount of income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Naseem hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons, and laces

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 53 year old fisherman from Concepcion, Iloilo. Jose is a married man and has been in business for more than 20 years now. Fishing is his main source of income. He also runs a small sari-sari or retail store business.

Jose is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. Also more stock like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries. With a loan, Jose will be able to improve his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. Moreover, he will be able improve his inventory in his store thus attracting more buyers to his store.

In the future, Jose hopes of making his business a success. Moreover, he wants to save some of his earnings for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. Also more stock like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries,.

loans.name: Mapesheni Group

texts.en:
Pili, who is in her early 40s is married with two children who are still in school. She has been running several projects, a genge (grovery stall), charcoal sales and a bodaboda (motorcycle taxi). She has been in business for three years now. She works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Pili's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and restock the missing items in the genge. She dreams of building her house.

Pili will share this loan with her loan group "Mapesheni" which consists of nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and restock missing items in her genge (grocery stall).

loans.name: Rigoberto Pedro

texts.es:
El socio Rigoberto Pedro  se dedica al negocio de bazar y tambien el socio vende artesania,el socio vende regalos y peluches,el socio por medio de estos negocios quiere salir adelante.El socio solicita el credito para comprar adornos y peluches.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The associate, Rigoberto Pedro, runs a bazaar business, selling crafts, gifts and stuffed toys. He hopes to move forward in life with the help of his business. He is requesting a loan to buy decorations and stuffed toys.

Rigoberto is thankful for the loan and promises to pay the installments.

loans.use: buy decorations and stuffed toys.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en: In the year 2009, Paz learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives. As a farmer in Mahayag, Molave, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to start her rice production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Paz feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Paz wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tursabubu

texts.ru: Турсабубу успешно погасила кредит, использовав его по назначению, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании, на сегодняшний день у Турсабубу есть 3 коровы, 2 теленка, 7 овец. Доходы от животноводства в прошлом году позволили Турсабубу накопить средства на приобретение автомобиля. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Турсабубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Турсабубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Tursabubu successfully repaid her loan after using it as directed. She is grateful to the Kiva Fund and everyone, who had helped her with the financing. Today, Tursabubu has 3 cows, 2 calves and 7 sheep. Last year's earnings from the animal husbandry business allowed Tursabubu to save money to buy a car. In order to further develop her business, Tursabubu requested a loan in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount. Tursabubu plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock quantities and saving money for her children's continued education.

loans.use: to buy sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 42 years old and married with four children, two in school.

Jennifer works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jennifer has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Jennifer aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
A USD 800 loan is offered to Elisa to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like a refrigerator, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, sagiko, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, body lotion, shampoo and water. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business.  She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, sagiko, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, body lotion, shampoo and water.

loans.name: Silvia Gabriela

texts.es:
Silvia es una mujer de 25 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de zapatos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, generosa, amable, independiente, activa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en la zona Sur de la ciudad. Un área caracterizada por el comercio informal y la manufactura, de clima cálido tropical; con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Silvia es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello largo color castaño, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de zapatos como; zapatos deportivos, de vestir, mocasines, botines, tacones para mujer, de charol, etc. Labor que realiza durante todas la semana sin descanso de forma ambulante, ofreciendo sus productos a peatones y trabajadores de oficinas, restaurantes, y personas que trabajan en todo tipo de comercio. Sus productos mayormente de cuero son de gran competencia porque se ocupa de buscar los mejores y más atractivos tanto para varones como mujeres. “conozco las nuevas tendencias porque ando informada en mi rubro y sé que modelo viene bien para cada ocasión…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda propia bajo techo para dejar de ambular. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio por motivo de las fiestas de fin de año, para contar con variedad de modelos en todos los tamaños y así generar mejores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. Esta es la 1 secuencia  de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Silvia solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de zapatos por mayor para complacer a sus clientes y generar bienestar en su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia, 25, has a 6-year old son.  She is a single mother and has a shoes sales business.  She is friendly, generous, enterprising, hard-working and a good mother to her little boy.  She works as a street vendor in the south part of the city, an area characterized by small commercial and manufacturing businesses.  The local climate is tropical and daily temperatures range from 21- to 35-degrees Centigrade (or 70- to 95-degrees Fahrenheit).
Silvia is medium-height and brown-skinned with long brown hair.  Her first language is Guaraní but she speaks Spanish, as well.  She and her son live in a rented house and have water, electricity and sewer services.  Silvia sells all kinds of shoes: sports shoes, dress shoes, slip-ons, high-heels and others.  She works every day, with few breaks, going from street to street, office to office, restaurant to restaurant, selling to whoever she can draw in.  She works hard to find good merchandise and her shoes are well-made and mostly of leather.  She sells shoes for both men and women and says, "I follow the latest fashions and know what to recommend for every occasion".  For the future, she hopes to open a shop of her own so that she no longer has to work as a street vendor.  
Silvia is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with various models and sizes of shoes that she can sell over the coming holidays.  The investment will provide her with a means to increase her income and better support her family.  
Silvia started her business 4 years ago and this is her first loan from the bank.

loans.use: to stock her shoes sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 49 years old and married. She is from Bintana, Tangub City, Philippines. Rosalinda has a food-vending business and has earned approximately PHP 4,000 each month for two years. This is how she has helped her husband in meeting their needs. Rosalinda wants to provide her family a durable and comfortable living space. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase bags of cement to complete her house. Rosalinda has recently become an active member of PMPC. Now, she is on her way to finishing her house.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement for to complete her house.

location.town: Tangub - Bintana, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is 59 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children, both adults. 
Pedrita has earned a living from a snack vending business for more than six years. Pedrita earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month from this business activity. She has requested a loan to buy additional varieties of snacks for retail. Pedrita has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Pedrita hopes to innovate her business products to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy additional varieties of snacks for retail

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, is 49 years old, married and blessed with five children. She has a business vegetable farming where she plants kale and cabbage. She also does dairy farming. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on financial management and enterprise development.
She is taking out a loan to buy dairy feed to help improve milk productivity and earn income from improved sales. The anticipated income will assist Florence in supporting her family's basic needs and also in paying school fees for the children.
She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the great support.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed to improve milk productivity and increase her income for family needs.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS, él socio tiene 47 años de edad, él socio continua  dedicándose al negocio de agencia de viajes, él socio continua vendiendo paquetes turísticos para sus clientes  como City Tours, Machupicchu, Valle Sagrado entre otros, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
EL socio solicito el crédito para la compra de boletos turísticos.
El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our member, 47, belongs to the MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS community bank.  He sells tour packages for tours around the city, to Machu Picchu, to Valle Sagrado and other local sites.  He has used past loans to grow his business and is applying for a new loan that he will use to buy tourist passes.  He hopes to carry on the business and says that it is his means of supporting his family.  
Our member is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy tourist passes for his tourism business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for the family agricultural land

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 54 years old and has one child.

Milagros works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, junk food, and other groceries.

Milagros has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from fruit vending.

Milagros aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, junk food, and groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goats to raise and resell

loans.name: Fe En Dios Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FE EN DIOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yanett ella es soltera y tiene 37 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de fotocopiadora, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Fe en Dios" (Faith in God) Communal Bank, located in the Cusco District, Province and Department, Peru.

Yanett is one of the members. She is single, 37 years old, and has two children. She has a restaurant business, where she prepares different dishes such as chicken with potato, soups, and stir-fried meats. She works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. She has had this business for 10 years, and it is going very well for her; her dream is to expand the restaurant. She is seeking her portion of the loan in order to buy ingredients for cooking, such as chicken, meat and vegetables. 

The other members have businesses such as photocopying services, selling clothing, general stores, and restaurants.

(The member who is pasted in the corner of the group photo had to have her photo taken after the meeting, due to her work commitments.)

Yanett is grateful to all those who are part of her dream through Kiva, and she promises to make make her repayments in the proper installments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Nhóm 05  Thôn Thạch Bắc Xã Quảng Thạch Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nên operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tools to catch fish for sale.

Nên is 36 years old and married with four children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 05 Thôn Thạch Bắc Xã Quảng Thạch Solidarity Group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Nên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nên has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Nên has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Nên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Nên hopes to maintain a successful business, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to catch fish for sale.

loans.name: Nhóm 11 Cụm Thạch Bắc Xã Quảng Thạch Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huyền operates a food stall selling fish. She has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Huyền is 28 years old and married with two children. She lives with two dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Huyền is the group leader of the Nhóm 11 Cụm Thạch Bắc Xã Quảng Thạch Solidarity Group, which consists of six members.

In 2013, Huyền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Huyền has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Huyền hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Asteria works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Asteria is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials to use for her fishing business.

Asteria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials to use

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 45 years old and has three children, two in school, Aida works very hard to provide for her family.

Aida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods and groceries..

Aida has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Aida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods and groceries

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a repair shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her repair shop business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 8 years. She earns more income from farming vegetables, and buying and selling recycled materials.

Elizabeth successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her shop

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 46 years old and married with three children, with one of them in school. Emily works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Emily has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Emily would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Aidai

texts.en:
Aidai is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Psychology. Here is her story:
