I have the dearest mom in the world. My parents divorced when I was four years old, and my mother brought me up alone. We live with my grandmother, who is a pensioner. She has health problems and high blood pressure. She gets a limited state pension, which is not enough for her medicine, and she needs regular treatment. My father doesn’t help us, and he didn’t pay alimony. My mother relied just on herself and has done her best to raise me and support my grandmother.

AUCA is a highly prestigious university in the region, with a solid core curriculum and high academic ranking. I believe that it is the best university in Kyrgyzstan. It has none of the flaws common for local institutions, such as bribery, dishonesty, and plagiarism. I always dreamed of studying at AUCA. Unfortunately, my mother is a single parent, and can’t afford to pay a full tuition. 

I am really excited to become a part of this special community. I have chosen my path, but it has a lot of bumps, due to the high cost of university tuition. I hope that Kiva lenders will help me with my aspiration to be a student. I promise to study hard and be an active participant in any events. I have a good dancing and drawing skills, which allow me to contribute in AUCA’s social life, and contribute to a nice atmosphere among the students. I would appreciate careful consideration of my request for a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Tatiana Nicole

texts.es:
Tatiana tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, vive con sus esposo y su hijo en el canton Guaranda en la provincia de Bolivar.

Solicita el credito para la terminacion de la construccion de la casa o media agua que es mixta y le falta comprar el techo las compras realiza en ambato.  quiere terminar su casita para pasarse a viver para ya no pagar arriendo por es caro y no le alcansa por que es empleada domestica y quiere que sus hijos tenga una casita propia.
en su tiempo libre le gusta dormir y salir a pasearse.
texts.en:
Tatiana is 27 years old, married, and has a five-year-old child. She lives with her husband and child in the canton of Guaranda in Bolivar Province.

Tatiana is requesting a loan so that she can finish the construction of her house with a slanted roof that is half completed. She will acquire the supplies in Ambato. Tatiana wants to complete her house so that she can begin living in it. She does not want to pay rent since it is expensive. Tatiana works as a domestic employee so the rent is no longer affordable. She also wants her children to live in a home of their own.

In her free time, Tatiana enjoys taking naps and going out for walks.

loans.use: to finish the construction of her house.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a 36-year-old mother of four children, living in Mundri County, Western Equatoria, state region of South Sudan. A loan of 1,600 SSP helps Lilian to buy more goods to sell, earning income to pay school fees for her children and pay the rent.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Sayram

texts.ru: Сайраму 49 лет. Она жена и мать восьмерых детей. У Сайрама большая семья. Семья состоит из ее мужа, пятеро сыновей, трое дочек и двух невесток. Сайрам занимается растениеводством. Это семейный бизнес. Данной деятельностью занимались ее предки и предки мужа, и ее дети тоже работают в этой сфере деятельности. 60% населения Таджикистана занимаются сельскохозяйственными деятельностями. Работать на земле Сайрам научилась от своей свекрови. На данный момент Сайрам готовиться к очередному посеву. На этот раз она посеет пшеницу и арбузы. Из-за того что ей не хватила денежных средств на приобретение семян арбуза, пшеницы и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Sayram is 49 years old. She is married and a mother of eight children. Sayram has a big family, consisting of her husband, five sons, three daughters and two daughters-in-law. Sayram is involved in agriculture. This is a family business. Her and her husband's ancestors were involved in this business, and Sayram's children also work in this field. 60% of Tajikistan are involved in agriculture. Sayram learned how to work on the field from her mother-in-law. At the present time, Sayram is preparing to plant the next crop. This time, she will plant wheat and watermelons. She is requesting this loan because she does not have enough money to buy watermelon and wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy watermelon and wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Cellia

texts.en:
Maria Cellia is a 36-year-old married woman, and the mother of five children. She is from Concepcion, Iloilo. Maria Cellia has been engaged in the fishing business, with her husband, for more than 12 years. Fishing is the source of their income. Maria Cellia is standing next to fishing nets in the photo. 
Maria Cellia is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat. This loan will help them improve their catch, giving them more fish to sell in the market.
In the future, Maria Cellia hopes to make their fishing business a success. She wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat

loans.name: Guadalupe De Jesus

texts.es: Guadalupe una mujer de 49 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo mayor de edad que le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Ella se gana la vida con la recolección y posterior venta de productos reciclables como: papel, plástico, hierro, cobre, latas, aluminio, etc. Guadalupe desea realizar mejoras al techo y piso de su vivienda, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, cemento, arena y ladrillo para realizar mejoras en el techo y piso de su vivienda lo antes posible, para lo cual espera contar con el apoyo de este crédito.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a 49-year-old woman who resides in her own home along with her adult son who helps with the household expenses. She earns her living by collecting and reselling recyclable goods such as paper, plastic, iron, copper, tin, aluminum, and other items.

Guadalupe wants to make improvements to the roof and floor of her house. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will invest in galvanized metal sheets, cement, sand, and bricks so that she can make these improvements to the roof and floor of her home possible. She hopes to receive assistance through this loan.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, cement, sand, and bricks so that she can repair the roof and floor of her home.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 48 years old and lives in Baga, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children of adult age.

Gina has been engaged in coconut buying and the coconut charcoal processing business for 18 years already. She earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of business activity. This amount is very helpful in supporting her financial needs. She has requested a loan to be used in buying more coconut shells for charcoal processing and retailing.

Gina has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Gina hopes to expand her coconut buying and coconut charcoal processing business.

loans.use: to buy more coconut shells for charcoal processing.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 28 years old and has one child.

Marissa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, condiments, beverages, and other goods.

Marissa has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from a loading station.

Marissa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, condiments, beverages, and similar goods.

loans.name: Judite

texts.en:
Judite is the owner of Jhass-K Production, a cosmetic company that is manufacturing a variety of beauty and body products in Haiti. Over the years, the owner has gained popularity through the package and the utility of her products.

Her first loan was used to purchase labels in large quantity. In response, the enterprise was able to catch a segment of the market. Now, Judite needs to meet its customers’ expectations in terms of production. Tons of customers would like to buy more from her. That’s why she turns to Zafen for a second loan.

Judite’s passion for nature began when her daughter got ringworms. Using a mixture of natural oils under careful advice, she has created an efficient medicine solution, which has healed her daughter. Thus, she replicated the formula of that same medication to help other people affected by ringworms. As a result, many customers realize that Judite’s products make their hair healthier. From that, she was encouraged by her customers to open her business.

Judite made connections to export her products to friends and relatives in the United States. She had her first exposure to the national market in 2009. Judite participated in empowering rural women. Your contribution will help her buy equipment, create two part-time jobs, and move forward.

loans.use: to purchase a grinding machine, a generator, one industrial oven plus accessories, five plastic containers, and two plastic drums.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is 59 years old and married with eight children.

Maxima works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, and other groceries.

Maxima has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Maxima aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, and other groceries.

loans.name: Meerikan

texts.ru: Мээрикан, 52 года, замужем, мать 5 детей. У нее среднее образование, много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Дети активно помогают матери. В хозяйстве Мээрикан на сегодняшний день есть 2 коровы, а также на собственном земельном наделе мерою 0,78 ГА, она выращивает кукурузу и картофель. Ежемесячный доход Мээрикан составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, часть средств направит на покупку семян картофеля. Доходы от бизнеса помогут улучшить благосостояние Мээрикан и ее семьи и увеличить сарай для скота.
texts.en: Meerikan is 52, married, and a mother of five children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and has been a crop and livestock farmer for many years.  Her children actively help their mother.  Currently, Meerikan has two cows on her farm in addition to 0.78 hectares of her own land for growing corn and potatoes, and her monthly income is 10,000 som.  To further develop her farm, she's requested a loan of 100,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy more livestock as well as potato seeds with a portion of the money.  The income she'll earn from her business will help Meerikan improve her and her family's well-being and expand her livestock barn.

loans.use: buy additional livestock and potato seeds

loans.name: Ka Laug Ta Yar Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Pyi Taw Tar Village in Myanmar’s Ayeyarwaddy Delta region.  The Community Based Organization (CBO) consists of five committee members overseeing 30 village customers. This new loan would help the Ka Laug Ta Yar Village Group members purchase more ducks and buy duck feed (one packet is $14, feeding 100 ducks for six days). More ducks will increase income from more duck eggs.

Pictured above are committee members from the Ka Laug Ta Yar Village CBO, named U Khin, U Aung, Daw Chaw, Daw Hla and Ma Tin. Apart from raising ducks, most of the villagers are farmers and especially do cropping. Some of the women make handmade bags for extra income and every villager raises pigs and hens as livestock. 

Included in photo is 45 year-old Daw Hla (in the middle), who is married and has two children. She and her husband are farmers as well. Her income comes not only from farming, but also from betel nuts and livestock. Like other members, Daw Hla will use the loan to buy more food for ducks to enable more egg hatching, hoping to command a higher price for her ducks.

loans.use: to help Ka Laug Ta Yar Community’s 30 villagers purchase ducks as well as high-quality feed.

borrowers.first_name: Ka Laug Ta Yar Village Group

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia Bernardina se dedica al negocio de venta de helados, la socia vende helados de diferentes sabores como fresa, leche y chocolate, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante y sacar adelante a su familia,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local para vender los helados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar helados.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bernardina has a business of selling ice cream. She offers different flavors such as strawberry, vanilla, and chocolate. Through her business, Bernardina wants to move forward and help her family get ahead. She has been in business for eight years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell ice cream.

Bernardina is requesting a loan so that she can buy ice cream. She is pleased to receive this loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly is married with six children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. Milly has had a business selling charcoal for 12 years. She sells to all types of people, on both a retail and a wholesale basis. She generates additional income from poultry farming. Milly has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal and poultry feed. She works seven days a week. Milly's major monthly business expenses include transportation, and one of her challenges is seasonality. She is aspiring to build more rooms for poultry farming. Milly resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es: Berta es una mujer de 44 años de edad que se gana la vida con la crianza y posterior venta de gallina india y pollo actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 21 años de edad que le brinda todo su apoyo. Berta sabe que la mejor temporada para su negocio es en navidad es por eso que ella desea invertir en su negocio para poder aprovechar la época y obtener mejores ingresos y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: gallinas indias, pollos, concentrado y vitaminas para tener una mayor cantidad de productos que ofrecerle a su clientela.
texts.en:
Berta is a 44-year-old woman who makes a living raising and selling cornish hens and chickens. She has been doing this for eight years.
She lives in her own home with her 21-year-old son who gives her all his support. Berta knows that the best time for her business is Christmastime, so she wants to invest in her business in order to take advantage of the season and make a greater income. For this, she needs a loan from FUSAI to invest in cornish hens, chickens, chicken feed and vitamins in order to have more products to offer her clients.

loans.use: to invest in cornish hens, chickens, chicken feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
Ma. Dolores is 54 years old and has nine children. She is married, and four of her children are in school.

Ma. Dolores is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Dolores has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Dolores would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jomratie

texts.en:
Jomratie is a 51-year-old married woman with five children.

She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. Jomratie is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers for her coconut plantation.

Jomratie has been farming coconut for 14 years, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business .

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her coconut plantation

loans.name: Santos Aurelia

texts.es: Doña Santos, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene  4 hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes.  Hace mas de 15 años que estableció su propio negocio de  venta de comidas, vende pollo frito, tajadas, baleadas, tacos, sopas, agua y refrescos. Esta actividad la realiza en su casa. Ella esta solicitando otro préstamo y es por 17,000 Lempiras para surtir de materia prima como carnes, arroz, vegetales, frijoles,  harina, manteca, condimentos, refrescos, agua etc. Para elaborar la comida y vender. Ella considera que esta inversión le va ayudar a crecer y aumentar las ventas. Su meta es ayudar a su familia, a sus hijos con el estudio y que el negocio crezca.
texts.en: Doña Santos is 53. She is a single mother with four children and lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. She started her own business over 15 years ago, where she sells food such as fried chicken, fried plantains, “baleadas” (tortillas stuffed with beans and served with other condiments), tacos, soup, water, and pop. She runs the business from her home. She is requesting another loan for 17,000 lempiras to stock up on basic staples such as meat, rice, vegetables, beans, flour, butter, condiments, pop, water, etc, in order to make and sell food. She thinks that this investment will help her to expand her business and increase her sales. Her goal is to help her family, to help her children with their studies, and for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy beans, meat, rice, vegetables, flour, butter, condiments, pop, water, etc to make food for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to fix his damaged home.

loans.name: Cristina Jhomaira

texts.es:
Cristina tiene 22 años de edad es soltera vive con sus padres en el canton guaranda, Provincia de Bolivar.
Solicita el credito para la compra de una cocina industrial ya que la que tenia se daño y quiere una mejor con un papera incluida, su sueño es tener un negocio de ropa para mejorar su calidad de vida y construir una familia estable.
En su tiempo libre de gusta ir a una piscina a nadar.
texts.en:
Cristina is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the canton of Guaranda, which is in Bolivar Province. She is requesting a loan in order to buy an industrial oven since the one she currently has is in disrepair. Cristina would like to have a better oven with a food warmer included.

Her dream is to have a clothing business so that she can improve her quality of life and build a stable family. In her free time, she enjoys going out to the pool for a swim.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in chickens, cornish hens, chicken feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Rosa Irma

texts.es:
Rosa de 59 años, está casada y tiene tres hijos de 45, 40 y 32 años de edad, cada uno con familia y dos con hogar propio. Estudió hasta 2° grado de educación básica, su esposo trabaja como albañil, vive con un hijo y una nieta.

Rosa es comerciante, vende frutas y verduras, además en esta temporada navideña vende gallinas, antes vendía comida frente a un centro penal pero por causas de la delincuencia tuvo que dejar el negocio. Todas las mañanas sale a vender gallinas u fruta a las comunidades vecinas más cercanas y por las tardes va a los cantones a comprar gallinas para luego venderlas, lo hace con la ayuda de un hijo que tiene un vehículo.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar más aves, en esta temporada es cuando tienen el mejor precio de venta y es cuando más se venden y quiere aprovecha esa oportunidad para hacer negocio, después con las ganancia y pasada la temporada invertirá en la venta habitual. Espera Dios le preste vida para seguir trabajando y mantener al nieto que le han dejado ya que su esposo está en el extranjero.
texts.en:
Rosa, 59, is married and has three children aged 45, 40 and 32 years; they have their own families and two have their own homes. She finished her elementary education. Her husband is a bricklayer. She lives with one of her sons and his daughter.

Rosa is a businesswoman. She sells fruit and vegetables, and during the Christmas season, she sells hens. She used to sell in front of a penal centre, but because of delinquency she had to leave her business. Every morning she goes out to sell hens or fruit to the closest surrounding areas and in the afternoons she goes to buy hens so she can sell them later; she does this with the help of a son who has a car.

She is requesting this loan to buy more hens. She'd like to take advantage of the fact that during this time of year, they have the best selling price and more are sold. After the season has passed, with her earnings, she will invest in her regular sales. She hopes God will help her continue working and maintaining her granddaughter, whose father is in another country.

loans.use: buy more hens.

loans.name: Marile

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Marile works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from raising pigs. Marile is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials to use in her motorcycle transport business.

Marile has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaline is 43 years old and married with eight children.

Rosaline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Rosaline has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Rosaline aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 47 years old and has four children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Rosemarie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Rosemarie has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina has successfully built her general store business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fifth loan cycle and has applied a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more stock of grains, sugar, milk, tea and cleaning products. This will enable her to increase her sales to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of grains, sugar, milk, tea and cleaning products to increase her sales to gain more profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in fruits, vegetables, spare parts for electronics, and tools.

loans.name: Nhóm 01-Thạch Ngọc-Quảng Thạch Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuyến works in agriculture, raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Xuyến is 51 years old and she is married, with five children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 01-Thạch Ngọc-Quảng Thạch solidarity group, which consists of nine members. Xuyến lives with no dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Xuyến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Xuyến has been involved in her business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Xuyến hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie is from Baybay, Leyte. She is 32 years old and married with three children ages 3, 8 and 15. Eight years ago she started investing in the hog raising and transportation business. She does all this with the help of her husband. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy piglets, feed and tires. Melanie knows the value of available inputs needed in their business. This will give them enough time to look after their business and maximize their income for their family. In the future, she hope to be successful in raising her children and giving them an education.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and tires

loans.name: Rosa Abigail

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer de 28 años de edad que desde muy temprano sale a ganarse el pan de cada día en su negocio de venta de verduras el cual realiza en el mercado municipal desde hace 3 años, sintiéndose feliz de contar con una buena cantidad de clientes. Ella actualmente habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 3 pequeños hijos de 12, 6 y 3 años de edad, al igual que su compañero de vida. Rosa sabe que a pesar del apoyo económico que le brinda su esposo la mayor fuente de ingresos que tiene es su negocio, y sobre todo en época navideña que es cuando más expectativas de venta tiene, por lo que ella desea tener mayor cantidad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tomates, chile verde, cebollas, pepino, papas, güisquiles, etc. Para tener mayor variedad y cantidad de productos para ofrecer en época navideña.
texts.en: Rosa is a 28-year-old woman who started making a living for herself at a very young age, through her vegetable business. She has been selling vegetables in the municipal market for three years and is happy to have a good amount of clients. She currently lives in her own home with her three little children ages 3, 6, and 12, as well as her partner. Rosa knows that despite her husband's economic support, her business is their main source of income. She also knows that the Christmas season is the time when she can expect the most sales. She wants to have a greater quantity of products to offer her clients, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in tomatoes, green chili, onions, cucumber, potatoes, trifles, etc in order to have a greater variety and quantity of products to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to invest in tomatoes, green chilis, onions, cucumber, trifles, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena es una mujer de 52 años de edad que siempre busca la manera de salir adelante, es por ello que hace 10 años decidió dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de riquísimas pupusas, obteniendo hasta la fecha una gran cantidad de clientes que visitan su vivienda en la cual tiene ubicado su negocio. Ella vive junto a su esposo en la misma vivienda en la que tiene su negocio, por lo que se siente feliz de no tener que realizar mayor inversión en inmueble para el mismo. Elena desea realizar una inversión en su negocio ya que con el capital propio no logra cumplir la demanda de productos con la que cuenta, es por ello que desea adquirir un crédito que le permita invertir en: maíz, harina de arroz, frijoles, queso, chicharrón, tomates, repollo, zanahoria, etc. Para poder cumplir con la demanda de productos que sus clientes solicitan y de esta forma obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Elena is a 52-year-old woman who is always looking to get ahead. For this reason, ten years ago she decided to make a living preparing and selling her delicious pupusas [tortillas with meat and vegetable filling]. She has gained a large number of clients who come to her home where her business is located. She lives with her husband in the home where she has her business. She is happy that she has not had to invest in another building for her business. 
Elena wants to invest in her business since she does not have the capital necessary to cover her demand. For this reason, she would like to take out a loan to invest in corn, rice flour, beans, cheese, pork rind, tomatoes, cabbage, carrots, etc in order to be able to meet her clients'  demand and obtain a greater income.

loans.use: to invest in corn, rice flour, beans, chicken, pork rind, tomatoes, cabbage, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Luz is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ma. Luz has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. It was damaged by Super Typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Ma. Luz requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business to restart her business activities.

Ma. Luz had been in this business for one year and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save enough money to afford to sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian is 36 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Marian works very hard to provide for them.

Marian runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

Marian has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Marian would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her welding shop. Teresita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old and has two children.

Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

Vilma has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Vilma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, and groceries

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 44-year-old who owns a piggery in her hometown of Baybay, Leyte. She is a married woman with three children. Her eldest is 21 and her youngest is 16. 

For seventeen years, she has been raising hogs and has also engaged in buying and selling hogs from other hog raisers. In addition to this, Lorna also sells chorizo (pork sausage). She is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy more hogs to resell, more chorizo (pork sausage), and feed to keep her hogs healthy. 

In the future, she plans to continue making business expansions to increase business profitability.

loans.use: to buy more hogs to resell, more chorizo (pork sausage), and feed to keep her hogs healthy

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 56-year-old married woman with one adult daughter. Her husband is a farmer, while Evangeline grows flowering and ornamental plants to sell in the municipality of Baybay. Some of her plants are also bought from other farmers. 

She is asking a loan to buy more plants to resell for a profit. Her income will be for family daily consumption and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more plants to resell for a profit

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Paz works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Paz is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Paz has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elena is 42 years old and has four children who are in school.

Elena has a buy and sell of fruit business in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of fruit to sell.

Elena has been in this business for one year. In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fruit to sell

loans.name: Martha Shg Group

texts.en:
The Martha self help group received a loan because their members deserve to grow day by day. They are very honest, hardworking and dedicated to their work. The purpose of this group is to become self-reliant in terms of venture capital. As evidence of this, two members left the group because they have been able to manage their businesses well and sustain themselves with their own capital after having taken out a loan from People's Forum earlier. Other members still need new loans for their businesses. They all have a strong will to become successful goat and chicken breeders. This loan will be used to improve their businesses by allowing the purchase of superior goat kids or chicks. 

Diptimani will use her portion of the loan to buy ten goat kids and feed. She has a plan to maintain them for fattening. She is 38 years old, a widow woman who lives with her parents. She has a son. Her father helps her business by providing traditional feed, such as banana leaves, from his garden each day. With this business, Diptimani hopes she can save some money and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy ten goat kids and feed.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rafaela is 42 years old, and five of her children are in school.

Rafaela has a buy-and-sell scrap business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy scrap to sell.

In the future, Rafaela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy scrap to sell.

loans.name: Rochie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rochie works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Rochie is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other equipment to use for her bicycle transport business.

Rochie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other equipment to use for her bicycle transport business.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en: Genalyn is a 30-year-old married woman from Baybay, Leyte with one son who is nine years old. For the last nine years, she has been engaged in making refreshments and snacks to sell in her house. She usually sells sweet-flavored drinks with gelatin and soya, and fruit shakes. The income of 6,000 PHP that she generates on average helps in ensuring the needs of her family, like food, are met. This business has helped her husband who is working as a hollow block maker. Genalyn is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy an ice crusher and popcorn machine so she can sell more snacks. She hope to expand her business someday for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy an ice crusher and  popcorn machine so she can sell more snacks

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita, 34 years old, is a married woman with two sons aged four and seven. Her husband works as a laborer in a school near their home. Melita helps by selling home-cooked meals like sauteed vegetables, fried fish and soup, and selling fresh vegetables such as water spinach, sweet corn and pechay (bok choy). 

This business started four years ago and usually earns her 5,000 PHP per month. She is asking a loan to buy more vegetables to sell like pechay and sweet corn to support her family’s need for healthy food and payment of school fees for her children.

In the future, she hopes to be able to have more business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy pechay and sweet corn to sell for profit to buy healthy food and pay for school fees

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a resident of Baybay, Leyte.  She is a 53-year-old married woman with a 15-year-old daughter. Perla runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items such as sugar, coffee, condiments, noodles, toiletries and canned goods. Her husband is an employee in a school. 

She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy additional grocery items to sell  in her store such as candies and chips, and sachet items like milk, toothpaste, shampoo, conditioner and coffee. 

In the future, Perla would like to expand her business to support her family, and to save enough to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items for her store such as candies and chips, and sachet items like milk, toothpaste, shampoo, conditioner and coffee

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 23-year-old single man from Baybay, Leyte. He raise hogs for a living in order to support himself and his parents. For the last two years, he has been raising a boar. This means that for every sow that produces piglets, he will be able to have one piglet as a payment to him as boar owner.

He is asking a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed for his boar and to keep his animal healthy. Any income generated will be for healthy meals and reinvestment in the same business. In the future, he plans to build a store that will sell poultry and livestock supplies  for a better income.

loans.use: to buy feed for his boar

loans.name: Petmarie

texts.en:
Petmarie is a woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 32 years old, and four of her children are in school.

Petmarie has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. It was damaged by Super Typhoon Haiyan on November 8, 2013. Petmarie requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other maintenance for her business to restart her business activities.

Petmarie has been in this business for one year and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 51 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Rosalinda has a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Joiada

texts.en: Joiada is a married woman. She is 28 years old. She lives in Baybay, Leyte with her husband. For the last two years she has been operating a chicken layer farm business. Her business earns on average of 2,700 PHP per month. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more chicks and feed. She dreams of expanding her business so she can better prepare for her family life. Her income will be used for reinvestment in the same business and the family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is from Baybay, Leyte. She is 37 years old. She is married with three children ages 9, 12 and 15. It is common for married people in the Philippines to have a spouse working abroad in order to earn better and support the children. Marissa is living a life like this, with her husband working abroad to provide for them. While looking after her kids she also engages in businesses such as selling rice and making homemade snacks like popsicles, locally known as "ice candy". These have been her businesses for four years now. She is asking for a loan to buy more rice and ingredients like milk, sugar and fruit flavorings.

Marissa dreams of having a bigger and more profitable business someday so her husband can come home and be with them.

loans.use: to buy more rice and ingredients like milk, sugar and fruit flavorings

loans.name: Jomratia

texts.en:
Jomratia is 43 years old, married, and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She sells bamboo in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. She earns additional income from farming and selling vegetables.

Jomratia requested her third loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional bamboo to sell. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to sell

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Айнагул есть 3 коровы, 10 овец. На участке мерою 2,0 Га она выращивает экологически числые арбузы, помидоры, перец. Доход от сельского хозяйства составляет примерно 30,000 сом (KGS) в год. Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян дыни, помидоров, и клеенки для парника. Доходы от кредита Айнагул планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Ainagul successfully paid off her previous loan, and used it for its intended purpose.  She is grateful to Kiva and to everyone who helped her financially.  Ainagul now owns 3 cows and 10 sheep and on her plot of land, which measures 2.0 hectares, she raises organic watermelons, tomatoes, and peppers.  Her annual income from her agricultural endeavors is about 30,000 KGS.  She turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 120,000 KGS to purchase fertilizer, melon, and tomato seeds, and plastic for a greenhouse.  With the income from the loan, Ainagul plans to invest in increasing the size of her herd and also plans to save towards building a stable for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds to grow organic watermelons, tomatoes, and plastic for a greenhouse

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with seven children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members, her grandchildren. She has a retail shop and has been in this business for 6 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, beans, flour, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and jerrycans of cooking oil. Rose works in her shop seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. She generates additional income through tailoring. Her major business challenges include seasonality, transportation, and defaulters. She aspires to build rental rooms. She resides in a rented house in which the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, rice, flour and beans.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 35 old, married, and has two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise and financial management. She does both vegetable and dairy farming. 

Mary requested a loan, which she will use to buying more stock of dairy feeds to help improve her milk productivity. This loan will enable her meet the rising demand for milk. Mary hopes her business will thrive and earn more income so that she will be in a position to support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feeds

loans.name: Mishelle

texts.en:
Mishelle is a married woman with two young children from Baybay, Leyte. Her husband works as a habal-habal (motorcycle with extended seats as a means of transportation in remote places) driver and janitor. Mishelle just started rebuilding her sari-sari (variety) store business so she can operate again. With this, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy merchandise such as bath soap, detergent, cooking oil, snack food, chips, candies, insect repellent, shampoo, conditioner and toothpaste.

A store in her community is not only for herself; it will also benefit her neighbors who will be needing the basic commodities without having to go to the city. Her income will provide her family the needed consumption and pay basic household bills like electricity and water.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as bath soap, detergent, cooking oil, snack food, chips, candies, insect repellent, shampoo, conditioner and toothpaste

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother of seven children. She is a resident of Carles, Iloilo. She runs a sari-sari (variety store) business and sells different items to the people in her community. She has also been engaged in fishing for six years. 

She is asking for a loan to buy additional items to sell in her store, such as snack foods, coffee, beverages, toiletries, condiments, fishing nets, fuel and nylon. 

In the future, Analyn dreams of making her business a success for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store, such as snack foods, coffee, beverages, toiletries, condiments, fishing nets, fuel and nylon.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 55 years old and married with four children. Violeta works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, beverages, etc.

Violeta has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Violeta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, and beverages

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru: Дамира, 33 года, замужем, есть сын дошкольного возраста. У Дамиры среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается торговлей одеждой на рынке. Бгодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Дамиры, на сегодняшний день у нее есть товар в обороте на сумму 468,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 30,000 сом (KGS). Дамира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для покупки женской одежды и карнавальных костюмов для продажи в праздничные дни. Она намерена расширить свой бизнес, что позволит ей отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Damira is 33 years old, married, and has a preschool-aged son.  Damira has a secondary education.  Damira's work selling clothes at the market serves as her family's primary source of income.  Thanks to the Damira's perseverance, dedication, and hard work, she now has inventory worth 468,000 KGS.  Her monthly income is approximately 30,000 KGS.  Damira turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase women's clothing and carnival costumes to sell during the holidays.  She intends to expand her business, which will allow her to repair her home.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothes and carnival costumes to resell and to increase her inventory

loans.name: Zhumakan

texts.ru: Жумакан 54 года, замужем, мать 5 детей. У Жумакан среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она уже 20 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Жумакан, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 4 коровы, 2 лошади и 20 овец. Также есть земельный надел мерою 4,20 ГА, где Жумакан выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для закупки коров для откорма и реализации. Жумакан намерена увеличить поголовье скота, что позволит ей накопить средства на развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Zhumakan is 54 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children.  Zhumakan has a secondary education.  Her work in agriculture and animal husbandry, in which she has been engaged for 20 years, serves as her family's primary source of income.  Thanks to Zhumakan's perseverance, dedication, and hard work, she now has 4 cows, 2 horses, and 20 sheep.  She also has a plot of land measuring 4.20 hectares, on which Zhumakan raises barley.  Her aggregate monthly income is about 25,000 KGS.  She turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase cows to fatten and resell.  Zhumakan intends to increase her number of livestock, which will allow her to save toward the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows to fatten and resell

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy lives in Carles, Iloilo. She is in the fishing business, since her husband is a fisherman. They have been in this business for 16 years. Christy does her best to help and support her husband in meeting their needs, especially in raising their five children, aged five to 14. 

Christy is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and fuel. This investment would be a great help in increasing her husband's catch.

Christy dreams of expanding the business to earn more for the family. She also wants to give her children a better education, and this loan would be a great help toward making her dreams real.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and fuel

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia, 43 years old, is from Baybay, Leyte.  She is married with two dependents aged 12 and 15.  Amalia operates a sari-sari store for an income in her neighborhood. This business started six years ago. She sells basic household items like canned goods, chips, seasoning and toiletries. She is asking for a loan to buy in bulk merchandise such as noodles, eggs, seasoning, toiletries, soft drinks and coconut wine. She is confident that with hard work and perseverance, she can continue to support her children. 

In the future, she would like to make her store bigger and sell items that she did not previously carry. Any additional income will be for her family's daily consumption, savings and school fees.

loans.use: to  buy in bulk merchandise such as noodles, eggs, seasoning, toiletries, soft drinks and coconut wine

loans.name: Narlyn

texts.en:
Narlyn is a 48-year-old widow and entrepreneur from Carles, Iloilo.  She runs a sari-sari (variety store) business, where she sells items like biscuits, soft drinks, spices, shampoo, condiments, chips, detergents, canned goods and noodles. She has had her business for four years. 

Narlyn has requested a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos to buy a stock of canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, seasonings, chips and toiletries. 

She hopes to successfully send her two children, aged nine and 12, to school from the income from her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, seasonings, chips and toiletries

loans.name: Ykybal

texts.ru: Ыкыбал, 48 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. Ыкыбал в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается сельским хозяйством. Стартовав в 2003 году, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Ыкыбал есть 3 коровы, 30 овец и 3 лошади. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнеса около 10,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Ыкыбал планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Ykybal is 48 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children.  Ykybal's work in agriculture, beginning in 2003, serves as her family's primary source of income.  She now has in her care 3 cows, 30 sheep, and 3 horses.  Her monthly income from her business is about 10,000 KGS.  With the goal of further developing her business, she turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase cattle.  With the income from her loan, Ykybal plans to save toward the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila is a 59-year-old married woman with two dependents, aged 16 and 18. She is from Baybay, Leyte. 

Prescila's husband is a coconut farmer. Through him, she learned to sell coconut wine, and has done so for 10 years now. She also cooks rice cakes and pancakes to sell to people in her community. 

She is asking for a loan to buy coconut wine from other farmers as well as sugar, flour and cooking oil. 

Prescila hopes to maintain her business and to continue making improvements for sustainability. Her income will be used for her family's daily needs and school fees.

loans.use: to buy coconut wine, sugar, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in clothes and cosmetics to strengthen her business which allows her to provide for her children’s education and improve her home

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 49 years old and a widow. She lives in Baybay, Bonifacio. Wilma is managing her rice farm to earn a living, and she is also dedicated in her work as a tailor. Wilma mastered doing this type of activity over twenty years. She joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative on June 2008. She is hardworking and has a strong determination to pursue her goals to sustain her needs, alleviating poverty. 

Wilma requested a loan to purchase fertilizers to increase crop yields on her rice farm, and also to buy additional textiles, buttons and other sewing supplies. This will greatly help Wilma boost her income. Someday, she hopes to buy a parcel of rice land to expand her farm and venture into the rice retailing business.

loans.use: buy fertilizer & sewing supplies

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 53 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 sons now in their college and high school years. For their means of living, Edwina  is engaged in  managing a sand and gravel distribution business for 2 years and also a hollow block processing business. She earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

Edwina has requested a loan to purchase a "sampan" or boat for sand quarrying for her business. Edwina has been a member of PMPC for almost 1 year. In the future Edwina hopes to expand her sand and gravel distribution and hollow block processing business.

loans.use: buy a sampan

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita hails from the municipality of Baybay, Leyte.  She is 43 years old, married with two children ages 10 and 14. Last year, she started selling processed meat products like hot dogs, longaniza (sausage) and ham. This is to help her husband who provide for them from the income he earn as a driver. Nenita is asking for a loan of 8000 PHP to buy more stocks of hot dogs, ham and longaniza (sausage).  She would like to keep her business going and will do more improvements for it to become more sustainable in the future.

Her income will be for family daily consumption, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of hot dogs, ham and longganisa (sausage)

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are attending school. She is also looking after her sister.

Margret has been operating a restaurant for the last four years, working seven days a week.  She has requested for a loan of Ugandan Shillings 1,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her stock more ingredients like food spices, rice, beans, peas sugar, cooking oil and flour. Her challenges include thieves and fluctuating prices. Her dream is to own a big restaurant in future. She joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest charged on loans and the chance to save money. 

Margret lives in her own house with access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is a 38-year-old sari-sari (variety) store owner from Baybay, Leyte. For the last two years, this has been her livelihood in helping her husband who is a fisherman. They have two children who are 11 and 14 years old. 

She usually earns 5,000 PHP per month for her family. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy merchandise such as canned goods, noodles, detergent, bath soap, shampoo and toothpaste. It is Pedrita’s dream to continue improving her inventory so she can increase her business profitability and give her family a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, detergent, bath soap, shampoo and toothpaste

loans.name: Jiguene Bakhna 65 Group

texts.fr: JIGUENE BAKHNA 65 est un groupement de femmes qui habitent dans le même quartier. Elles évoluent toutes dans la commercialisation des produits halieutiques. Elles se réunissent tous les fins de mois pour organiser des tontines. Elles ont comme présidente la dame Ndèye Maguatte, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5ans et sollicite ce montant pour aller dans la petite cote pour acheter des produits halieutiques et venir dans sa commune pour les revendre au marché. Elle appuie son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la maison. Elle commence sa journée à 7h pour la  terminer à 20h du soir. A l’avenir, elle souhaite augmenter et diversifier son stock de marchandises. Ainsi elle pourra épargner de l’argent et améliorer les conditions de vie sa famille.
texts.en: JIGUENE BAKHNA 65 is a group of women who live in the same quarter. They all sell fish products for a living. They meet at the end of each month in order to organise credit meetings. Their president is Ndèye Maguatte, who is married with children. She has worked in this field for over five years and is seeking this loan in order to enable her to purchase fish products for re-sale in her local market.  She supports her husband in running the household expenses. She starts her days at 7am and ends at 8pm. In future she would like to increase and diversify her stock levels. In this way she will be able to put money aside as savings and improve her family 's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fish products and fish for re-sale

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is a 29-year-old mother of three children ages one, four and six. She and her family live in Baybay, Leyte. For two years, she has been selling prepaid loads for mobile, locally known as E-load (electronic load) for both Globe and Smart prepaid users. This is her way of helping her husband who works hard as a laborer. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more prepaid loads to sell.  She hope to expand her business someday so she can give her children a better life.

loans.use: to buy more prepaid electronic load for mobile phones

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario owns and toils on her land. She grows and sells rice. She is a sixty-four-year-old married woman with four grown children. She has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 20 years.

Rosario is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy a Landmaster - a vehicle having a powerful gasoline or diesel motor and unusually large, heavily treaded rear tires, used especially for pulling farm implements or machinery. This will help make her farming methods easier. She could now grow and produce more rice during next harvest season.

In the future, Rosario dreams to have good health so that she can still manage her farm to be productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy a Landmaster - a vehicle used especially for pulling farm implements or machinery.

loans.name: May Angela

texts.en:
May Angela is from Barangay 5, Tangub City. She is a persevering mother when it comes to the welfare of her family, since she has always been known to provide the best for her family especially their health needs.  That is why she is earning a living in her retailing business, selling health and wellness products. 

To generate more income, May Angela decided to expand her resources after she learned that she can access financial assistance from PMPC. Consequently, she requested a loan to restock more inventories of the products to increase sales and able to meet the demand of her customers. May Angela smiles at the thought of having a healthy and comfortable life and providing her family a better life.

loans.use: buy health products

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, 60, is mother to a 16-year-old son. She is from Baybay, Leyte. 

She has been engaged in a sari-sari (variety store) business, as well as in food vending, for more than 10 years. She sells items like biscuits, soft drinks, spices, shampoo, detergents, condiments, chips, canned goods and noodles. 

She is asking for a loan to buy additional inventory of cooking oil, flour, seasonings, canned goods, noodles and toiletries. This investment will allow her to earn more, because she will always have a supply of goods. 

Victoria dreams of sending her child to school until college for a successful life.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, seasonings, canned goods, noodles and toiletries

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace, pictured above, has seven children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Grace is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Grace has been a farmer for 20 years and, in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs, but also a solar light. She is very happy to be getting the solar light because it means she will reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and, therefore, save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Grace is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 3.75 acres will be planted by Grace's Group, and between them they will receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Ancheta

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Ancheta works hard to support her family.  She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and raising pigs.  

Ancheta is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to  buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell for her general store business.  She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Ancheta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Nory

texts.en:
Nory is 57 years old, married and has two children.   She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Nory requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nory has been farming rice for 25 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Nory would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fertilizer & farm supplies

loans.name: Punjik

texts.en:
Punjik is 54 years old and lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. Punjik is married and has two daughters and a son. Now only her youngest daughter lives with her. 

Punjik’s husband works at a private construction company.  As Punjik likes to say, she is the happiest mother in the world since she, with her husband,  managed to bring up perfect children who now are grown up and they are very kind and educated persons. Her son and elder daughter are married and Punjik with her husband are already rich with their grandchildren. Punjik is very touched and very happy since her youngest daughter is also going to get married.

This loan in the amount of 600,000 Armenian drams Punjik asks since she wants to organize her daughter’s wedding party and this loan amount also will help her to buy nice gifts for her daughter and her fiancé.

loans.use: pay for her daughter's wedding

loans.name: Jhonette

texts.en:
Jhonette is 52 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are in school. Jhonette works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future Jhonette would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Wendani Self Help Group

texts.en: In 2014, Wendani Self Help Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa  to be trained on enterprise development and financial management.  The person raising her hand in the photograph is Zipporah, a member of this group. She is 47 years old, married and living with the husband and her four children. She operates a small grocery where she sells items such as tomatoes, onions, cabbages, kales and carrots. She has applied for a loan to add stock to her  grocery business so that she can sell more and meet her customers’ high demand. She hopes that her business will thrive, thus improving her income. The anticipated income will help her improve her living standards such as providing quality education for her children.  Zipporah  is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: buy fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Rwandema Women Group

texts.en: In 2012, Rwandema Women Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. The person raising her hand in the photograph is Rachael, a member of this group. She is married and blessed with five children.  She does vegetable farming and also sells charcoal. She is borrowing a loan to add more stock of charcoal to her business. This will help the business thrive hence be in a position to support and take care of her children.  She is grateful to Kiva for assisting her to improve her business.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Margaret, who is forty nine years old, married and blessed with five children. Her economic activity is vegetable, maize, beans and dairy farming.

Margaret is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for the training on enterprise creation and financial management she received that has enabled her keep clear and updated farm records. She is applying for a  Kiva loan to buy dairy feeds. She hopes this will improve the milk production thus supply more milk to the local market. She looks forward to more income and be in a position to cater for her family needs such as food.

Margaret is happy for Hand in Hand Eastern Africa and Kiva for the support

loans.use: buy dairy feed

loans.name: Sembrando Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEMBRANDO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Frank tiene 31 años de edad y es soltero, él socio se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma salir adelante.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de restaurant, negocio de taller de carpintería, imprenta, negocio de venta de pasteles.
En la foto grupal salen dos niños.
El socio  agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank “SEMBRANDO”. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is in the Cusco province in the Cusco region.

One member, Frank, who is 31 years old and single, provides a taxi service. He has had his business for a long time and it is going well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work every day. He wishes to be able to carry on working and in this way be successful. He is asking for the loan to carry out maintenance on his car. 

The other members work in the grocery shop, restaurant, carpentry, printing and pastry-selling businesses. 

In the group photo there are two children. 

The member [Frank] is very grateful to those who contribute to this dream through this process and promises to comply with the instalment payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to get his car serviced

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a 62-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with eight grown children. Three years ago, she started operating a food vending business. She prepares home-cooked meals such as noodles, fried fish, sautéed vegetables and soup. Teresita is asking for a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos to buy ingredients such as soy sauce, meat, noodles, cooking oil, seasoning and salt. She hopes to continue her business for a long time so she can save for her future financial needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as soy sauce, meat, noodles, cooking oil, seasoning and salt for her food vending business.

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Madame Akoko est mariée. Ils ont en charge 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. Elle revend des pagnes qu'elle distribue à ses clients depuis 1990. A l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année, Akoko sollicite un prêt pour acheter des pagnes afin de satisfaire les demandes des clients.  Elle souhaite réinvestir dans l'activité et améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en: Madame Akoko is married with three children in her care, two of whom attend school.  She sell pagnes (wax cloths) which she she has been selling to her customers since 1990. As the new year approaches, Akoko is seeking a loan in order to purchase loans to satisfy her customers' demands.  She is seeking to reinvest in the business and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase pagnes (wax cloths)

loans.name: Risieba's Group

texts.en:
Risieba, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is now proud to represent her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She is 54 years old and married with eight children.

Risieba likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012. She decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says, being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had more profits from each harvest. She plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

In total, Risieba’s group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.75 acres of land. Some group members will also purchase solar lights with this loan, for a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Rabecca's Group

texts.en:
Rabecca is 31 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for 12 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Rabecca is the only one featured in the picture, she is actually representing her group of 12 farmers from Webuye District, Kenya.

Rabecca started working alongside One Acre Fund in 2010. She decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family. This year, she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Rabecca’s group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will purchase solar lights so, with this loan, the group will receive eight solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Chrispine's Group

texts.en:
In the photo is Chrispine, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 32 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 16 farmers from Kakamega South District, Kenya. She is married and has three children.

Chrispine is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again. This means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Chrispine says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2014, she has had more profits from each harvest, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Chrispine will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase ten solar lights as well as seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.75 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will receive a total of ten solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is 43 years old and has 8 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 15 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Jane has been farming with One Acre Fund for some years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Jane also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Jane's Group will be able to receive a total of 6 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 9 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Teodora lives in Baybay with her family. She is married with four grown children. Teodora is engaged in seedling production of fruit trees and hard-wood trees. This business has existed for seven years. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP as additional capital to buy more seeds and plastic containers. Teodora enjoys doing this business since she does not have to leave home in order to earn. In the future, she hopes to have other business options so she can save enough for old age.

loans.use: to  buy more seeds and plastic containers

loans.name: Ma. Necitas

texts.en: Ma. Necitas, 58 years old, is from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and her husband is a farmer who earns barely enough to make both ends meet. Because of this, she started helping three years ago by selling rice cakes and pancakes to earn a living. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy flour, margarine, cooking oil, sticky rice, sugar and eggs. Ma. Necitas believe that a loan will be such a great help for her to continue her livelihood. She plans to introduce more snacks to sell in her neighborhood to expand her business. Her income will allow her to buy healthy food for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to  buy flour, margarine, cooking oil, sticky rice, sugar and eggs

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr: Imprimeur de profession, mr Yawo en plus de son activité revend des articles de mercerie depuis 2003. il sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises.  Le profit supplémentaire lui servira d'agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille. Il est âgé de 32ans avec 01 enfant de 08ans en charge.
texts.en: Mr Yawo is a printer by trade, but has also sold haberdashery tools since 2003. He is seeking his first loan in order to buy goods. He will use the additional profit in order to enlarge his business and improve his family's living conditions. He is 32 years old with an 8 year old child in his care.

loans.use: To purchase haberdashery tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, milk, fruit, and a four-cylinder gas tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase general groceries

loans.name: Rui Wu

texts.en:
Rui Wu is deaf. He is divorced, 48 years old, and lives alone in the countryside without dependents. He has a son, who is working out all the year round.

When Rui Wu was young, he didn’t have a proper job that he could feed his family with. His wife couldn’t bear this poor living condition, and she left him and their child to work outside. She never came back, since then. For the sake of supporting the family, Rui Wu came to work in a machinery factory. The factory environment was very difficult; they operated machines that filled the air with disturbing noise. After more than ten years of hard-working there, which made him deaf, he could not hear any more. At the same time, his son owed a debt in the amount of ￥200,000.
