In order to help his son, he left the factory and began to work on a construction project. Finally, at the end of last year, they finished paying the debt off.

This year, Rui Wu came back to his hometown. He established a tea house, in his house. Without many acquaintances and friends, his business is stagnant. He requested ￥5,000 from MicroCred. He will use part of the loan money to buy new machinery and equipment to expand his business, and he will use the rest to stock daily necessaries.

Rui Wu describes himself as very hard-working and honest. His dream is to save up enough money to have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy new machinery and equipment and to stock daily necessaries.

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn is 43 years old and married. She has five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional feed and vitamins. Gemalyn has been raising pigs for 10 years, and she earns additional income from dried fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married with five children, three of whom are in school. Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Virginia has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Boas's Group

texts.en:
Boas, in the photo, has been a farmer for more than 50 years and is now proud to represent his group of eight farmers in Teso district. He is 77 years old, married and has eight children.

Boas likes to think of himself as a very reliable person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had more profits from each harvest. Boas plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Boas’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 3.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Rachel's Group

texts.en:
Rachel, pictured above, has been a farmer for 16 years and is now proud to represent her group of nine farmers in Teso District. She is 39 years old, married and has five children.

Rachel likes to think of herself as a very reliable person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Rachel plans to use the profits from this coming season to save more money for the future.

In total, Rachel’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her maize harvest

loans.name: Pamela's Group

texts.en:
Pamela's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Teso District and is being represented by Pamela, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 22 years old, married and has four children. Pamela has been a farmer for three years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Pamela isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Pamela will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Pamela's Group will purchase a total of five solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer, to improve her maize harvests

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima De Conchacalla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA DE CONCHACALLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Toribia, la socia continua dedicándose a su   negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua vendiendo sus animalitos en las distintas ferias y clientes que le solictan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y alimentos para sus animales.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de construcción, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ganaderia, agricultura y negocio de venta de chicha.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
These business partners belong to the community bank “Santa Rosa de Lima de Conchacalla”.  This bank is located in the district of Anta, which belongs to the province of Anta in the department of Cusco.  Mrs. Toribia is one of the members; she has her own business breeding small animals. She is grateful to whoever is part of this dream through this method and she is dedicated to ensuring the loan payments are paid by the determined deadline. 

Toribia continues to sell her little animals in the different fairs and to clients who request them. This is how she provides for her family.  She is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs and food for her animals.  The other members of the group have their own business; selling animals, in construction, running a corner store, breeding animals, in agriculture and selling "chicha" (or corn liquor).  The person who is in the photo with their face covered does not belong to the community bank.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and food for their animals

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of an additional family member.

She has a business selling passion fruit and orange juice. She has been in this business for one year, and she works seven days a week. She sells her products in the market, by means of retail. Constance has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of passion fruit, mangoes, and oranges. She generates additional income by selling Airtime. The main business challenges include thieves and transportation.

Her goal and aspiration is to buy land, to start passion fruit- and mango-growing. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy oranges, passion fruit, mangoes, and watermelon.

loans.name: Sol De Oro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL DE ORO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Edi ella es soltera y tiene 58 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Golden Sun” communal bank, located in the district of Cusco which also pertains to the province and department of Cusco.

Member Maria is single and 58 years old, with three children. She works in her grocery store. Maria sells products of primary necessity, such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She works from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm. Maria has spent ten years in this business and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery business. Maria is requesting a loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

Maria's photo is attached to the group photo because the original picture was taken after the reunion and she had to request permission to be absent because of work.

The remaining members have businesses that sell candies, clothing, groceries or books and stationary.

Maria is grateful to those who form a part of her dream. Through this means, she promises to comply with her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies to sell.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Loida is 40 years old and has four children who are in school.

Loida has a fishing business in the Philippines. Loida requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials to use in her business. Loida has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Loida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr: AICHA est une femme qui est très brave, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle habite à un quartier non loin du Guichet. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des denrées alimentaires. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans e commence sa journée à 10h pour la terminer à 20h. Etant à son 10ème prêt, elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des denrées alimentaires comme le riz, le sucre, le savon, l’huile …. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Les denrées alimentaires sont très prisées par les populations qui l’achètent en détail, elle pourra avec le crédit augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent. A l’avenir elle voudrait aussi diversifier ses produits et à long terme faire des voyages dans la sous région pour mieux promouvoir son commerce et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: AICHA is a brave woman who is married with children. She lives in a quarter near the Guichet area. She sells foodstuffs for a living. She has worked in this field for over ten years. She starts her days at 10am and finishes at 8pm. She is on her 10th loan and is seeking a new one in order to purchase foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, soap, oil... She assists her husband with the family's expenses and their children's school fees. The foodstuffs are very popular with her customers, who buy at retail.  She will be able to use this loan in order to drive her revenues and save money.  In the future, she would like to diversify her product range, and in the long term travel to other regions in order to promote her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs in order to sell to her customers

loans.name: Raima

texts.ru: На фотографии Раима. Ей 62 года. Раима вдова. Она живет с детьми на районе Вахш. У нее пятеро детей, три дочки и трое сыновей. Раима очень добрая и приятная по натуре женщина. Она в течение 6 лет занимается животноводством. Доход от бизнеса уходит на покрытие семейных расходов. Для нее животноводческая деятельность очень нужна. Сейчас для Раимы необходимо увеличить поголовья скота, чтобы поддержать бизнес и сохранить источник дохода. Раима планирует увеличить количество скот, укрепить бизнес и добиться признаний в этой области.
texts.en: This photograph depicts Raima. She is 62 years and a widow. She lives with her children in the Vakhsh district. They have five children - three daughters and three sons. Raima is a very kind and pleasant woman. She has been involved in animal husbandry for 6 years. The income from the business goes toward covering the family's expenses. She really needs her animal husbandry business. Now Raima needs to increase her livestock headcount in order to sustain the business and retain her income source. Raima plans to increase her livestock quantities and achieve recognition in this field.

loans.use: to increase her livestock headcount in order to sustain the business and retain her income source

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, two of whom attend school. She supports two additional family members. She operates a beauty salon and has been in business for the last eight years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy braids, weaves, hair treatments, oils, shampoo, and relaxers. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses includes school fees, food, and rent.

loans.use: To buy rollers, weaves, braids, relaxers, treatments, and oils

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth's Group is formed by 14 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Elizabeth, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 48 years old, married and has four children. Elizabeth has been a farmer for 19 years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Elizabeth isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Elizabeth will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Elizabeth's Group will purchase a total of 14 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer, to improve her maize harvests

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба 30-летняя молодая женщина, имеющая мужа и троих детей. Ее муж работает в пекарне и занимается выпеканием таджикских лепешек. Старшая дочь посещает школу, а младшая дочь и сын еще маленькие, им по 6 и 3 года. Насиба со своей семьей живет в районе Б.Гафурова города Худжанд. Она по профессии портниха. Вот уже три года как она занимается шитьем женских национальных одеяний. Теперь она хотела бы расширить свою деятельность и с такой целью запрашивает кредит. Насиба собирается приобрести новую швейную машинку, с помощью которой улучшится качество и прибыльность ее работы. Она надеется на этот кредит.
texts.en: Nasiba is a 30-year-old young woman with a husband and three children. Her husband works at a bakery and bakes Tajik flatbread. Her oldest daughter attends a school, and her youngest daughter and son are still very young - they are 6 and 3 years old. Nasiba and her family live in the town of Khujand of the B. Gafurov district. She is a seamstress and has been involved in sewing women's national clothing for three years. Now she wants to expand her business and requesting a loan for this purpose. Nasiba is planning to purchase a new sewing machine, with the help of which the quality and profitability of her work will improve. She relies on this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine in order to expand her business

loans.name: Shiners Self Help Group

texts.en:
In 2014, Shiners Self Help Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to be trained on savings mobilization, enterprise development, and financial management in order to improve the members’ livelihoods.

The person raising his hand in the photograph is Paul, a member of this group. He is thirty-four years old, married, and living with his wife and her two children. He makes briquettes to earn a living.

He has applied for a loan to expand his business by buying raw materials such as charcoal dust and sawdust. This will enable him to make more briquettes and meet his customers’ demand. He hopes this will help him increase his income, thus enabling him to pay for his children’s education.

Paul is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as charcoal dust and sawdust, for making briquettes; this will help in meeting customers' demand.

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia is 56 years old and has eight children. She is a married woman.

Artemia is in the agricultural business, farming tobacco in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Artemia has been in this business for eleven years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Artemia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ushirika Self Help Youth Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Mwainja, a member of the Ushirika Self Help Youth Group. She is thirty-four years old, married, and blessed with two children who are in primary school.

She sells clothes and also does vegetable farming to earn a living. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to add more stock of clothes to her enterprise. She believes this will help meet customers' rising demand. Mwainja looks forward to improved profits which she will plough back to help expand her enterprise.

Mwainja is happy for Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to help meet customer demand.

loans.name: Jiafu

texts.en:
Jiafu is a 28-year-old blind man. He lives with his girlfriend, who is eight months pregnant.

Jiafu was born in a poor family, in the countryside of Nanchong. At the age of eight, he had an operation to remove the tumors in his brain. Unfortunately, that operation was not so successful; it hurt his optic nerve and made him blind. The disease and its results did not defeat him, and made him stronger than before. He insisted on studying and finally found the job that he can do.

Five years ago, Jiafu began learning the skills of blind massaging. Due to his hard work, he had his own massage shop just one year later. His business goes very well, and he has a high reputation with his clients. The dream of supporting his family, by himself, has come true.

He requested ￥8,000 from MicroCred. He will use one part of the loan money to make preparations for the coming baby, and the other part to buy some equipment for his business. He hopes that his family will have a better life, in the future.

loans.use: to buy some equipment for his shop and make preparations for his coming baby.

loans.name: Mahfurat

texts.ru: Махфурат 36 лет. Она заботливая жена и мать. У нее с мужем двое милых детей, ради которых они усердно работают. Махфурат у себя во дворе дома занимается разведением скотов. Она держит коров, овец и баранов для откорма и дальнейшей продажи. Данной деятельностью она уже занимается 9 лет. Махфурат сейчас необходимо закупить пару мелкорогатых скотин для развития деятельности и с такой целью обратилась за кредитом. Она ждет поддержки, так как собственных средств не хватает.
texts.en: Mahfurat is 36 years old. She is a caring wife and mother. She and her husband have two lovely children, for whom they work very hard. Mahfurat is involved in fattening up livestock on her livestock yard. She keeps cows, ewes and rams for fattening up and subsequent sale. She has been in this business for 9 years. Now Mahfurat needs to buy a pair of small livestock in order to develop her business and requested a loan for this purpose. She awaits support because she does not have enough of her own money.

loans.use: to buy small livestock in order to develop her business

loans.name: Rahejeh

texts.en:
Rahejeh is a 38-year-old married mother of four sons and one daughter. She is from a village near Jenin city. Her husband works as a construction worker with an unstable income. Ten years ago, Rahejeh started working on the family farm planting olive and lemon trees. It is a very good business and the income covers a big part of the family's needs.
Rahejeh took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more olive and lemon seedlings for her agricultural land. By taking this loan, the farm productivity will increase . 
Rahejeh appears in the photo on her farm

loans.use: to buy more olive and lemon seedlings for her agricultural land.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic household commodities such as cooking oil, sugar, eggs, noodles, powdered milk, soap, and canned goods. She is a 57-year-old married woman with nine children. Three of her children are still attending school. In addition to that, she also raises and sells hogs.

Trinidad is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy assorted groceries for the store and an additional pig. This stock will fill her store with various stock and help her grow and sell more pigs in the coming months.

Trinidad dreams to expand her business to make her livelihood more sustainable in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries for the store and an additional pig.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 59 years old and married. She has five children, one of whom is in school. Nenita works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more stock to sell, like noodles, eggs, milk, soap, etc. Nenita has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Nenita would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, like noodles, eggs, milk, soap, and the like.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 39 years old and married with four children.

Rhodora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, and shampoo.

Rhodora has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rhodora aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages and shampoo.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is a fisherman from Concepcion, Iloilo. He is a married father of four children. Fishing is the source of his income. Rey has been in the fishing business for more than 10 years now.
Rey is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. A loan will improve his catch thus allowing him to sell more fish to the market. .In the future, Rey hopes to make his fishing business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and three kids: two sons and one daughter. He works as an employee in the public sector, and he also works as a farmer on his land. He uses greenhouses to ensure he has good-quality crops.

Mohammad requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more seedlings and fertilizers for his agricultural land. This will improve the land conditions and increase its productivity.

Mohammad appears in the photo on his land.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings and fertilizers for his agricultural land.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 37 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to pay laborers' salaries for land preparation.

Josephine has been farming rice for 15 years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay laborers' salaries for land preparation

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is a 36-year old married mother of four children, three in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Eleuteria has a direct-selling business in the Philippines. Eleuteria requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more products to sell.

Eleuteria has been in this business for three years. In the future, Eleuteria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Erlita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from making dried fish. Erlita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials such as plywood, bamboo, and paint for her fishing business.

Erlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials such as plywood, bamboo, and paint for her fishing business.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of 12 children, Antonieta works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from seaweed. Antonieta is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Antonieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en:
Marwa is a 28-year-old married woman from Bethlehem City. She is a mother of two small sons. Her husband has a carpentry business next to their house. He makes home furniture upon request. It is a very good business, but the raw materials are expensive.

Marwa requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to fix the carpentry workshop and also buy new tools for his business. By taking this loan, Marwa's husband will be able to improve his production with a better quality.

Marwa appears in the photo in her husband's carpentry business.

loans.use: to help her husband to fix the carpentry workshop and also buy new tools for his business.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: Mario es una hombre trabajador que cuenta con 57 años de edad ganándose la vida desde hace 2 años con su tienda de productos básicos la cual el mismo atiende de la manera más amable posible por lo que tiene una gran cantidad de clientes que siempre buscan sus productos. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 nietos de 11 y 9 años de edad que apoya muy feliz para que sigan con sus estudios. Mario sabe que su tienda es su mayor fuente de ingresos, por lo que desea invertir en ella,  para lo solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lácteos, embutidos, carnes, bebidas frías, golosinas, detergente, etc.
texts.en: Mario is a hard-working 57-year-old man. He has been making a living for the past two years from his store, where he sells basic staples. He tends to the store himself in the kindest manner; because of this, he has a large clientele who always seek out his products. He lives in his own home with his wife and two children ages 9 and 11. He supports his family and is very happy because they are continuing with their studies. Mario knows that his store is his greatest source of income, so he wants to invest in it. For this, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in dairy products, sausages, meat, cold drinks, candy, detergent, etc.

loans.use: to invest in dairy products, sausages, meat, cold drinks, candy, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Jhon Abelardo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS, él socio tiene 25 años de edad, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando para una empresa pública, él socio es arquitecto el realiza diferentes tipos de diseños que le solicitan, el socio lleva buen tiempo trabajando el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  su trabajo, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando parta de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
EL socio solicito el crédito para la compra de una laptop.
El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Mujeres Emprendedoras communal bank. He is 25 and alternates his daily chores with his work for a public company. He is an architect and makes different kinds of designs as requested. He has been working for quite some time and it is going well for him thanks to the hard work that he puts into his work every day. 
He wants to be able to keep working to continue supporting his family. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a laptop. He is grateful for this loan and promises to repay his quotas as established.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Beijing Group

texts.en:
Adella is in her early 40s, married and has one child, who is still in school.  She has been running a business of mama lishe (food vending) for 16 years now.  She works from 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Adella's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restock items in her mama lishe business. She dreams of owning a hotel.

loans.use: to restock items in her mama lishe (food vending) business.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a 52-year-old married mother of two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Estelita has a seaweed business in the Philippines. Estelita requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy farm supplies for her seaweed business.

Estelita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Estelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her seaweed business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 37 years old and married.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Maribel  is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional varieties of rice for her farm.

Maribel has been farming rice for five years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of rice for her farm

loans.name: Santos Fidencio

texts.es:
Santos de 43 años de edad, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Es un hombre trabajador que dio educación y estudio a sus hijos junto a su esposa que lo apoya en todo. Es una persona muy activa y un líder reconocido en su comunidad miembro de varias organizaciones que participan en el desarrollo comunal.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción, costaneras y láminas para reparar el techo de su casa que con el tiempo y la pasada época lluviosa se ha deteriorado. Sueña con que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y tengan una mejor condición de vida que la que él tuvo.
texts.en:
Santos, age 43, is married and has four children.  He is a hard-working man who, together with his wife who supports him in everything, gave his children an education.  He is a very active person, and he is a recognized leader in his community.  He is a member of various organizations that participate in community development.

He is requesting the loan to buy construction materials.  He will buy beams and metal sheeting to repair the roof of his house.  With time and the past rainy season it has deteriorated.

He dreams of his children completing their education and having better living conditions than what he had.

loans.use: to buy beams and metal sheeting to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: Maria de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 52 years old and she lives in her own home with her two children. She has her own store that she runs from her place of residence. She has many customers because she offers fair prices and a friendly atmosphere. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase more soaps, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, pastries etc. This will help her to improve her earnings and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase more soaps, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets and pastries.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a married woman with 13 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Julieta is 44 years old and has five children who are in school.

Julieta has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fish nets and other fishing materials.

Julieta has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rene Oswaldo

texts.es: Rene de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, el posee una tienda desde hace 10 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, Rene está solicitando un crédito para la compra de más mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rene is 32 years old and he lives in his own home with his three children. He has run a store for ten years out of his place of residence and he sells a variety of items like sweets, soft drinks, basic gains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatins, sugar etc. He has many customers because he offers fair prices. Rene is asking for a loan to purchase more merchandise. This is his only source of income and the expanded merchandise will lead to higher returns and allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: purchase sweets, soft drinks, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, sugar etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase shoes, shirts, sweaters and blouses.

loans.name: Nozikoy

texts.en:
Nozikoy is a businesswoman. She was born in 1971 in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is a widow and has three children. Nozikoy feeds her family alone. She is a retailer. She has worked in this field about seven years. 

Nozikoy buys and sells clothes for kids. Her business is doing well. Seasonal demand for her products has increased. She needs some differentiation of her products. She is planning to buy more clothes to sell.  Financial support will help her to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Beatriz is 57 years old now.

Beatriz has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for twenty years. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing materials.

In the future, Beatriz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat lives with his beloved wife in Kapan city of Syunik region. Ararat has no higher education, but he managed to become a very skilled and already very famous constructor in his city.

He describes many buildings he built during past years, and he is happy to see all of it as nice as when he built it many years ago. He says he is sure they will be in a good state for still many, many years.

Now he works by order doing different construction work, and in this way he earns his family’s living. Ararat has two nice daughters and a son.

Ararat asks for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams, since he wants to buy some new, very needed construction equipment, which he uses during his work. (He says his tools are already very old and worn out.)

loans.use: to buy some new, very needed construction equipment, which he uses during his work.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, a 47-year-old married mother of three children, one of whom in school, works very hard to provide for them. She has been operating a general store in the Philippines for 10 years, and is requesting a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Born in 1973 in the northern part of Tajikistan, Muhabbat is a married mother of seven children. Her husband works as an emigrant.

Since 2005, Muhabbat has been retailing children's clothes. No matter the season, there is demand for her products. She is requesting this loan to add children's shoes to her product line.

loans.use: To buy children's shoes to sell

loans.name: San Isidro De Yungaqui Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “San Isidro de Yungaqui” perteneciente a la comunidad de Yungaqui en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jesusa ella es soltera y tiene 54 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de ganaderia, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member, Jesusa, belongs to San Isidro de Yungaqui Communal Bank in the community of Yungaqui in the district of Anta, in the province of Anta and department of Cusco.  Jesusa, 54, is single and has five children.  She works in her ranching business raising and fattening livestock to sell at market.  She works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.  She wants to make progress with this job.  Her dream is to expand her livestock business.

Jesusa's requesting the loan to buy a cow.  She's grateful to those who are part of her dream through this means and she promises to make her payments punctually.

The businesses of the other members are food sales, farming, a grocery store, and animal sales.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks, sunflower oil, ketchup, dishes, coffee, flour, etc.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is 37 years old, and a married woman from Yatta, a village near Hebron city. She is a mother of four sons and two daughters. Her son works as a construction worker, with an unstable income. Four years ago, Laila started working in the family farm. She plants seasonal crops, using greenhouses. It is a very good business, and the income covers a big part of the family's needs.

Laila took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy fertilizer for her agricultural land. By taking this loan, the farm's productivity will increase, with a good quality. Laila appears in the photo, at her farm

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her agricultural land.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
La socia Nery se dedica al trabajo como profesora del nivel primario, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Nery is a primary school teacher and she works from 8am to 2pm. She wants to get ahead in life by working hard at her career and her dream is to one day own a clothing store. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase a television for her home. She is happy for the loan and she promises to make on-time payments.

loans.use: purchase a television for her home.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a 37-year-old mother of three children, ages 9, 15 and 18. She is from Carles, Iloilo. She is married to a fisherman and she learned fishing to be her source of income for ten years now. 

Violeta is asking a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fishing nets. She is convinced that all her hard work will pay off in the end. She is determined to ensure that her children can go to school, so they have more options and have a better life in the future. 

Any income generated will be utilized on family consumption and school fees.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 39-year-old, married woman from Carles, Iloilo. She works side-by-side with her husband, to help support their family's needs. She has been engaged in fishing for nineteen years, now. She has five children, ages 3 to 19 years.

She is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP. She will use it to buy fishing nets, nylon, and household needs like detergent, spices, and toiletries.

Her income will be for her children's schooling and for healthy meals for her family. In the future, she dreams of successfully sending all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, nylon, and household needs like detergent, spices, and toiletries.

loans.name: Narda Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia Narda Ana Maria  se dedica al trabajo como profesora del nivel primario, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz,azucar y leche para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Narda Ana Maria works as a primary school teacher from 8am to 2pm. She wants to get ahead in life by working hard on her career and her dream is to one day own a clothing store. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase rice, sugar and milk for her home. She is happy for the loan and promises to make on-time payments.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a 43-year-old, mother of seven children, ages 2 to 18. She lives in Carles, Iloilo with her family. Her husband has been in the fishing business for a long time now. Jenny works hard in helping her husband so they can support their children in terms of food and schooling. 

She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy plywood, crude oil, kerosene, rice and fishing nets. She hopes to keep her business for a long time, and to make it more sustainable someday. She dreams of seeing her children be successful in their education in the future.

loans.use: to buy plywood, crude oil, kerosene, rice and fishing nets.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 33 years old and married. She has one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.

Josephine is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for two years, and she earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 50 years old and widowed. She has five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.

Perlita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan amount to buy more sacks of feed for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for six years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling recycled materials.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Gulnor

texts.ru: Гулнор 52-летняя женщина из сельского района Кубадиён. Она живет там с мужем и двумя детьми. Ее муж обычный рабочий. Чтобы поддерживать семью Гулнор тоже трудится. Она в 2011 году начала маленький торговый бизнес. Гулнор занимается куплей и продажей миндаля. Она оптом у себя в селе и близлежащих деревнях покупает миндаль и затем продает его по прибыльной цене на рынках района. Таким образом она вносит свой вклад в бюджет семьи. Сейчас Гулнор необходимо закупить партию миндаля, но из-за нехватки финансовых средств она не может осуществить эту цель. В связи с этим она обратилась за кредитом. Помогите Гулнор продолжить ее деятельность.
texts.en: Gulnor is a 52-year old woman from the agricultural region Qubadiyon, where she lives with her husband and two children.  Her husband is a laborer and Gulnora also works to support the family.  In 2011 she started her small retail business buying and reselling almonds.  She purchases almonds wholesale in her village and in surrounding villages, and then sells them for a profit in the markets in the region.  In this way, she is able to contribute to her family's budget.  Gultor now needs to purchase almonds, but due to insufficient financial funds, she cannot accomplish this goal.  It is for this reason that she is asking for a loan; please help Gulnor continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase and resell almonds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase potatoes, tomatoes, chicharron, cheese, cold drinks, beans etc.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has six children who are in school.

Caridad has a seaweed business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for fourteen years. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production.

In the future, Caridad would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel, a 62-year-old resident of the city of Ijevan in Lori region, is married and has a son and a daughter. His son, a very clever and respected person,  works at the college as a deputy director  Samvels’ wife, who is unemployed, takes care of their family. Samvel works as a driver,

Samvel says that he is very happy because his daughter is getting married, and he hopes that very soon he will become a grandfather. Along with the money saved by Samvel during many years, this loan will help him to organize a nice and unbelievable wedding party for his daughter.

loans.use: organize a great wedding party for his daughter

loans.name: Mahina

texts.ru: Махине всего 21 год. Она уже 4 года зарабатывает самостоятельно. Махина занимается шитьем женской одежды. Благодаря своей работе она обеспечивает себя и помогает своей семье. Она живет с мамой и двумя сестренками. Ее сестры учатся в школе. На данный момент дом Махины срочно нуждается в ремонте. Зима уже пришла, еще не поздно отремонтировать дом и оберечь семью от холодов. Махина собирала деньги, но нужной суммы не смогла собрать. Она чувствует ответственность за свою семью. Она надеется получить кредит и вскоре отремонтировать дом. Поддержите Махину.
texts.en: Mahina is only 21 years old and has been earning a living independently for 4 years. Mahina is involved in sewing women's clothing. Thanks to her work, she provides for herself and helps her family. She lives with her mother and two sisters. Her sisters attend a school. At the present time, Mahina's house needs urgent repairs. The winter has already arrived, yet it is still not too late to repair the house and keep her family from the cold. Mahina saved money, but could not come up with the required sum. She feels responsible for her family. She hopes to obtain this loan and repair her house soon. Please support Mahina.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Orzugul

texts.en:
Orzugul is a strong woman. She was born in 1971, in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is divorced. She has two children. Orzugul is working and raising her children, alone. Her business is selling shoes. She is satisfied in doing business. The demand for her products is permanent.

She needs to diversify the products, for increasing her sales. She needs to buy a new collection of shoes. The financial support will help her to realize what she has planned.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of shoes.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth is a 60-year-old proud mother of eight children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Ruth has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family. She describes her harvest as excellent last year but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

She is very excited to be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Ruth’s group will be able to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land and purchase nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Toi's Group

texts.en:
Toi, 36, is married and has three children. He is often described as a very reliable person. 

As a group leader, he is representing his group of nine farmers in Teso District in Kenya. He is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Toi's desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he will also purchase a solar light as part of his loan. This is very exciting to him, as he will now have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this year’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

In total, Toi and his group will receive nine solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant 4.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou is 43 years old, married, and a mother of five children. She lives with her family, in the town of Concepcion, Iloilo.

Marylou runs a sari-sari (retail store) business. She sells various goods and items, to the people in her place. She wants to take a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, and condiments, plus two piglets to raise. With a loan, she will be able to augment her stock, thus attracting more buyers into her store.

In the future, Marylou hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, and condiments, plus two piglets to raise.

loans.name: Lyudzheza

texts.ru: Люджеза, 62 года, замужем, 3 детей. У Люджезы средне-специальное образование, она на пенсии, более 20 лет занимается торговлей салатов, пирожков, ашлянфу. На собственном участве выращивает чеснок и кукурузу. Люджеза известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). Люджеза решила закупить скот для разведения, поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS). Часть средств она направит на развитие ее текущего торгового бизнеса. Доходы от кредита Люджеза планирует использовать для развития своей деятельности.
texts.en: Lyudzheza is 62 years old, married and has 3 children. Lyudzheza has a specialized secondary education and has been selling salads, piroshki and ashlyamfu (noodle dish) for over 20 years. She grows garlic and corn on her plot of land. Lyudzheza is known as a decent, reliable person with strong principles. Today, her business yields a monthly profit in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Lyudzheza decided to purchase livestock for fattening up and sale, and this is why she requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank. She will use some of the money to develop her current retail business. Lyudzheza plans to use the earnings from the loan to develop her business.

loans.use: to invest in her retail business and purchase livestock

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 58 years old and has five children. She is married, and one of her children is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional vegetable seeds and fertilizer. Melinda has been farming vegetables for 20 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF, to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetable seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.ru: Мафтуна молодая 33-летняя женщина, проживающая в районе Спитамен. Она замужем и имеет двух детей. Мафтуна работает в сфере услуг. Она в течение 5 лет предоставляет услуги швеи. Эту деятельность она научилась у тёти. Мафтуна работает у себя на дому и ей нравится такая деятельность. Сейчас она хотела бы купить необходимые принадлежности для шитья. Для этой цели она берет кредит. Мафтуна верит в вашу поддержку и заранее благодарит Вас за помощь.
texts.en: Maftuna is a 33-year-old young woman, living in the Spitamen district. She is married and has two children. Maftuna works in the services sector. She has been providing sewing services for 5 years. She learned this business from her aunt. Maftuna works at home and likes this business. Now she wants to purchase sewing necessities and is requesting the loan for this purpose. Maftuna believes in your support and thanks You in advance for the help.

loans.use: to buy necessities for her sewing business

loans.name: Los Puntuales De José Olaya Group

texts.es:
Sandra, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica hace años atrás a la venta de comida ubicado en su domicilio, pues fue su madre quien la motivó a tomar esa iniciativa. A raíz de su separación decide complementar otro negocio como es el de una pequeña tienda en su vivienda, con el propósito de afrontar los gastos de sus hijos y es por ellos que día a día se esfuerza mucho por darles lo mejor. Requiere del crédito para comprar una vitrina para exhibir sus galletas, chocolates y dulces (golosinas), así mismo para comprar mercadería de insumos.
Se siente muy contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad que les brinda los inversionistas kiva.
Sandra, viste una blusa de color azul.
texts.en:
Sandra is the mother of two young children. She has had a business selling food for a few years. Her business is located in her home and it was her mother who motivated her to take on this initiative. Upon her separation she decided to open another business so she has a small store in her home. The objective is to pay her children's expenses and it is for them that she puts for so much effort day after day.

She needs a loan to buy a display case to display items such as cookies, chocolates and candy, so she will also buy the merchandise to display. She is very content and thankful for the opportunity that the Kiva investors provide.

Sandra is wearing the blue blouse in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a display case and goods to display.

loans.name: Ramiro  Antonio

texts.es: Ramiro de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, el tiene un negocio de venta de tortas y hamburguesas desde hace varios años tiene muy buena clientela pues vende su comida a un buen precio su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene cubre algunos gastos de su hogar, el solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus tortas y hamburguesas como: pan, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, mortadelas, entre otros ingredientes y poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Ramiro is 39 years old and lives in his own home with his 4 children. He has had a business selling sandwiches and hamburgers for a few years. He has a very good customer base as he sells his food at a very good price. His business is located in his home. With the earnings he obtains he covers some of his household expenses. He seeks a loan to be able to buy what he needs to make his sandwiches and hamburgers such as: bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, cheese and other ingredients and thus be able to have greater earnings.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, cheese and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more construction supplies for his work.

loans.name: Maria Petronila

texts.es: Maria de 49 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, María vive junto a su esposo y su hija en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 4 años, ubicado en el mercado municipal que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, María solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor, para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 49 years old. She is a hard-working and responsible person who dedicates herself fully to her business. Maria lives with her husband and daughter in their own house. She has had a business selling fruits and vegetables for 4 years. It is located in the municipal market near her home. Maria seeks a loan to be able to buy more fruits and vegetables at wholesale in order to have better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es: Dalila una mujer de 59 años de edad desde muy joven aprendió a ganarse la vida, por lo que actualmente se dedica a la venta de productos básicos por mayor en el mercado municipal, pero además vende productos de belleza y cuidado personal obteniendo mejores ingresos. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos de 30, 20, 18 y 15 años de edad, de los cuales los mayores de edad le apoyan con los gastos de su hogar al igual que su esposo. Dalila sabe que para poder mantener un negocio es necesario invertir en él, y aprovechando que se acerca la época navideña en la cual tiene la expectativa de tener mejores ventas ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cereales, lociones, desodorante, cremas de manos, etc.
texts.en:
Dalila, 59, is a woman who learned how to earn a living from a very young age. At the moment she sells basic products in bulk at the municipal market, but she also sells beauty products and personal care products, bringing in better income.

She lives in her own house with her husband and her 4 children, who are 30, 20, 18 and 15 years old. The older ones support her with the household costs, as does her husband. Dalila knows that in order to maintain a business it is necessary to invest in it. Making the most of the fact that the Christmas period is approaching, bringing with it the prospect of increased sales, she has decided to ask FUSAI for a loan to invest in cereals, lotions, deodorants, hand creams, etc.

loans.use: to invest in: cereals, lotions, deodorants, hand creams, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy parts for household electronic appliances at wholesale.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina de 51 años de edad posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual está ubicada en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 17 años, Reina vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor, ya que de esta manera podrá darles una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Reina is 51 years old and has a business selling fruits and vegetables located in the market that is near her home. She has had this business for 17 years. Reina lives in her own home with her husband and son. She seeks a loan to be able to buy more fruits and vegetables at wholesale, as in this way she will be able to give a better life to her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves es una mujer de 22 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 2 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional cruceña.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realizan en la localidad de ‘El Torno’ una comunidad rural ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad en automóvil, caracterizada por el comercio agrícola que reúne a productores campesinos y vendedores/distribuidores de la ciudad, el clima del lugar es cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante en día entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Nieves es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por su trabajo. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y su hijo que ya sabe caminar, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional cruceña, como; Majadito (de charque, de pollo y de pato, además de plátano  y huevo frito), Locro Carretero (incluye arroz, charque y plátano, papa, cebolla verde y huevo), Pipián de Pollo (lleva presas de pollo con salsa de maní y arroz blanco), Rapi al jugo ( Es carne de res cocida y acompañada con arroz y yuca), Sopa tapada (Contiene arroz batido con carne y trozos de plátano frito), y otros. Labor que realiza de lunes a domingo para la hora de almuerzo y cena, en el patio de su casa. “empecé a cocinar cuando era muy joven, ayudándole a mi mamá, luego me independicé y ahora necesito ampliar mi negocio…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante grande y conocido por la buena comida. Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la construcción de un cuarto para atender a sus clientes bajo techo y algún día tener un restaurante. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Nieves solicita un préstamo para la construcción de un cuarto para utilizarlo como restaurante.
texts.en:
Nieves is a 22 year old woman and has a business selling traditional Santa Cruz food. She lives with her partner and has a two year old son. 

She is a good mother – hard working, independent, optimistic, happy, well-mannered and responsible. She conducts her business in ‘El Torno,’ a rural community located 45 minutes outside of the city by car characterized by its agricultural trade that brings together peasant producers and sellers/distributers from the city. The climate is hot, tropical and humid, with an average temperature that fluctuates between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade throughout the year. 

Nieves is of short stature with a brown complexion and long black hair. Her mother tongue is Guarani and speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for her work. She shares her life with her partner, who makes a living in construction, and her son, who already knows how to walk. They live in their own home made of bricks and has drinking water, electricity and sewage. 

Her business is the sale of traditional Santa Cruz food, such as: Majadito (jerky, chicken and duck, as well as plantain and fried egg), Locro Carretero (including rice, jerky and plantain, potato, green onion and egg), Chicken with Pipian sauce (chicken with peanut sauce and white rice), Rapi al jugo (cooked beef with rice and yucca), Tapada Soup (rice mixed with meat and bits of fried plantain), and others. 

She works Mondays to Sunday in her house patio for the lunch and dinner hours; she comments: “I began to cook to help out my mom when I was very young, later I became independent and now I need to grow my business…” Her dream is to have a large restaurant and gain renown for her cooking. She wants to grow her business through building a room in which to attend to her customers under a roof, and to one day have a restaurant. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the first year that she carrying out this activity independently. 

It is for these reasons that Nieves asks for a loan to build a room to use as a restaurant.

loans.use: to build a room to use as a restaurant

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: Maria de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo y su nieto, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Maria está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 54 years old. She lives in a house that she owns along with her son and grandson. Maria owns a small store that she operates in her home. She has many customers because of her low prices and her kindness. Maria is requesting this loan in order to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet breads, etc. so that she will increase her income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet breads, etc.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 33 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 11 años, y su negocio es una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, buena madre, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Palcoco’ ubicado a 40 kilómetros de la ciudad, cercana al lago Titicaca, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-12 grados centígrados.
Maria es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, su vestimenta es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio de lana de alpaca, y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa de propia construida de ladrillos y que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar, leche, fideo, arroz, refrescos, galletas, etc., en una tienda de barrio que atiende de lunes a domingo, durante todo el día. “hace 11 años que tengo esta tienda, los vecinos me conocen y son clientes constantes…” comenta. En su diario vivir ella siempre está buscando la manera de satisfacer a sus clientes, se acerca fin de año y un regalo común entre los pobladores son las frazadas para el frío; a manera de ayudar a sus seres queridos. Su sueño es tener una tienda tipo minimarket con variedad de productos. Ella desea realizar la compra de frazadas por mayor, para ofertar a los pobladores, para que las utilicen como regalos en las fiestas de fin de año. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 11 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de frazadas por mayor para que sus clientes las regalen en las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Maria is 33 years old, married, and has two children ages 14 and 11. Her business is a neighborhood store that sells basic food items.

She is a good mother, patient, a good listener, strong, enterprising, and hard-working. Her business is located in the Palcoco community, which is 40 kilometers from the city, near Lake Titicaca, in an area where the climate is cold and dry with a daytime temperature that varies between 2-12 degrees centigrade.

Maria has a dark complexion, long curly hair, she is short and dresses traditionally. Her first language is Aymara and her second is Spanish, which she uses daily and in business. She shares her life with her husband who sells alpaca wool, and with her children who attend school. They live in their own home made of brick that has potable water and electricity.

Her business is selling basic need food items such as bread, sugar, milk, noodles, rice, beverages, cookies, etc. in a neighborhood store that is open Monday through Sunday, all day long. She states, "I have had this store for 11 years. The neighbors known me and are regular customers..." in her daily life she is always looking for the way to satisfy her customers. As the end of the year approaches, a common gift between community members is a blanket for the cold - a way to help one's loved ones.

Her dream is to have a minimarket grocery store with a variety of products. With this loan she wants to buy blankets at wholesale so that her customers give them at the end-of-year parties. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in 11 years that she has had her business. It is for these reasons that Maria seeks a loan to buy blankets at wholesale so that her customers give them at the end-of-year parties.

loans.use: to buy blankets at wholesale so that her customers give them at the end-of-year parties.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 23-year-old single man, who has run his mobile phone and accessories shop since 2012.  He has four years of experience in this area, having previously worked with his brother, and decided to develop his own career path.  He is an ambitious, hardworking man, who puts so much effort into developing his business in a well managed way.

Ayman is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to start selling laptops in order to diversify his products and increase his selling, especially for the Christmas and New Year season, with special released offers.

Ayman  hopes that in the future, he can start working in wholesale trade and increase his income.

loans.use: to start selling laptops, to diversify his products and to increase his selling, especially for the Christmas and New Year season, with special released offers.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional fishing net, for her fishing business. She has been in this business for 25 years. She earns more income from culture shells.

Luisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics, including local "Wax" fabric, to retail.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more liquid and powdered soap to put in small pacages to resell to ordinary people, and to buy Muslim type of dresses called madila to resell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Ruth, a very hardworking and self-driven farmer who is based in Kiapsang, a remote village in Eldoret. This region has harsh weather patterns, and poultry farming is the only profitable business venture that thrives. Ruth is happily married and blessed with one lovely princess. 

For the past 6 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been selling milk and crop farming. She passionately loves poultry farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, her reply was “selling eggs”. Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds to increase her poultry farming. 

Ruth is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Poultry farming is the only business that thrives in the Eldoret area because of the harsh weather patterns, so she wants to take full advantage of the poultry business. Ruth is a member of Ebenezer Self-help Group and through the group, she has received training on financial management and saving. 

With the loan, she will sell eggs to the local market and to her neighbors, hence improving her living conditions and getting out of the poverty situation she is in currently. Profits from the loan will be used in repaying back the loan and increasing her business.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 56 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a direct selling personal collection in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of products to sell.

Delia has been in this business for five years.

In the future she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 38 years old. She is married, with four children aged between four and nine years, all of whom go to school. She has a shop and has been in business for 13 years. 

With the loan requested, Florence would like to buy more sugar, salt, rice, and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, rice, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Jackline, a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Kipsomba, a remote village in Eldoret. She is happily married and  has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her family, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Eldoret area is very populated, and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. 

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. 

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Asuman

texts.en:
Asuman is a hardworking man, aged 34 years, and happily married with four children. He grew up in a very humble family which had few assets, and without even school fees to educate him. He opted to work in the nearby national park as a gardener to earn a living. 

Due to his hard work, he managed to save some money and bought a piece of land in a trading centre in Mbarara District, where he put a banana plantation. This enabled him to get a living to the extent that he even managed to start constructing a house which up to now he has failed to complete. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 to finish his house. He thanks Kiva lenders for the great support and partnership.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Bett

texts.en:
Bett is a woman of experience, wisdom, and a lot of patience. She is a 32-year-old farmer from Eldoret, which is a small, rural town in Rift valley Kenya. The mother of four is interested in many farming activities. Currently, she is doing dairy farming, maize farming, and horticulture. She has put the last five years of her life into agriculture. She loves it. Her main sources of income are milk and maize. She makes extra money on the side through venturing in other personal businesses. 

She is very appreciative of the fact that farming has sustainable returns! This enables her to enjoy profits and expand. 

Bett is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow. This is aligned with her strategy to boost milk production. The demand for milk is very high in Eldoret. Bett believes the key to increased milk production is proper health. A dairy cow needs roughage and protein in her diet to be healthy. A healthy cow is more productive, and that means more income for the owner. 

The extra income will enable her to provide a better life for her family and afford her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
While many young people in Africa dream of getting well-paying jobs, Miriam, from the Eldoret area of Kenya, left her “peanuts” paying job to become a full-time small holder farmer. She decided that she will be independent and contribute to her community by practicing mixed farming.
