Miriam is married, and blessed with four lovely children who she refers to as “my heart beat.” Her primary sources of income are milk selling, poultry farming, and some personal business that she does to supplement her meager income. Deciding to practice poultry farming for Miriam was not difficult. “I was brought up with chickens raised by my grandfather and grandmother,” Miriam said. “It is in my blood.” 

For the past ten years, Miriam has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and she wants to increase her poultry, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. 

Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates a business opportunity for entrepreneurs and it’s a kind of business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. 

With your loan, Miriam is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Miriam is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net, gasoline, etc.

Cristita has been in this business for six years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
This is Pauline; she joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIH-EA) in 2011. She is 42 years old, and a mother of five children.  Three of them are in primary school and two are in secondary school.

She does vegetable farming to earn a living. She is borrowing a loan to buy fertilizer and manure. This will help improve crop yield, thus more income to cater for family needs such as clothing. 

Pauline appreciates Kiva and promises to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer that will help improve crop yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal (100 lbs) and lime.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, chicken, vegetables, tomatoes, consumes, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a fish vendor from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is 31 years old and married. She has three children. Rosie has been in the business for more than 6 years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a fisherman.

Rosie is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. With a loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus allowing her to sell more fish.

Rosie hopes to expand her business in order to generate more income. She adds that she wants to save some of her earnings to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 29 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace varios años vende en su pick up por las diferentes colonias, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Miguel is 29 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and daughter. He has been selling fruits and vegetables for several years in different neighborhoods from his pick up truck. He has many customers for his good prices. He seeks a loan to buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale in order to continue with his sales and thus have greater income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise: rice, soup, beans, tuna, flour, oil, cookies, milk, etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 41 years old. She is married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 2 children. Her spouse provides additional income for the family. 

Alice runs a textiles shop, a business she has done for the last 3 years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000.

Alice has requested her 3rd loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 70,000 which she will use to add stock of textiles especially kente design.

With the anticipated profits, Alice will be able to expand her business even further. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to become a leading wholesale provider of textiles as well as cosmetics.

loans.use: to add stock of textiles especially kente.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 56 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. Carina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Carina has been in this business for 6 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 44 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Amelia has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah lives on a hilltop in Eldoret, Kenya with her husband and their two children. From her small, but immaculately clean mud house, she can see a lush valley full of maize, tomatoes, beans, and vegetables. She can also see a bright future, thanks to the income she earns through practicing mixed farming. Dinah passionately loves dairy farming and has nicknamed one of her cows “Lelgina” (from a person’s name). Because of her immense farming knowledge, she has turned her farmland into an open university. Here, hundreds turn up to get trained in the hope that they will replicate her model on their own farmland. However, the biggest challenge she faces is satisfying the demand for milk in her village. The demand is overwhelming. She is seeking a loan to buy another dairy cow. She believes that through the loan, she will be able to improve her living conditions and be able to secure the future of her children. Having gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, she is confident that the skills she acquired will help her increase her business and she will be able to pay back the loan. Dinah is confident that if you invest in her dream you will be impacting the life of her family and children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Working in the countryside is one of the most difficult things nowadays, due to the hard work that is necessary in order to get ahead. But Priscila has not given up despite the climate or any other hurdle. She is always ready to provide for her family. 

Priscila is a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Sirikwa, a remote village in Eldoret. She is happily married and is blessed with three adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 13 years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Eldoret area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” 

Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 40,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Esther a very skilled farmer with experience in diverse areas of agriculture, with an innate talent for teamwork and with a great business mind. She is a wise farmer whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Eldoret, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. 

Esther is happily married and together with her husband, blessed with two lovely children. For the past 14 years, she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been growing maize, milk, cabbage, and tomatoes. She also keeps dairy cows. Esther has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up; “I have to do something for my family," she said. 

Esther mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Esther is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge hence suffering so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price, and through this loan Esther is going to achieve her dream and goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Esther feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help out women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Esther will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market and also, because she will increase her sales volume as she will be able to transport more goods to the market and hence increase her income level. Esther is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, Esther will improve her living conditions and assure her children and grandchildren to come of a secure future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to timely deliver her products to the market.

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
This young man is 30 years old and he lives in the frontier village Getahovit of Tavush region. Garik lives with his brother’s family. Both Garik and his brother are contractual servicemen, but they also run farming and agriculture. Garik for several years used to work in the Russian Federation doing  various constructional work. He says he likes farming more than his brother and he decided to develop it now. In his farm, he has a cow, a calf and 20 chickens. On his plot of land, he cultivates potatoes and greens. His orchard is full of nice and sweet apple trees. From his farm, he sells milk and meat and his brother's wife helps to sell the vegetables and fruits of their land. 

Garik will be thankful for this loan since with this loan amount he wants to buy 2 bulls, 2 pigs and also animal fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy 2 bulls, 2 pigs and also animal fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola es una mujer de 33 años de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos de 7, 4 y 3 años, y su negocio es la lechería.
Ella es buena madre emprendedora, sincera, generosa, comprensiva, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad ‘pampa Chilaya’ ubicada a 85 kilómetros de la ciudad, en cercanías al lago Titicaca, de clima frio y seco, con una temperatura que varía mientras transcurre el día entre 2-12 grados centígrados.
Lola es de tez morena, baja estatura, su vestimenta es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y para el comercio en la ciudad. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura y sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y los menores juegan durante todo el día. Su negocio es la lechería y producción de derivados lácteos, como; yogurt, queso, quesillo, nata, etc. Labor que realiza durante todos los días de la semana a toda hora. El ordeño de la vaca es totalmente manual y no interviene ningún tipo de máquina, el establo que tiene es amplio, donde el ganado puede movilizarse con normalidad, el frío del lugar afecta la cantidad de leche que produce cada animal, por lo que en verano la producción aumenta y en invierno disminuye. Una vez obtenida la leche; es destinada a la elaboración de algún derivado lácteo, y otras veces es vendida a vecinos productores del mismo rubro. “venimos realizando este trabajo desde que tengo uso de razón, muchas veces tenemos que trabajar la tierra y vendemos la leche a nuestro vecinos…” comenta. Su sueño es mejorar su establo para producir mayor cantidad de leche. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de ganado lechero para aumentar su producción de derivados lácteos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que realiza esta actividad en forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Lola solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero y aumentar su producción de derivados lácteos.
texts.en:
Lola is a 33 year old married woman with three children ages 7, 4, and 3. She has a dairy business.

Lola is an enterprising mother, sincere, generous, understanding, responsible, and hard-working. She works in the Chilaya pampa community located 85 kilometers from the city, near Lake Titicaca, an area with a cold and dry climate and daily temperature of 2-12 degrees centigrade.

Lola has a dark complexion, is short, and dresses traditionally. Her first language is Aymara and her second language is Spanish which she uses daily and in business in the city. She shares her life with her husband who is a farmer and her children, the oldest studies in school and the younger children play during the day. Her business is a dairy producing milk and dairy products such as yogurt, cheese, etc. She works every day of the week, at all hours. Milking the cow is totally manual and she doesn't use any machines. The stable she has is spacious, where the cattle can move with normalcy. The cold climate affects the quantity of milk that each animal produces, so production increases in the summer and decreases in winter. Once she has the milk, it is destined to make some sort of dairy product, at other times it is sold to neighbors so that they may produce products. She states, "We came to a realization that sometimes we have to farm the earth and we sell the milk to our neighbors..."

Her dream is to improve her stable in order to produce a greater amount of milk. She wishes to make an investment in her business by buying a milk cow in order to increase her production of dairy products. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 20 years that she has had this business. It is for these reasons that Lola seeks a loan to buy a milk cow and increase her production of dairy products.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow and increase her production of dairy products.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en: Iliya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Iliya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Nura and Rabilu.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Iliya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to address his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Iliya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Iliya  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms for his children thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Laurent

texts.en: Laurent is 31 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 2 and 6 years, two of whom go to school. He sells fertilizer and has been working in this business for 7 years. With the loan requested, he would like to buy more fertilizers to resell.  The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and increase his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers to resell.

loans.name: Zumratbi

texts.en:
Zumratbi was born in 1966 in the southern part of Tajikistan. She is a widow with five children. For 22 years, Zumratbi has worked as a tailor. She feeds and provides her family by herself. Zumratbi unfortunately does not have enough finances to educate her children.

Zumratbi is requesting a loan to purchase a travel ticket so that her son may go abroad to get an education. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a ticket to send her son abroad to get an education

loans.name: Junalyn

texts.en:
Junalyn is 30 years old and married with two children who are in school. For the past five years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Junalyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Junalyn is requesting a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell such as spices, eggs, bread, soft drinks, and other items. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spices, eggs, bread, soft drinks, and other items

loans.name: Ulan

texts.ru: Улан, 44 года, женат, есть 2 детей. У Улана высшее образование, уже 14 лет он занимается земледелием и животноводством. Сегодня в хозяйстве Улана есть земельный участок мерою 4,0 Га, где он выращивает клевер и есть 1 корова и 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход Улана составляет в среднем 15,000 сомов (KGS). Он очень трудолюбив и ответственен. Обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS), на который он купит скот для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита позволят Улану увеличить его хозяйство и улучшить материальное состояние его семьи и детей.
texts.en: Ulan is 44 years old, married and has two children. Ulan has a higher education. For the past 14 years, he has practiced crop farming and livestock breeding. Today, Ulan has a 4.0 hectare plot of land on which he grow clover. He also has 1 cow and 10 sheep on his farm. Ulan's average monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). He is very hardworking and responsible. He turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" for a 150,000 som (KGS) loan to buy cattle to increase the size of his herd. The income from the loan will allow Ulan to increase the size of his farm and improve the material circumstances of his family and children.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase the size of his herd.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 24-year-old Palestinian refugee who is working hard to develop his social and financial situation through acquiring his university degree. He puts so much hope on this to find a better job in his acquired domain than the one he is doing now.

Mohamad has worked in a sweets shop since 2011 and is working hard to develop his family's living; especially that in addition to his education expenses, he is the sole breadwinner for one member of his family. He has to make sure that he can cover the necessary living needs.

Today, and because his limited monthly income sometimes isn't enough to cover unexpected needs, Mohamad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his university tuition fees.

He is working hard to graduate and start work in his own domain and develop his living.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition fees.

loans.name: Begai

texts.en:
Begai is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Sociology. She is requesting a loan to pay her university tution fees. Here is her story:

“I was born and studied at school in a small village in Naryn region, Kyrgyzstan. Our region is mountainous one, where both summer and winter are cold. People of our village buy livestock and sell it when it is fat, in such way they try to earn money for living. We also have a cow, which gives much milk, what we sell and drink ourselves.

We are three people in my family: my mother, my grandmother and me. Unfortunately, both of them receive pensions due to their disability and are not able to have a full time job. I have never seen my father. We had good times with grandfather, but several years ago he passed away and we faced a lot of problems. Sometimes our relatives help us, but they can’t support us totally as they have their own family.

I studied at school with poor conditions and was so surprised when I won AUCA’s full scholarship for one-year-program at New Generation Academy. So I got familiar with AUCA, met a lot of new friends, learned English and wished to be an undergraduate student here. Now my dream came true, but I need financial aid to pay my university’s tuition fee. Thanks to Kiva loan I will be able to study at the best university in Kyrgyzstan and will be able to find good job, and support my family after graduation. If I help my family, I will save at least three people from poverty and better their life.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a young woman with the energy and disposition to face the world and get ahead. Fifteen years ago, she started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Olkinyei, a remote village in the Eldoret area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. Sally is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy.

Sally is requesting a loan to build a modern dairy. Her loan will help her have time to milk and feed her cow. A good dairy provides a good place where cows can relax and also helps to prevent diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Sally believes that, through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy. Sally waits for your kindness.

Support the project of a young, enterprising Kenyan!

loans.use: to build a modern dairy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 36 years old. He is married to Beatrice and together they have been blessed with three children ages one, five, and nine. Beatrice is unemployed and does not provide additional income for the family. For the past eight years, Charles has been an electrical mechanic. He earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

Charles is requesting a 75,000 KES loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase spare electrical parts and appliances for his business. This will be his fifth loan. He will use the anticipated profit from his loan to expand his business even further. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a happy family and to be able to provide for their basic needs as well as their secondary needs. Charles hopes to have a sustainable business.

loans.use: to purchase spare electrical parts and appliances

loans.name: Rokhilyam

texts.ru: Рохилям успешно погасила кредит по линии Кива, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день ее ежемесячная прибыль от продажи одежды составляет около 30,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)  на расширение ассортимента товара в обороте. На доходы от кредита Рохилям хочет отремонтировать ее дом.
texts.en: Rokhilyam successfully paid off her previous Kiva loan, using it for its designated purpose. She is thankful to Kiva and to all that helped her finance her loan. From the retail sale of clothes, she currently has an average monthly income of 30,000 som (KGS). She turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" for another loan. She is requesting a loan for 120,000 som (KGS) to expand the assortment of merchandise she has to offer. Rokhilyam wants to use the income from the loan to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy clothing for retail sale.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 28-year-old married father of two children and a Palestinian refugee who lives and works in a Palestinian refugee camp, since he was born. 
Due to the low social and financial situation of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, he opened a special Falafel cottage inside his house three months ago in an attempt to cover his family's needs and expenses, until he can afford to open his small restaurant outside his house and hopes outside the camp too, to attract more customers, and increase his income. 

Shadi is an ambitious hardworking man, who puts so much effort to develop his business in a well managed way. Today, Shadi is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a necessary stove requested for his business development, in addition to a necessary glass display that will help in keeping his shop separated from the outside pollution and especially the coming winter season's heavy rains.

In addition to Falafel Sandwiches, Shadi sells Lupin as side orders, and beans for the breakfast. He hopes to expand his business more in the future through moving outside his house, and to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a necessary stove requested for his business development, in addition to a necessary glass display that will help in keeping his shop separated from the outside pollution and especially the coming winter season's heavy rains

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
This is Eunice. She is 32 years old and a mother of three children. Two of her children are in primary school. Eunice is a vegetable farmer and she operates a dairy. Hand in Hand-Eastern Africa’s training has enabled her improve her skills on enterprise development, record keeping, and also financial management.

Eunice is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and dairy feed. She believes her Kiva loan will further boost her business by improving her crop yield and her milk production, thus providing a greater supply of vegetables and milk. Eunice hopes her income will increase and that she will be able to pay for her children’s school fees. She is happy for Kiva and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and dairy feed
